Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: SeaBiz10
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Hilton Hotel is comfortable, clean, and spacious. I was fortunate to stay in a Junior Executive Suite with a view of one of the famous Markt Squares. I had a refrigerator but no microwave. Breakfast was included in the price and the breakfast buffet was just great: omelletes made to order, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, all kinds of fresh breads and cheeses, and more. Service was excellent. The hors d'oeuvres served in the Executive Lounge are fantastic as is the service. The Brandenberg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Berlin Wall and other famous locations are within walking district as are shopping options. ATM right outside front door (better exchange rates at ATMs than at hotels). Gym was small and had only one treadmill, one elliptical machine, one stair climber, some dumbbells, and about 4 arm and leg machines. There was a spa that I didn't use so cannot comment on it except to say that it is a nude only sauna and steam bath facility as is customary in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BengtSweden
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and a great location at the Gendarmenmarkt. Easy access to everything. Hotel is as expected great, both in quality and service. Outstanding breakfast buffe.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Hilton Hotel Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TomMcCormick
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3nights and 4 days in the Hilton in Berlin and we have nothing but good to say about the accommodation, the service, the breakfasts and the swimming pool everything first class including the service. Really friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rachelp9
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin is fantastic. Really modern and in a great location, in walking distance from the major attractions such as Check Point Charlie. Surrounded by great bars, restaurants and shops, as well as opposite the hop on/off bus stop location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mikko H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during Easter. We had Executive Room, and servings incl breakfast were good in Lounge. Croissants could have been softer but it must have been difficult to find those during Public Holiday. To taste famous Berliner sausage, try DOM Curry next to hotel for delicious currywurst! To sum up, this Hilton was centrally located, quite modern and therefore nice to visit. Only bad side is that if you visit Hiltons a lot, they start to feel like visiting McDonalds - you know beforehand quite exactly what you are going to get. Probably time for us to try some other hotels for a while..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra W
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine a better place to stay in Berlin. It's in a great location for touring Berlin on foot. The lobby is beautiful, staff was very efficient, friendly, and spoke English very well. We booked an Executive twin and I concur with what other reviewers have said. It is well worth it to upgrade to an Executive room to take advantage of all the food and drink presentations and the free Internet in the Executive lounge. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DewsWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as part of a holiday package. Excellent all round accommodation. A very large room, complete with business desk and chair, and a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was very good with a full range of cooked and cold food and service was friendly and quick. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Break”
Reviews.Author: Fifer9
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Berlin and it won't be my last - the city is beautiful and so interesting. But this review is about the hotel. The Hiton is on the Gendarmenmarkt in the heart of what would have been East Berlin. I'm so glad we stayed here as it has a very stately feel about it and hasn't got the seedy element that exists in most Western cities. Wide pavements, open spaces, beautiful shops and cafes all around the hotel. The Hilton itself offered recently refurbished rooms, a lovely atrium and breakfast area and the Exec Lounge was great for afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapes. The concierge staff and those in the breakfast room merit a special mention for friendly attentive service. When I'm back in Berlin, I won't consider staying anywhere else as the hotel was great and the connections to transport so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location (but 5 star?)”
Reviews.Author: KfordRedSox
Reviews.Content: I'm always intrigued by what defines a 5 star rating, perhaps i expect to be carried by sedan chair to my room especially after walking into a rather grand lobby area to check in. The location cannot be faulted, the staff were effecient and friendly and you could not wish for a better breakfast, plenty of options to suit your appetite. The king size room was adequate, this is where the 5 star rating comes into question, the air conditioning control is questionable and the facilities of both the room and bathroom are no better than any average hotel, nevertheless clean and comfortable. Our room was on the second floor facing the inside courtyard so it was peaceful with not much of a view, If you want a view you are offered an upgrade on arrival of 40 euros a night ( I was offered this on line prior to travel at 20 euros a night). I suggest enjoying the view at breakfast. One slight issue when on our second morning we were told we had to sign for breakfast as it wasn't included, slightly embarrasing as we questioned this in front of other guests, it was later resolved but again, it shouldn't happen at a 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice short break”
Reviews.Author: WatfordTraveller
Reviews.Content: Husband and I tried this hotel for a short break. Very good location on the former East German side of the city, within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie. The stop for the Hop On-Hop Off bus is just around the corner. Lovely high end shops, Gucci, Louis Vuitton within short walk. Lots of local cafes (not the global brands), many with their own in-store bakery. Do try the pretezels, better than you get in New York. Tried the local speciality the Curry Wurst. There is a Curry Wurst Museum nearby. Lovely chocolate shop adjacent to the hotel with an impressive chocolate model of the Brandenburg Gate and a chocolate volcano. Plus points: Had an Executive room overlooking the Gendarmenmarkt. Good size room, very well presented bathroom. Staff were very curteous. Negatives: Husband is Hilton Honors regular and he felt that the food selection in the Executive Lounge was rather disappointing and whilst high quality, variety available was lacking, although a good range of fresh fruit was available each day. Also that bed was a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTS147
Reviews.Content: The Hilton does what it says on the tin. Great service, great facilities and close to all the attractions including the city tour buses. You're also close enough to walk to most of the major attractions. I would upgrade to an Executive room if you can to make use of the Executive Lounge which was great for breakfast, coffees and also pre dinner drinks in the evening. The hotel restaurant was very nice and the staff attentive in typical German efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, and Priced Well”
Reviews.Author: TravelWise78
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Hotel was great. The lobby greeted us we an upbeat atmosphere with a bar in the center of the lobby and a welcoming vibe. The staff were very friendly at check in. Our room was modern and very comfortable. The only reason for the four rating as opposed to five rating was because the bathroom was a bit on the small side; although common for Europe. On the other hand the bathroom was comfortably modern. The hotel was extremely clean. We didn’t take advantage of the spa unfortunately but that is a big perk that I would like to take advantage of next time. And you can’t beat the location – it is perfect! It sits right at a U-Baun (underground subway) stop, it is right in the center and easy walking distance to the main attractions, and there are plenty of nearby restaurants and bars! I would absolutely stay at the Hilton my next visit to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great Location”
Reviews.Author: VaciAVaci
Reviews.Content: Hilton Berlin is a good Hotel in a great location! You are close by to everything! It's very clean, nice and tidy. Check in goes quick and Reception staff is very friendly. Rooms have a good size and are very comfortable! The SPA area ist absolutely great! Rather rare to find in a City hotel. Only minus point is the breakfast service. Staff very unorganised and slow, misses on serving coffee or cleaning tables. The evening service in the Bar is therefore outstanding. Delicious cocktails quickly served by knowledgable staff! We had a good time! Overall it's a very good Hilton hotel which impresses with SPA and Bar!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: 1112012f
Reviews.Content: Staff were all outstanding, always helpful and courtious. Location is great for all the main sights with the subway entrance straight outside (though it was closed when I stayed due to flooding on the line but other stations are close by.) Rooms clean and beds comfortable. Breakfast is good with a great selection and very friendly staff. Hilton Gold got me free wifi and free breakfast, though no upgrade unfortunately. I would stay here again next time I visit Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good view towards Gendarmenmarkt”
Reviews.Author: jones880
Reviews.Content: Berlin has in my opinion the cheapest average rate for 5* hotels so look for other options all the time! The Hilton is at a good location at the Gendarmenmarkt (Sofitel is very close, West In Grand not far). Hotels was renovated recently so rooms are nice. Take a room with view towards Gendarmenmarkt it´s worth it! Breakfast was good but a bit overcrowded, service in the hotel reasonable but also at the check-in counter sometimes crowds and still people in the back making calls instead of going to the front and helping out. As I said, watchout for other hotels since Hilton can be overaverage expensive. Sofitel is good too and the nice hotels (Hyatt, Ritz, Marriott) at the Potsdamer Platz aren´t far as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hilton-a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ana4sc
Reviews.Content: Hilton Berlin is located in a central area and has excellent amenities. Great location in a beautiful square (Gerdarmenmarkt) very convenient for the metro (right outside the door) and an easy walk to many museums around town. We really enjoyed our 3 night stay. The staff were excellent and the rooms were really comfortable. The Hilton Berlin is a great hotel. We stay at Hiltons frequently on our travels and this is among the best. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern minimalist with luxe lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Laura7Clearwater
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my minimalist styled room with greys, blacks, and comfortable chairs. Bathroom was sparkling white with black granite counters. The lobby was a great place to hang out, couches, everywhere and typical upscale shops on the side. A bit slow on the check-in-could have used more help there. The breaskfast buffet choices where amazing. I especially liked the mini liverwurst and view out the huge windows! Located less than a mile from Brandenberg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie and the usual stops, shops and museums. Plenty of nearby restaurants. Wish I had more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: boricuajetsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Berlin for a weekend city trip and the experience was lovely. The location is perfect as it's situated right at Gendarmenmarkt, which is one of the most beautiful squares in Berlin surrounded by nice restaurants and cafes. The service was very good and the concierges were very helpul in reccomending good restaurants and things to do. I also liked the fact that the metro was only 10 meters from the hotel, making it very easy to sightsee throughout the city. The rooms very comfortable and the ammenities great. The only negative was the fact we had to pay for the internet access (9 EUR 24hr for tablet access). Besides that, we had a great experience with the hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NLJS
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, having attended a conference held in the hotel. Observations: - modern, well-appointed hotel in a nice area - room is clean and comfortable - breakfast room offers big choice - evening food is will cooked and presented - very nice Look out for: - elevators are REALLY slow - gym is "light" on equipment - hotel is a bit pricey, but this is a city centre hotel so no surprise

Reviews.Title: “Great hotle to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Hilton hotels, especially in Europe and regularly write about them, they management approach and the deliverables to guests on my blog. This is a guest review from the perspective of a guest who was extensively involved in hotel and tourism management, staying as HHonors VIP gold status. Visiting ITB in March, one of the largest travel fairs in the EU, was a Greta excuse to get back to hotel Hilton Berlin and have a taste of its new design as it was recently renovated. The things I liked about Hilton Berlin Hilton Berlin hotel The new design, the spacious room, the executive lounge team and to top it up, a minute before leaving the hotel, I was given some sweets for the road… No I don’t think this is standard procedure, it was just the nice F&B lady at the exec lounge. Welcome feeling factor: this is a factor stated by Endeavour long ago indicating the subjective feeling of the hotel guest regarding the level of being welcomed at the hotel. Hilton Berlin scores very high on that one. The full review is on: http://www.endeavour-eu.com/2011/09/hotel-hilton-berlin-review/

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: I have been to Berlin a few times but it's my first time staying at the Hilton. Pros: -Newly renovated rooms -Good location located at Gendarmenmarkt -Subway station outside the hotel Cons: -Internet costs 22 euros per day! -Sauna costs 12.5 euros! -Airport bus stops 6 blocks away, which is a bit of a walk -Room is smaller as compared to hotels in this price range -Most rooms have no view of Gendarmenmarkt. They look at residential apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an amazing City”
Reviews.Author: SteveAussie
Reviews.Content: Top Hotel. Hilton doing it right in Berlin. Staff were attentive, breakfast offering was extensive and cooked to perfection. Rooms are nicely decorated and good size. Location [tourist-wise] one of the best in the city. Highly recommended!!! Thanks Hilton Berlin for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: codash
Reviews.Content: This would be one of the better Hiltons I have stayed in, but to keep it in context, I am currently a Diamond HiltonHonors member. That said, service was excellent but unobtrusive, room comfort great and breakfast excellent. Location is good, right on the Gendarm market and close to two U-Bahn lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aberfitchfish
Reviews.Content: I was solo traveling in Berlin, and had a bad experience at a hostel and decided I needed to check into a hotel for some comfort, since I was feeling a bit homesick. This was a great hotel. I felt comfortable in a nice executive room with a king size bed. The shower, bathrooms, and everything were great. The location is AMAZING for site seeing, and there is a U Bahn stop right outside the hotel. I would definitely recommend staying at the Hilton Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Blueduncan
Reviews.Content: Lovely room...excellent friendly staff, location is perfect..underground 50yds away.......and the best breakfast ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tina1606
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Berlin for 3 days at the end of February. was attending a conference on site. The rooms are spacious,clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel is well located with shops within walking distance. However on Saturday night there was a little bit of noise,probably coming from a nearby nightclub. Heard some of the conference-goers complaining about the Wifi. the speed, the price. There are loads of Arab channels! Else cannot complain much. The breakfast buffet has an extensive choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: macarne
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I am big fan of the hilton branch. And I have to say that the Hilton Berlin is one of the best hilton hotels I ever stayed. The rooms in the executive floor are awesome and the city location is great. Also the staff is brilliant. In the last 3 month I stay 3 times there get every time an update and get a warm welcome from the executive lounge crew. The rooms are bright and clean and also I love the little rubber dugs you get every time you stay ;) The breakfast and the snacks are served in the executive lounge are from a high standard as well as the in room meals like the Hilton burger. In front of the hotel you find the a subway station and also the Brandenburger gate is very near. My office is located just a few steps away so there is no better place in Berlin for me. Just have to say thanks!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: ArneOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: I am a great fan of this Hilton. I use to stay there once in a while. The service is smiling and effective, the lobby is attractive and very suitable for a pre-dinner drink, and the concierge is very helpful and knowledgeable of the city. And best of all, the location is unbeatable. The Hilton stands at the southern end of the wonderful Gendarmenmarkt, there is an U-Bahn-station virtually by the entrance, and many of Berlin's best restaurants are close. Of course, this is not a hotel for those who want a secluded, romantic inn to celebrate their honeymoon, but that's not why you choose a Hilton anyway, is it? One negative note: the room was excessively hot this time (in March), and the air conditioning was not sufficiently effective. Had to open the windows to the sometimes noisy Mohrenstrasse at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Pestus
Reviews.Content: All I can say is very good – bordering on excellent. My wife and I visited the Hilton Berlin between Christmas and New Year in December 2011. When booking we paid the small upgrade for the Exec room, and what a great deal it was for the leisure traveller. The Exec Room initially gives you check-in (and out) via the Exec Lounge saving time at the desk. The room itself was very comfortable. It was clean, modern, well equipped, and had had everything we needed. The rooms also came with access to the Exec lounge, which had recently opened and had great facilities. With charges for drinks and food (outside of the lounge) typically carrying the Hilton ‘premium’, the lounge was great value for snacks (hot and cold), and well as drinks (including alcohol). The hotel location couldn’t be better for sightseeing, with a Christmas Market over the road, and was very central for most of the sights we wanted to see. The only negatives were 20+ Euro for 24 hours of Wireless (which is quite frankly, robbery), and poor service from the lady handling our check-out in the Exec Lounge. She kept us waiting for over 5 minutes whilst she chatted on the phone without even acknowledging us. Don’t let this put you off though, as this is the best city break hotel (for location and facilities) we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Location, standard and service”
Reviews.Author: danielwebster
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small as many have pointed out but they are well organized and big enough if you are traveling alone. For couples I would suggest a bit small but workable. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Very well maintained rooms. In my view and as some others have suggested, this is really a 4 star hotel. It is not luxurious in any way but for a city hotel it is more than adequate. The location can not be beat. For more interesting restaurants venture to other neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “berlin was grey hotel made it blue”
Reviews.Author: macdick
Reviews.Content: we had 4 day break in february very cold but hotel was warm and welcome, I can not fault this hotel, it was all we wanted nice room lovely bathroom, peaceful, close to everything, and breakfast was fantastic. Very happy with this hotel. All staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic weekend stay here and I cannot fault anything, bar possibly the outrageous wifi charges that these types of hotels think is reasonable to charge- about €25 per day?! The hotel is chic modern and well furnished throughout- both in communal areas and the rooms. The room was well proportioned and clean, with an understated luxury feel- not opulent, but elegant. Breakfast was amazing, with a fair mix of traditional German and standard "international hotel" fare of bacon, eggs, pastries etc... Always nice to have an egg station, where a chef will whip up an omlette on demand. The location was excellent, slap bang in the centre, near to pretty much every main attraction and with a metro station by the door. Staff were friendly and helpful. In short, highly recommended and we will be back the next time we are in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-snoop-Belfast
Reviews.Content: We had a faultless stay in this Hotel. It is perfectly located, luxuriously appointed, and very well kept. It has had a makeover in recent years and feels as clean as it indeed should be! Like other posters, as HH Gold benefited from lounge access - this is an impeccable lounge which is beautifully set out and has great breakfast and evening Hors d'Oeuvres. Bed really comfortable and room really quiet. At the kind of rates available, it represents excellent value and I will not hesitate to return when I'm next in Berlin. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “poor wayfinding”
Reviews.Author: Don D
Reviews.Content: It's really hard to find your room - very long corridors. Make reservation for the restaurant well before. Checking in is a little bit long... You can clean your shoes only on your floor... and nowhere else. If you speak louder in the business room, you get a call from the business center reception that you're too loud.

Reviews.Title: “another fantastic stay , this time between Christmas and New Year”
Reviews.Author: jan-remi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time this year at the Hilton in Berlin Gendarmenmarkt-1 week- and once again this was a wonderfull experience ! As HH diamond we had access to the ELwhich is one of the best in Europe IMHO! The entire EL staff is led by a wonderfull lady ,a very professional young manager who makes it a point of honour with her entire staff to get to know the wishes of all guests as fast as possible making each stay at this hotel another special experience. Breakfastbuffet in the restaurant is very nice but very crowded while the breakfastbuffet in the EL has almost all the same choices but the morningstaff in the EL working the breakfastservice has everything so well under control that all tables are constantly cleared and all choices are refilled before anything runs out... During the day the choices in the EL are some sweets and coffee but it is still a nice place to relax after visiting the beautifull area around the hotel and enjoying all great shops such as" franconia" on friedrichstrasse ;the fitness is also great and very clean ; the pool gets a bit crowded sometimes but if you have he time a lomilomi massage is a must do experience so we usually splurge on a 95 minutes delightful experience... Eveningservice in the EL is great with soup, sandwiches, cheeseplate and 2 hot choices which changes every night so even during our 6 or 7 day stays we rarely get the same hot choices twice making this a fantasticexec. lounge and certainly one of the best you can enjoy in Europe leaving US Hilton EL far, far behind as even the sparkling wines, beer and other alcoholic drinks are free and all guests pour their own shots so it is easy to see several bottles of good quality booze getting emptied AND replaced by a new one on a short evening ;). If you are HH gold or diamond it really pays of to contact the hotel if you do not get a mail from them a few weeks before arrival and let them know your ETA and wishes ... We for onecan't ait to get back to this hotle for our next stay and having had to stay a few times in other holes in Berlin I for one prefer this place to a lot of other similar priced hotels and this before you even had time to walk aroudn Gendarmenmarkt and all beautifully restored museums "unter den linden " which is a short walk away !

Reviews.Title: “Modern furnishings but service is poor and unreliable.”
Reviews.Author: sl3854
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the Gendarmenmarkt, and one can walk to many major sights. the rooms have modern furninishings, although the carpet had a strong chemical smell. The hallways were a bit drab. But the poor service seems to premeate the whole hotel. The check in process is sloww and the staff allow multiple lines to form and other people to jump the queue. Calling gues services from the room is frustrating as the phone goes unanswered often. Signing up for internet access requires signing a form every 24 hours, and means either going to lobby or having someone sent up to room with paperwork (who forgot to show up for 45 minutes). Even the room cleaning is sloppy, with used glasses and spoon not changed, used coffee packets replaced with only decaffeinated packets and no regular coffee, complimentary water only on first day. Overall like a hotel trading on its location and making you feel unwelcome. will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice renovated room”
Reviews.Author: OF665
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my spouse at the Berlin Hilton for a weekend. The location is very nice for tourists and if you have a view to the Gendarmenmarkt you will love it. The room was very nice renovated but the bathroom are still the same and old, As a a gold vip member the internet and breakfast are complementary which are in other hotels anyway included. At the front desk at arrival they argued with me about the upgrade to an executive room and didn't gave it to me even they had free executive rooms. They told me that the policy at Hilton changed and they not obliged to give one. Very interesting is that i spoke with Hilton Hotline before I booked the room and they told me that if there is one room available they will upgrade me. So this was very disappointing since i could not use the lounge. They don't want to understand that frequent traveler looking for this goodies and have many choices for hotels. so next time i will choose another hotel instead. their lost The breakfast was good but as I know it from past stays I felt that the quality went down. I used the Garage of the Hotel for additional 20 Euro per day. Summery: They have a good product but know very well how to disappoint their valued customer. As there are much better Hotels in the city they should make a much bigger effort to hold the customers on the long run.

Reviews.Title: “Average no free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: JeddaCath
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in Feb on business. There was a meeting in the hotel and about 200 attendees were booked in the hotel by the company. Room: Basic what is to be expected at this level, nothing beyond. The room was small and faced the inner courtyard so it was quiet. Except on Saturday night when the loud music from the nightclub had the room lightly booming till 6 am. Iron, coffee-maker but no envolopes (first time needed one). English TV channels are the basic CNN, BBC, CNBC, Sky plus 2 ITV channels. There are more Arabic channels than English channels Bathroom: very small. If I spread my arms I would touch all 4 walls. With a full sized bath tub it was really cramped. Happy with the central location and U-Bahn station right outside (U2/U6). Walking distance to many locations including Potsdamer Platz and Sony Cinema. Conceirge was helpful with basic directions. Unhappy with the fact that there is no free internet either in room or in the lobby. This is now more important than the TV in the room. I could care less for a TV as long there is good (or even slow) free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Well, the name Hilton speaks for its quality!”
Reviews.Author: Patersoneditha
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hilton Hotel because Estrel Hotel was booked for 2 days before the start of the World Coin fair in February 2012. It was a real blessing in disguised. Hilton was an excellent hotel; the service, the location (excellent), the rooms, etc. I really couldn't say more since the name Hilton speaks well for its quality. Congratulations, guys. You made my stay in Berlin colorful despite of the gray winter I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: jgallag
Reviews.Content: You are very close (~ few blocks) to check point Charlie, ~ 10 minutes walk to the Brandenburger Gate/Tor, and 3 more minutes to the Reichstag (Parliament building). There is a metro (Stadtmitte) right out front of the hotel. The transit system is great!! Next to the hotel is a large chocolate shop for you or potential gifts to take home. If you can (when you book your room or upgrades with gold/diamond), get into an executive room with privileges to the executive lounge. It was just re-done and looks great! Free water and drinks throughout the day with all kinds of coffee and hot chocolate as well as alcohol at night. The "presentations" are great. The people at the hotel speak english, but remember you are in Germany. The pool at the hotel is great!! The hotel is simply centrally-located to everything. Get a taxi from the airport and back, but public transit the rest of the time is relatively cheap and easy. Questions, email me.

Reviews.Title: “Bland with expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: HP14
Reviews.Content: Outside is the spectacular Gendarmenmarkt. Inside it could be Houston, Memphis or anywhere unremarkable. The rate seemed reasonable but it excluded breakfast – which at €27 extra was excessively costly, also excluded were the overpriced internet access and even access to the sauna – only the tiny pool was free. Not sure about the minibar pricing – but pick something up and you’ll find out as you’ll be automatically charged (per a small sticker inside the fridge but not on the front of the door) by lifting the item. Rooms have been refurbished and are very comfortable, if rather compact (showing that you are not in Houston or anywhere in the US!). After booking an e-mail came though offering various room upgrades – mostly unnecessary but the view of the Gendarmenmarkt was well worth the extra €13 a night – despite hardly ever being there too see it. It was a good way to start and end the day. There are far more rooms without the view so if you want it don’t take a chance and hope you'll get a room with a view. Location next to stadt mitte u bahn is also egreat - it took less than an hour from landing at tegel to get to my room at the hotel, using bus and underground - easy to walk to the sights of mitte, museum isalnd and potsdam platz, though with limited dining options in the evening. It’s OK but I would never stay there again. The Hampton Inn in west central had better staff, included breakfast, there were free computers in the hall and while the rooms were more simply furnished and smaller they were still comfortable and the far smaller price made the whole experience far more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 2BReisen
Reviews.Content: A real gem, best Hilton experience! Recommend upgrading to Executive level as the lounge and staff make this a super value.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Hilton Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: BearsdenTowers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Berlin Hilton for a Birthday weekend Dec 2011. Hotel was beautifully decorated for Xmas and as one of the main Xmas markets is on your doorstep it is an instant Winter Wonderland. Bedrooms were well appointed with our rooms looking into a quiet courtyard providing peace and tranquillity if required. Breakfast was a grand feast set in a busy but efficient atmosphere. Go early and grab a window seat and watch this part of Berlin waking up. The Hotels atrium area hosts a well stocked bar, brill cocktails, comfortable seating areas, a coffee bar during the day and live piano/jazz music at night. Typical Hilton Prices but top end Hilton surroundings. I have recommend this hotel to many friends since our return. its location is perfect, you can walk to lots of different places easily. Get out on a Sunday morning and you can walk to the riverside to the church bells ringing, plenty of coffee houses nearby, and don’t miss visiting the chocolate shop on the corner......one of the best I have come across. Berlin's nightlife is huge and varied, even in sub zero temperatures people are outside drinking and eating in the late night markets. December is a fab time to go ***** 5 stars from all my party.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_H687
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin to take in the sights and go to the Christmas markets. The Berlin Hilton was incredible. Great service and attention. And to top it of there is a great Christmas market right across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back...not good service for the price”
Reviews.Author: gaviota77
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the Hilton Berlin (Mitte). Great location, but Im not returning. Why? 1. Had to ask for a working internet access code more than two times... first time got an access code that had already been used by someone else. After trying to connect for an hour not knwong the issue), went down to the front desk to ask for another code. After a few minutes of waiting I got a second access code with the assurance it would work. Same thing happened again... went down again and finally got a working code. 2. Do not stay at room 7019...the window doesnt close compeltely... looks like housekeeping doesnt checks for these details... I managed by pushing up the heating up. 3. Toiletries were not replaced daily...the note pad in the room had just one sheet of paper...looked like the hotel is trying to cut costs... could be done more elegantly 4. One day saw a half bitten apple left in an elevator (probably by a kid)... an hour later the apple was still there... not what you would expect from a supposedly 5 start hotel 5. Finally, upon check out I presented my Hilton Honors memebership card. the answer from the lady at the frontdesk: "you should have shown your card when checking in...plus looks like an internet site paid for your stay..so not sure you will get the points..." upon explaining I made the reservation via a web site the lady told me "we will try to see what we can do"...scribbling down my room number on a piece of paper ...Im not hopeful. When I asked how can I give formal feedback the repply was "you should have used the format in your room"...and not even asked what I wanted to complain about. Definetly not stellar service...to say the least

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BaldwinNL
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin is located on one of the most beautiful squares and central locations of Berlin in an impressive building. But for some reason the Hilton does not match the location with atmosphere, service and quality. The lobby has some sort of a American impersonal McDonalds atmosphere, the staff has a plastic smile, if they smile at all, and the rooms are very small. All in all not it does not deserve a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “You have to pay for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte-Rose86
Reviews.Content: The hotel its self was clean, luxurious, the rooms were comfortable etc... everything you'd expect from a 5* hotel. Except that you have to pay for everything! No complementary water in the room, pay for room service, pool advertised as heated but it was cold, you have to pay for use of the spa (steam room) 12 Euros per person, pay for Wifi, pay for computer and printing. Just not the usual 5* hotel customer service you'd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but still a standard Hilton”
Reviews.Author: 12Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at the famous Gendarmenmart is completely refurbished, but lacks personality compared to other Berlin Hotels like the Ritz Carlton or the Westin nearby. The rooms are pretty standard in size and style, bathrooms are rather 4 star than 5 star. Check-in took nearly 15 minutes, eventhough I was the only guest here at the front desk as they had diviculties to retrieve my Hilton Honor number in their systems, so they kept me waiting. All in all, ok standards, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A standard business hotel without surprises”
Reviews.Author: TuulaV
Reviews.Content: Hilton Berlin is similar to any other sterile 4-5 star business hotel. You'll step in the same huge lobby, meet the same well-trained and groomed staff, sleep in the same quiet clean room, and eat the same a bit over-priced standard buffet breakfast. It's a basic and safe choice for those who don't like surprises in good or bad, and who want to overnight close to some of the major historical attractions of Berlin. It is probably NOT an ideal choice for those who like hotels with a personal touch or want to spend their Berlin holidays closer to diverse restaurants, bars, shopping possibilities, and local buzz.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great City”
Reviews.Author: Beans04
Reviews.Content: I can't really fault the HIlton Berlin, it was located in a great place, close to many places to eat... Beds are great ad staff where fantastic... Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: this hotel ticks all the boxes great location clean friendly staff nice bar area and a lovely breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Class in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Lucas4
Reviews.Content: The Hilton's location is very good: Walking distance to shopping streets and major attractions. Service was impeccable. The hotel is clean and efficiently run, as one would expect from the Hilton. As Diamond members, we enjoyed an upgraded (very quiet) room at the Executive level and the privilege of the Executive Lounge, adjacent to the lobby, which served wonderful food throughout the day by an attentive and friendly staff. All in all, this is a great deal and we would highly recommend the Berlin Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: whirlwindnyc
Reviews.Content: After much research on where to stay in Berlin for my recent 4 night winter getaway, I selected the Hilton. The primary reason was the excellent location right on the Gendarmenmarkt, probably the most picturesque square. Here's what I liked about the hotel. It's conveniently located in a fairly quiet neighborhood, directly across from the Deutsche Dom and within a 10 to 15 minute walk to most of Berlins historical and cultural attractions. There is plenty of mid to high range shopping and a variety of restaurants for every pocket book and taste in the area. Directly outside the main entrance is the Stadmitte U-Bahn station for the U2 line which can conveniently take you to most other Berlins neighborhoods. The rooms were fairly standard in size compared to other properties and those on the front of the hotel offer spectacular views of the Deutsche Dom. The breakfast buffet they offer is extensive, varied and very filling and delicious. Here's what I found not so good about the hotel. The bathrooms were on the small size with a tub along with a hand held shower that didn't provide much water pressure and the toiletries were of minimal size as well. They charge 22.00 euro for WiFi or internet access. They also charge 12.50 euro for access to the Wellness area in their health club, while pool access is complimentary. I would consider the hotel a very good first class property, not a deluxe one. The reason is mainly due to the service provided by the hotel staff. For the most part, it was polite and efficient, but you had to ask them. To me, a deluxe property has staff that anticipate a clients needs and goes out of their way to provide assistance and service. Overall, The Hilton is a very clean, modern, comfortable hotel with good amenities and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: speckledjim
Reviews.Content: Great location (next door to the biggest chocolate shop you are likely to see), rooms were big and very clean (modern). Very close to U Bahn too so easy to get to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good, Well Located Hotel With A Heavenly Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: parkp
Reviews.Content: I booked well in advance and got a great room rate with breakfast for this hotel from Expedia and we stayed for five nights at the start of January. Being an experienced traveller, I came prepared with a print-out of my Expedia receipt. When we checked in and I asked about breakfast, without batting an eyelid the clerk immediately replied, "It's not in the room rate." I triumphantly whipped out my printed receipt, showed her and she had to relent! It didn't make me feel especially welcome, and I felt that at worst one or two of the clerks lauded the hotel's luxury reputation in a slightly intimidating way. Don't let that put you off, however: this is a really good, well located hotel with a heavenly breakfast. The room was a good quality standard business-like arrangement: warn, clean, quiet, secure with decent facilities, even if the colour scheme was rather muted. Happily, unlike many continental hotels, they have tea-making facilities in the rooms. On the down side, the room internet is cable-based and not WIFI; I think they have it but charge extra. Also make sure that you read the bottom of the back of the mini-bar menu before you use the mini-bar itself. It explains that if you open the door and toy with anything in there for a few seconds like a coke can or chocolate bar, the item will be charged to your hotel bill - whether you consume it or not... Is this computerized efficiency gone mad? Unfortunately our room was also rather dry and we had to keep drinking juice and water. When we found the busy breakfast room - on the first floor - the choice was absolutely fabulous with good quality food including smoked salmon, fresh watermelon juice and classy gauze tea bags (!). It was self-service but really excellent, attentive staff were on hand. Only on the last day did we have a problem, as our rather formal check-in clerk had not put our room number on the list (again I was again told, "It's not in the room rate"). Nevertheless I have to say that the breakfast remains a total stand-out. The hotel is ideally located, right on the Stadtmitte U-bahn station, next to some lovely old buildings and luxurious shopping opportunities. My girlfriend tried the spa and said to watch out for the mixed nude sauna, as staff were not always on hand to explain things! All in all this is an excellent business class type hotel that hovers somewhere between four and five stars. We would go again and recommend it to anyone travelling to Berlin - just remember to print out your receipt if you get a good online rate.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast ever-Hilton Gendarmenmarkt”
Reviews.Author: Vikenboet
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at Hilton and it was super! Nice rooms, nice staff and a lobby big as a football pitch, but still cosy with a nice bar in the middle. It feltid pure luxury. When we got to the hotel (by taxi) the staff took care of our bagage and brought it to our rooms, we did´nt do anything. But now to the best part: Breakfast. It was enormeus and they have everything you can wich for, from Belgium Waffles to German Curry Sausage and on saturday/sunday you could swallow it down with Champagne, I tell you... it was Grand!! This hotel was NOT so expensive as it lookt like, we found it on Internet and payed 850 Euros for four nights/four persons, incl. breakfast. Thats Good! Best Regards Olle and Karen in Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Not home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Maccaroo
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, unfortunately the Hilton Berlin was not able to accommodate my request to place an additional bed for my daughter in the room. The excuse was that all of their rooms were "too small". After having been guest in 5 other Hilton properties on this recent trip across Europe, this was the only property unwilling to help with such a simple request. I also would like to report the unprofessional attitude of the Hilton Berlin's bellhop, who chose to let my wife and daughter stand in the entrance area of the hotel in very cold weather, just to favor a customer who drove up after us, but in a 7series BMW. This is the first time I have to express my dissatisfaction with the Hilton brand, and it is particularly unpleasant experience, since I wanted to impress my family with a stay at a top hotel in my hometown Berlin. The opulent appearance of the Hilton, unfortunately didn't live up to the promise of enjoying a nice 3 day stay. I cancelled my reservation and stayed at the Hampton Inn at the Ku-Damm instead, where the professional staff availed us a very nice stay for a small fraction of the Hilton room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: smikolay
Reviews.Content: A great weekend visit to see the Christmas markets. The location is ideal, with one of the best markets on its door step. The staff were generally friendly - although at times came across a bit curt (especially when asking about HHonors privelages). The rooms were on the smaller side, but have been recently redone and were clean and new feeling. The bed was comfy. The gym was very nice, with an adjacent pool.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: maudtie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Berlin over Christmas and had a great time. Location is great, at Gendarmenmarkt (there was a Christmas market now). U-bahn close by and in walking distance of Unter den Linden, Brandenburger Tor and Alexanderplatz. Room was nice, bit somber colours though. That was also in the corridors, didn't feel very fresh. Breakfast was very good. Friendly staff overall. Would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond staff”
Reviews.Author: music_gal22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Berlin on a Globus Tour. While the hotel and rooms were wonderful, I feel I must comment on the staff here. My mother unfortunately had a medical emergency while here (she is fine) and the staff went out of their way to be helpful to us. We had to miss our tour's departure and the hotel held our room until we felt that is was safe for my mom to travel. The hotel also arraged our train tickets and even went to the rail station to pick them up for us and bring them back to the hotel. They also arranged for a taxi to take us to the station and the driver to personally escort us to the platform. This staff went above the call of duty when we really needed them. Words can't express how grateful we are that a hotel went to these lengths for a couple of tourists. If our travels bring us to Berlin again, we most definetely will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel website doesn't do it justice”
Reviews.Author: Jetscot
Reviews.Content: We extended our trip to the Christmas markets and decided to try out the Hilton hotel. It is very near all the shops in Friedrichstrasse and is probably the best Hilton we have stayed in. It has a beautiful reception area and a large bar across from the entrance. The swimming pool is lovely and for a small extra charge you can access the sauna and steam rooms. There are some shops in the foyer and a large German restaurant. Food is also available at the bar. One of the best Christmas markets is on the square beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Wanderkid
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with a recent stay at the Hilton. During December it is across the street from the Gendarmenmarket ( One of the major Christmas markets located here)and U bahn right outside the front door. It is a very convenient location, wonderful buffet breakfast and overall a very comfortable hotel. Welcoming staff at the front desk, which sometimes can be extremely busy, but all spoke english. I would recommend a visit to Museum Island...lots of great museums but I felt the best was the Neues Museum..don't miss the 3000 year old bust of Nefertiti and the Pergamon Museum with the Ishtar gates and Pergamon Altar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sarahdd0201
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very smart appearance. Nice cocktail bar in the hotel lobby. Staff are friendly and helpful. Can't fault the room and the bathroom. Bed was extremely comfy! Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries were provided in the bathroom. One of my favourite things about staying here was the awesome breakfast....every kind of breakfast food you could imagine....and fantastic service! The location is also perfect! There is an underground station right outside the front entrance to the hotel, and if you're going around Christmas time then it's a great place to stay as one of the best Christmas markets in Berlin is just across the road from the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but rather expensive.”
Reviews.Author: 72Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent central location, but every additional feature turned out to be very pricy, i.e. the price of wireless internet, breakfast etc. Will look for a better output for my money in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DHJUK
Reviews.Content: A typical Hilton with all the standard business features with the added benefit of being in a great location. If its the Christmas markets you want then this is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AddAdrTA
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms and stayed 2 nites. The rooms were nice, comfortable and with a correct size. The furnitures were modern and ok. The bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom however was a bit disapointing and not really at a Hilton's standard (at least at the standard I would expect from an Hilton hotel): Was small and a bit old. The joints between the protecting glasses of the shower were very old and missing on two third of the length. I specifically did not like: - The cosmetic products not being sufficient (e.g. only one shower gel for 2 persons ... very cheap from a Luxury hotel!) - The internet access being charged (and in addition very expensive) The breakfast was excellent: A lot of choice and quality items The location is simply fabulous. Near everything and in a superb area. Overall this stay was great. I would recommend it without problems assuming you can manage to find an interesting price ... otherwise, I may not be that enthousiastic as there are many other very nice hotels in Berlin at the regular Hilton's prices

Reviews.Title: “Good location with a nice lobby bar & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: H2where
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, the rooms are good sized, the bar very welcoming with a fireplace. There's an ample breakfast buffet that's reasonably priced. The rooms are good sized with a nice desk for working, and nice toiletries are provided in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kauaidudette
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference and the hotel services and rooms were excellent. My room was spacious and had a gorgeous view of the nearby old churches. The location is excellent. Not far from the old Checkpoint Charlie station, you can walk to many sights and the subway system is close by. Be sure to purchase the room plan that includes breakfast. It was very good value with a great array of choices. While the hotel restaurant prices were high, I found that the hotel is about 4 blocks from a major shopping colonnade which has an excellent food court and local restaurants. I ended up eating several dinners and getting take out meals as well. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but certainly not a 5 star Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: The_Sisko
Reviews.Content: Positive things about this hotel: Very stylish and nice lobby lounge, perfect executive lounge for meetings, good location and the rates are often OK. Unfortunately the service on this hotel is not Hilton-standard. First time I was there I needed something to eat at 05:30 AM (was up preparing a meeting) - I called room service but they just said "The chefs are preparing the breakfast right now so we can´t help you". This despite that they claim to have 24/7 room service. The next day they apologized and gave me discount on my previous room service orders. A few weeks later I gave the hotel a new shot (chasing my honors diamond status for 2012), this time I arrived on a Sunday and I needed help washing my suite for a meeting the next afternoon. I called housekeeping… and got the answer “We do not do laundry on Sundays so we can´t help you”. Maybe for people who do not travel frequently on business this sounds OK, but for me who depends on good service to cope with my schedule – this is a disaster. I choose Hilton and 5 star hotels just to get this kind of service. I this is the first time I run into a 5 star Hilton that do not offer laundry on weekends. Other things worth mentioning: The pool area is just average (no whirlpool for example) and the standard rooms and executive rooms are small for Hilton-standards (It´s OK if you upgrade to a Studio). To summarize, I do not get how this hotel can have 5 stars, its maximum a 4 star hotel. It’s not bad in any way, but compared to other 5 star Hiltons (I can mention for example Copenhagen, Warsaw and Prague) it’s not playing in the same league. If you, as I do, expect top notch from Hilton hotels, I´m afraid you might be disappointed if choosing Hilton Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “it comes with a price tag”
Reviews.Author: trips365
Reviews.Content: In October, we made a trip to Germany for 2 weeks, making Berlin our base. Each time when we would come back, we always chose a different hotel – we ended up staying in 3 hotels: Hilton Berlin on Gendarmenmarkt, Leonardo Royal Hotel Berlin and PLUS Hotel Berlin. I will post reviews of each hotel separately. This one is about Hilton Berlin. If you care about the location and your trips is centered around trips to the Museumsinsel, Reichstag, memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe or Gemäldegalerie (not much further), then this place is for you. It is so centrally located to all those sites that you would not need to use any transportation. First positive (aside from the location). The view is spectacular. If you’re paying for breakfast, try to wake up as early as possible and get a table right by the window – you will be looking at the Berliner Dom. Our room was great, very spacious with a nice size bathroom. If you want to stay in this hotel, try to reserve through the hotel website and request a room overlooking the square. We had a view of the building across the road, nothing special. The gym (included) is nice and unlike many European hotel gyms, it has free weights. The hotel’s second level (called bel-etage) has a nice bar, with live piano at night – it was great to sit there and have a drink while listening to the music. The stuff is great. There is a restaurant on premises, but we haven’t tried it. Now negative. Being in the prime location, it can be very expensive. Basically everything in the hotel comes at additional cost. The breakfast is 28 Euro; (though it was very good). The internet was not free and very expensive (22-26 euro, depending on how you intend to use it). The gym was free (and open 24 hrs) but in order to use sauna/steam room you have to pay. The pool (no extra charge) was cold every time we tried to use it. They have a lot of meetings and conferences a this Hilton and sometimes, during the day you might get a feeling in the lobby that you are at a conference center, with all the signs and print outs. We would stay there again only if we can get it at a low price; otherwise, we will look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: retireeurope
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine hotel. All of the staff were very friendly and courteous. The location is the best it could possibly be, all the best sites are close and easy to get to. You can get to the hotel from the HBF train station by S-bahn and U-bahn. You only need the short trip ticket (1.40 Euro's for use for 3 stops or less) to get from the HBF train station to the hotel.There is a U-bahn entrance 30 yards outside the Hilton's door. It is on line 6 and to get to the entrance/exit from the INSIDE of the line 6 U-bahn you go the exit OPPOSITE Mohrenstrasse street (look for signs in the U-bahn station 6) The short trip ticket will also take you to many of the best sites in Berlin if you plan well. The Breakfast Restaurant and the Executive lounge have some of the sweetest young Ladies on the planet working there. They do everything to make you feel welcome and give great service. The Breakfast buffet is very nice and has a great selection. Interestingly enough they do not understand how to make an American style Omelet, however what they make is tasty. The hors d'oeuvres in the Executive lounge are as good as any lounge we have been in, and the soup (that changes every night) is AWESOME. My wife wanted the recipe of one of the soups and the sweet young Lady (Juliana) who was serving us went back and ask the chef. He was kind enough to write down the ingredients for her. This lounge has a very pleasant atmosphere. The room we had was an Executive room and is a little small by comparison, however in general well designed. The room was completely fine in our opinion and cleaned very well every day. The previous complaints about the desk can be solve by taking the chair out from behind it and pushing the desk to the wall (it will move) then put the chair on the outside.The complaint about the closet door is legitimate, why they did not put a sliding door on it is a mystery. The only real disappointment (and this is really reaching to find something to complain about) had to do with the concierge, however I found out latter it was due to a personnel issue. I went to the concierge to ask some questions about the U-bahn. I had already looked up on line and had some knowledge of it. The person at the desk gave me the biggest line of S*** imaginable. I found out latter I was talking to one of the bell Boys playing concierge. If I had listen to him our trip would have been impacted. I latter saw they have several real concierge's that speak intelligently. So not a issue.(as long as you do not get a bell boy) We will definitely stay here again, a very nice hotel at a fair price. We stayed at the Berlin Hilton from Nov. 27 to Dec. 2, 2011 I congratulate the hotel Management at all levels, it is not easy to run a large hotel this well. John & Marilyn, Owasso, Ok. Retireeurope.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best locations in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PTJD01
Reviews.Content: 3rd trip to Berlin but my first stay at the Hilton Berlin. In general a standard Hilton in Europe. The location is outstanding! Right across from the Gendarmenmarkt, close to most landmarks, many restaurants around and the U bahn. Rooms were clean and updated, a little on the small side, The bathroom was definitely small. The executive lounge was very large and served the usual fair but was on the first floor and inconvenient. Wines and adult beverages not served till 6:00pm. Also since this is a very large hotel the elevators can get rather backed up, if you are on the executive floor take the direct elevator to the spa and it will take you to the Mezz level. Service was very good, would return to this Hilton when I am back in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daspot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located. However my stay could have been nicer. My room was freezing cold. It was on the 8 floor under the rooftop. The heating wasn't working. After calling the reception they came to fix it. Even though the heating seemd to work again the room stayed cold - also 2 days later. The room itself was very tiny, but well equiped.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: easyman1979
Reviews.Content: Its a grand hotel. Lobby is very impressive with modern arts and sculptures, very tastefully done. Staff was very efficient and gave us an excellent Executive Suite. Spacious and clean. Had an impressive Executive Lounge. The hotel is surrounded by historic building and the Hotel houses all the modern amenities, its an impressive feel. Definitely will return again. Centrally located with a good collection of restaurants around the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellen business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SallyB2
Reviews.Content: This is an excllent business hotel. Its location was pefect. Room was fine. The common areas were super. I liked the breakfasts very much and had guests for working breakfasts which worked well. Very good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ddleffers
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and the location was excellent. Got a really great price on priceline. Would certainly stay again if I could get a similar rate. Internet ridiculously expensive, Starbucks is about two blocks and free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: F215
Reviews.Content: It's not very often I like corporate style hotels, but the staff here went out of their way to make it a very relaxed and enjoyable stay. Special mention to Stefan in the exec lounge who always smiled at our silly questions and party behaviour!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean, friendly staff, and a great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: Packngo205
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is only a five minute walk to Check Point Charley, and several other points of interest in Berlin. The staff is helpful and friendly and the rooms are clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet, which was included with our stay, was one of the best I've come across in a European hotel. The only issue is, as is typical with most upscale hotels is the rediculous charge for internet access. For the chocolate lover there's an awesome store across the street.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gill t
Reviews.Content: stayed four nights in this lovely hotel.the room was excellent and spacious.the staff were very helpful and friendly. the only drawback was the price of the food at the hotel. but handy pub down the road and starbucks around corner

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Berlin October 11”
Reviews.Author: Frank1915
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located a reasonable walk to major sights. We had a room with a view of the square. Good breakfast but expensive in my opinion. Berlin is a lovely city with lots to see and do. The hotel is reasonably located one half mile to check point Charley and about a mile to Brandenburg Gate and the Parliament building, Had a good stay at the hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Super Fantastik”
Reviews.Author: maxbiddick
Reviews.Content: As any other Hilton Hotel, it's pretty amazing. I stayed in an executive room. It was smaller than I expected but nice. I enjoyed the stay and the lounge was amazing. The water in the gym was brilliant with a clever little special ingredient; lemon. The food was ravishing and every single facility was as was expected. I enjoyed my stay here and will be frequently visiting other Hilton Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonFroggy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mainly for the location: I did not mind walking down from Friedrichstrasse station, but for those who take the undergroung there is Stadtmitte station a minute away. If you happen to visit on a warm day, make sure that you go and enjoy a drink on the square opposite the hotel next to Gendarmenmarkt. Apart from that good service, clean room and bathroom (did not try the breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Undoes all the stereotypes of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mrosen94
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Berlin and I found this hotel to be worth the visit. The hotel is spacious, modern and well designed. The stand out moment for me was in the gym when the staff came over and offered complementary water with a twist of lemon. This was just a nice touch and one, which in my experience, is novel. the rest of the facilities and staff were exactly what i have come to expect from a hilton hotel in a metropolitan city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad A
Reviews.Content: Short version: This a great hotel at a great location, and I highly recommend it. Long version: We arrived at the hotel at around 10am. We already sent the hotel an e-mail informing them of our early arrival for check-in (the regular time is 2PM) and they said they'd try their best. To our delight (it was an overnight plane trip) our room was ready and waiting for us and the check-in process took only the time to sign the pre-filled form and receiving our key cards. The room looked exactly like the one advertised (it was a King room). The bed was comfortable, it had a long desk with plenty of electrical outlets (always a plus). The bathroom was not very big but it was adequate and clean. There was a water kettle with cups, coffee packets, tea bags, and everything you need to make a warm drink. The room also contained an iron and ironing board and a hair dryer. Our reservation included breakfast and it was served in the first floor in a room with a great view of the cathedral opposite the hotel. The breakfast selection was excellent and there was also an omelet station with a chef who can make your choice of omelets. We really liked the location of the hotel because it's near to the Museum Island which we visited several times. It's also very close to Friedrichstraße with its many shops. We had an occasion to call housekeeping because of a strange smell in the bathroom when we first arrived, and the problem disappeared upon our return so they were very efficient in their service. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Berlin. They've made our stay very enjoyable and we will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DorsetUKPaul
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you know that you are in good hotel. We got upgraded to an executive room and access to the executive lounge. The bedroom wasn't large but very well designed, very clean and the bathroom was well supplied. The executive lounge was spacious with a good variety of food and drink. The staff were very friendly and helpful ,a great credit to the hotel. Ps the location was fantastic for all visitor attractions and very accessible from the airport via bus and U Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlmancity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011, the hotel is beautiful and really well located with the underground right outside the hotel. The rooms were very well presented, clean and tidy. The breakfast was fabulous with a lot of choice, the downside is the cost of drinks, they were extraordinarily expensive and i would advise you to go out for a drink rather than stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: stew007
Reviews.Content: Great service Great room Great hotel Great location

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanDT
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, well furnished room and one of the better Executive Lounges I have used. It was conveniently located for public transport, with a U-Bahn station right outside the entrance. On arrival, I was shown to my room by one of the Executive Lounge check-in staff, which was nice. The Executive room I had was good, but a bit small. It was irritating that the wardrobe doors had to be closed to open the bathroom door (and vice versa) because they were so close together. Also, the desk was so close to the wall that it was difficult to stand up, or sit down, in the desk chair without banging it against the wall behind it. Evening food in the Executive Lounge was very good. Breakfast was a typical Hilton breakfast. The Executive Lounge was unusual, compared to other Hiltons I've stayed at, in that it was on the ground floor, whilst my room was on the 6th floor. This meant it was a bit of a trek to pop down to the lounge for 5 minutes for a drink. Overall, a good hotel that I would return to,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nadia-ath
Reviews.Content: In my next visit to Berlin I would definitely stay at the same hotel. The common areas are impressive, with its bar and restaurant, very nice rooms, clean, very nice breakfast, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellie-the-dog
Reviews.Content: This is a Hilton Hotel that was built by the Russians during the cold was and was for western visitors. Hotel rooms a a little small in comparison with western standards but still very nice.Location is excellent and you can get everywhere by walking.

Reviews.Title: “All you'd expect & more”
Reviews.Author: BeenandDoneIt
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Hotel in Berlin is perfect for a short break in the city. Firstly, it is superbly well located both for walking to the iconic sights, picking up the Underground or the frequent tourist buses and for access to an excellent selection of restuarants. The hotel itself has been recently refurbished and is in great condition - the reception and bar are are very open and welcoming and the lounge and restaurant are comfortable and elegant. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and the room was everything you would expect from the Hilton brand. All in all - a great location for a short break in a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay to top off our European Trip”
Reviews.Author: droch
Reviews.Content: Booked this location through the honors telephone line. I was trying to get the best rate and because I am a government employee the lady on the phone said it was by far the best rate. I continued to look and prices just kept going up. I knew something was going on but did not find out till we got to Berlin Took the train in from Prague and then took 2 undergrounds to the hotel. Even thought a station is right down the street one block it may be a little difficult to find at first, because the station is over a 2 block area and has a few lines. Went straight to the Executive Club Check in and the room was ready once again. It was early after noon. They had upgraded the room to one on the executive level. The room itself was the standard Executive Room with newer finishes. Cannot complain about the Room. Free internet because I am a gold and access to the Executive Lounge. Standard food and drink in the Lounge but I felt the ones in Prague and Vienna were better. This one on the mark of 9 would remove the food and drinks they had out. Pool area was very nice and we used it to relax after a long day of walking around Berlin. The location is in East Berlin and is now one of the richest areas in the City. Due to the national football championship going on the hotel was at capacity but you could not tell. If your coming from the air port there is a way to use public transportation. It is a little more difficult to figure out compared to other locations but if you email the hotel they will help you out. Taxi to the airport about 25 eur I would stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well-trained staff”
Reviews.Author: grumpyguest
Reviews.Content: Perfect location- close to sights, restaurants (Borchardt and many others) and shopping (Galeries Lafayette, H&M etc). Subway station "Mitte" right outside the hotel. Check-in was perfect: although I arrived early and had not told them (naughty me)- I got a beautiful room which was both quiet (facing the green courtyard) and had a view of the top of the German dome. Toiletries are La Source (Crabtree and Evelyn), great bathrobe and towels. Plenty of places nearby for a decent breakfast, e.g. Quchnia, Shan Rahimkhan or Einstein Kaffee-all have free wifi- the wifi in the hotel is expensive (22 Euros per day for a good connection). Spa area is ok but also costs extra- only small pool is free for hotel guests. Don’t use the manicure in the hotel- it is terrible and expensive. Executive Lounge on the ground floor is very cool and has Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, beautiful property, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JRLander
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Hilton Hotel. We were on the Executive Level, and had access to the Executive Lounge. The facility was beautiful and well maintained. The location was excellent. The staff at the Executive Lounge were extremely helpful in making dinner reservations and giving recommendations. Breakfast in the lounge was more than sufficient, and included eggs, bacon and sausages. Evening happy hour was comfortable. The hotel is right across from the Stadtmitte U-Bahn station, which made it very easy for us to go to other parts of the city. One good thing to know - there are two major supermarkets within two blocks of the hotel. You can buy bottled water and soft drinks for your room at a fraction of the cost of the hotels mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Tourism or Business”
Reviews.Author: RichardMer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night city break in Berlin - a great city with a friendly atmosphere and much to offer. We were lucky enough to have a room with access to the executive lounge in this excellent hotel. Moderately sized rooms are nicely furnished, very comfortable, and some have great views across the adjacent Gendarmenmarkt. The rooms are maintained spotlessly clean and serviced twice per day. We made extensive use of the comfortable executive lounge with its complimentary snacks, tea, coffee, and drinks. The hotel also serves an excellent breakfast buffet in its main restaurant. We encountered no problems at all during our stay and we found all of the staff courteous, pleasant, and eager to help with whatever we needed. Overall, we had the impression of a very efficiently run hotel which has set high standards for itself. Actually, we would rate this as one of our best hotel stays. The hotel is very conveniently located in the centre of Berlin (Stadtmitte) where all of the main attractions are within walking distance. Transport options for travelling further afield are also readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished Hotel in Excellent Central Location”
Reviews.Author: GastroInn
Reviews.Content: This large Hilton is stragically placed in the famous Gendarmenmarkt right in the centre of the City within easy walking distance of the main attractions,Checkpoint Charlie, Unter den Linden, Museum Island, Friedrichstrasse and great shopping. Allthe bedrooms and bathrooms were refurbished in 2010 so are really nicely appointed. Not huge but I think all have a desk area and well appointed bathrooms. Some have rooms overlooking Gendarmenmarkt with its twin Cathedrals so have great views. The majority however either look out on side streets or an inner courtyard, but unless you are desperate for a view the inner rooms are fine and are less expensive. The executive rooms have access to the lounge on the ground floor where breakfast and snacks and evening cocktails are served. Worth paying the extra for this in my opinion as the main restaurant for breakfast is huge and a bit of a scrum when the hotel is busy in particular and breakfast is not cheap. The lounge breakfast is of course slightly limited but more than adequate with a couple of hot dishes available and a much more peaceful place to relax in in the morning. The evening cocktails and snacks are also included and a good selection of alcoholic drinks thrown in. Many people seem to use this instead of going out for dinner! However it is a great place for an aperitif before dinner and there are lots of good local restaurants. We tried the hotel restaurant Mark Brandenburg but would suggest walking few yards to Lutner & Wegner which is a Berlin institution and much more atmospheric (generally need to book to be sure of getting in). Hotel has a car park at c 20 euros a day and valet parking also available.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Anna L
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hilton Berlin and it's really was the best so far. The recent renovation has improved the hotel rooms, lobby and executive lounge, making the hotel more modern. The location is perfect for exploring the city: subway in front of the hotel; dining facilities, shops and tourist attractions on walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTraveler5_0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept. 2011, and enjoyed our stay, it is very well located, just 2 short blocks from the main commercial walking/shopping street and less than 10 minutes walk to where "check point charlie" is located, and across the street from a beautiful plaza. The hotel appears to be more of a business hotel, but travelers will be very comfortable here, as the rooms are decent sized & well appointed. Didn't try any of the hotel restaurants/bars as we like to walk out & enjoy what the city has to offer. Many restaurants & cafes, bakeries nearby, so no shortage of food around.

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: moncic
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a few years ago and I remember that I wasn't too happy about the rooms, but now they have renovated them so it has the standard that one would expect. The food was very good and service impacable. Location is also excellent, only some 5-10min walk from Brandeburg Tor. The only thing I really need to complain about is the rediculous extra charge of some 15 Eur in order to use the sauna. You would really expect a 5 star hotel to include it in the premium price it already charges for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for work and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JMarpleInc
Reviews.Content: What a great location for business and pleasure. We received excellent service from all staff who are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Hotel has a first class Executive Lounge and business services. Lots of good restaurants nearby and walking distnace of many major sights - Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall, Holaucaust Memorial Square etc, plus sightseeing bus stops about 2 mins from the hotel. U-Bahn right outside too.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Areeni
