Reviews.Content: On a trip through Europe my friend and I stayed at the Hilton as a part of a package deal. It was nice but for what you pay I would say there would be better. All the things that were good about it were what I would've expected from a hotel with 5 stars, just not sure it's worth it. If you're happy to pay then stay here as it's lovely and they look after you well. I'm just not sure it's worth the extra money just for a bed for the night. Wifi was a little expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SWFCdave
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city. Smack in the middle of the city. Staff helpful and courteous. Restaurant and executive lounge were of high standard. Stayed for four nights but needed more. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Ad H
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Modern amenities. Mediocre service, at best: -didn't do a wake-up call -executive lounge had low quality food, and really below par wines and sparkling wines. -concierge was pretty clueless, and very unfriendly -tried to overcharge my bill (fraudulent charges removed, but system was down when checked out so it took emails and wasted time to do) -staff at the desk was not good -internet was spotty Overall, you can do much better for your money (not cheap!).

Reviews.Title: “well done”
Reviews.Author: sakis031
Reviews.Content: Although I’ve just stayed for one night due to the marathon race I can say that they run the hotel very well. Compliments to the girls at the reception the staff at the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good service”
Reviews.Author: Brissy2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located - walking distance to shops, sites and train station. Friendly service on checking in at Reception. Their bar area was undergoing renovations (July 2010), but there were plenty of other places to visit. The room was fine – had enough pillows – nice doona – good big bed! Comfortable all round - the decor was a bit dated, although it did have a good sized TV monitor. The Internet price at the Business Centre was 0.35¢ € per minute. If I had to mention a negative aspect, I guess it would be the distance we had to walk from our room which was on one corner of the hotel to the opposite side of the complex to visit the Executive Lounge which was no big deal (good exercise - LOL!). The amenities in their Executive Lounge were good and it was open for most of the day. Their Afternoon Tea was lovely as were the beers and cold Cokes. They also had 2 Internet terminals which were free-of-charge but they suggested only 15mins usage (to allow others to also use them). If you want to eat somewhere different, across the street we found an Italian restaurant called Malatesta which was both alfresco and indoor and served huge meals - we'd recommend the Octopus Salad! For us the Hilton proved to be a very handy location to the tours and walking around sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Up to the Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: pkerekes
Reviews.Content: This is a nice downtown hotel with good facilities and quite OK location. There is an U-Bahn line nearby and a few good bars (try the Newton whiskey bar or the home made beer at the Augustiner). The breakfast and the food in general at the hotel is excellent, just as you would except at a Hilton. Nevertheless the internet is a rip-off as mentioned earlier, 17 EUR for a day ... The airport (TXL) is quite close a 20min and 22-24 EUR ride away. When in Berlin make sure you do at least a half-day getaway from the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Julesp99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on a 4 night break. This was our first visit to Berlin and what a fabulous time we had. The hotel is one of the nicest Hilton hotels we have stayed in. The staff were very attentive across all areas of the hotel but we found the staff in the executive lounge to be really helpful and friendly. We recieved a nice phone call on the day we arrived from the executive lounge staff as we didn't check in there and a letter welcoming us to the hotel the following day. These small touches really do make a big difference. I would echo the views of many on here by saying the hotel is in an excellent location and the breakfast buffet has something for everyone with superb views over square. the food in the restaurant was very nice if a bit plain, however I felt this was the same in most of the restaurants but this was just my personal taste. There is a U Bahn station right outside the hotel and getting around is really easy. Well done and thank you for a really memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent levels of service, well recommended”
Reviews.Author: nystate0fmind
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in a very beautiful square in old East Berlin and is very close to the TXL bus route, a U-Bahn station and a lot of major tourist attractions. The only negative about this property I will mention upfront, it was at the time frequented by a lot of touring Americans who dominated the breakfast room and to some extent the executive lounge as well. The rest of our experience was a dream, we checked in inside the executive lounge and were well served at all times when we chose to relax in there. Cakes were provided in the afternoon, a full bar with a small selection of hot food in the evening and the lounge remained open until half eleven at night which was ideal for a nightcap. Our room was standard Hilton with a large bed, neutral colours and a non descript view of the courtyard. The breakfast was an exceptionally large spread in buffet form although I saw staff bring ordered items to tables. The hotel has a wonderful lobby bar with a live pianist in the evenings which really gave a great atmosphere. We would definitely return again when visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Flipendo
Reviews.Content: Hilton Hotel is located in Gendarmenmarkt, the most beautiful plazza of Berlin, with two cathedrals and the Koncerthaus, many cafes and restaurants. It is very close to the commercial Friedrichstrasse and a walk away from Brandenburg Gate. Metro station at few meters. The hotel is "hiltonish", so you will have a guaranteed and pleasant stay. Elegance is everywhere - from lobby to rooms. Room is well equipped. But you have to have luck to get one with a view, and not with the interior court. Still, I had one at the last flloor, from where I could've seen the roof of one of the cathedrals (see the picture). I would recommend Hilton for any kind of trip in Berlin, due to it's great location and to all the classy facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sugrbear73
Reviews.Content: The final leg of our 8 day journey took me and my son to Berlin. We stayed here for two nights and loved it. It is a chain hotel so you pretty much know what to expect as far as amenities but the staff is what sets this hotel apart. The check in/out staff were friendly and very quick which is welcomed after a long day of travel. The concierge was very knowledgable and friendly when it came to pointing the way towards the sights. The one gentlemen wasn't sure where the statue of Stauffenberg was located so he called someone who knew and very quickly gave us spot on directions. The breakfast is buffet style but with eggs to order which was a nice treat. Spacious dining room and fresh hot coffee served at the table. Great hotel, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: venntul
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent. Great location. We got a good room but no view because they had none. It was no big deal because we were out most of the time and enjoyed Berlin a lot. Great city. The bathroom was tiny. U bahn right outside the door. Great breakfast - Lots of choices. We were at the bar one night and the staff was extremely helpful. She introduced me to the Berliner Kindle only available in Berlin. Loved it. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Anthony-Susan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times in the past when traveling on business. This time, I was with my wife and other couples, staying here after an 8-day wonderful cruise on the River Elbe. This hotel is perfectly located for those who are oriented to the area that was formerly East Berlin, including the museums island, and I was telling our friends how pleased I had been with this hotel from my earlier stays. Not this time. I had repeated problems requiring front desk attention and each time I encountered a decidedly unhelpful attitute. For a major hotel in the Hilton chain, I was indeed surprised and disappointed. When I returned home, I sent a formal complaint to Hilton via my Hilton Honors account. They responded quickly, saying they would check into this, but I never heard anything further. Judging by this visit, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “It is great but,,”
Reviews.Author: limeorange
Reviews.Content: Hilton is great hotel met your needs. Also it is located just in front of Gartenmarket(?) which has a lot of restaurant and bar. But internet access was so expensive. Business plan 22Euro/day. lol.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: travelingchrissie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night only, but still remember the friendly staff. It is nicely located very close to the major shopping streets and to some of the famours sights. The room was very nice and comfortable and I remember the option to lend cloths for fitness and pool. I often forget to take that with me and really like the idea of being able to get that from the hotel! Congratulations on this nice initiative. Breakfast was excellent. In summary, a good option in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizenParis
Reviews.Content: We had the most delightful time at Hilton Berlin We booked in advance taking advantage of the anyweekend anywhere promotion A few days before the trip , I received an email offering e-upgrade at a very interesting price (30 euros per room for executive privileges) , which is half the price compared to check in upgrades. We landed at Tegel and boarded bus TXL ( one flight of stairs up, exit D and turn left) which dropped us in 20 minutes at the Under den linten/friedrichstasse stop for less than 3 euros each. After that it’s a 7 mn walk to the hotel. At the same stop you can hop on bus 100 and 200 which will take you to most of the sights in lieu and place of the sightseeing tours for a small fare (6,8 euros for the day ticket valid until 3 am the next day for all buses and metro and trams ) . Those buses are double deckers , so grab the front seat on the upper deck for the best view We arrived at the hotel at 10 am and were delighted to find out that our room was ready The staff was really welcoming and they were no lines for check in The building has only 6 floors and several elevators which means that you barely wait going up or down . A key is needed for activation The hotel interior is elegant in a contemporary style and has probably been renovated recently The room was lovely , of adequate size with a beautiful view on Gendarmenmarkt square Plenty of mirrors, space to hang clothes and shelves, iron board and tea and coffee making facilities The bathroom is a little small but perfectly equipped The bed is heavenly as should be in a Hilton and we slept like babies Aircon is perfect , not noisy and easily managed Unfortunaltely there is no space for your personal items in the fridge. The ice dispenser is kind of hidden in a closet on the corridor close to the elevators, ice bucket is provided in the room. The breakfast spread is the usual with a nice german touch (sausages, wide choice of bread, cheesecake and crumbles ). Scrambled eggs are a disaster but the egg station is really good Gluten free cereals are available The breakfast room has beautiful view over Gendarmenmarkt The Hilton has a sausage place on Gendarmenmarkt called Dom curry which offers sausages and beer for a regular price (same as others in berlin) The fitness room is well equiped (free weights, 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical machine, 1 runner machine, 1 rowing machine and more ...) and the attendant provides water with a slice of orange . water is also available from the dispenser There is a small indoor pool . The location is perfection. One can walk to most sites (Postdammerplatz, check point Charlie, Brandebourg gate, Reichstag, Museum island, Alexanderplatz ) in less than 20 minutes We spend a day in Postdam which is a lovely place and also enjoyed a day in the zoo , really worth the visit . The neues museum is enchanting for the collections but also for the building which is ordinary from outside but amazing from the inside, beautiful renovation. book on the web to avoid lines and select the 10 am spot to get in at opening time , head straight for the nefertiti head , one flight of stairs up , then right and right . like the joconde in the louvre , the room fills quickly with hordes of tourist trying to take pictures and robbing you of the most emotional moment of the visit. For internet, go to nearby starbuck as it is very expensive in the hotel We have already planned our next trip to Berlin and will stay at the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Good apart from poor room service”
Reviews.Author: NA1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife over the August bank holiday. It was looking good for a 4 or 5 star rating, the requested quiet 2 bed room was allocated us, nice decor, nice food in the bar. It went wrong the last night of our stay. We came back from a sightseeing trip to Potsdam and my wife wanted a simple bowl of potato soup. I rang room service at 8pm and was told it would be brought us in 25 minutes. An hour later we were still waiting. After ringing down again the manager came up and apologised that a trainee did not take my details correctly, and tried to deliver the food to the wrong room. He did apologise and led us to believe as he was leaving our room that he would offer us something, as he said 'I know what I can do'. I thought perhaps he was alluding to giving us some discount on our food bill, or offering us a special deal on a future stay. But checking out this morning they claimed to know nothing about it. The lady on the desk offered us a german currywurst sausage from the cafe as some sort of compensation ! As we were leaving for the airport then even if we wanted a sausage we couldnt have eaten it ! My wife and I both felt we weren't being treated seriously. I think the lady on the desk thought it a great joke. We werent being treated seriously. I was suprised that a 5 star hotel as the Hilton would treat people like this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: winwolf56
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights on points and as a gold member which gave us access to the Exec Lounge (and free breakfast and day long snacks/drinks). Rooms are modern and very comfortable. Hotel location is excellent, U Bahn right outside the door and a reasonable walk to many of the key sites of Berlin. There are several excellent reaturants and good shopping in this upsclae neighborhood. Staff are pleasant and very professional. All around excellent hotel; would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: beehappybe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of main tourist attractions. I was very happy with our King Hilton Guest room-clean, enough space and quiet despite being only on the second floor. The breakfast was great with great selection of different foods and even Cava at the weekend. We managed to get a very good deal (prepaid Bed & Breakfast spring sale for staying in the summer) so it was a good value-rack rate would have been probably about double that. The pool is also lovely-nice and clean. I would stay again if back in Hilton. The only disadvantage is the prices of all the sorounding places (cafes/restaurants) as they target 5* hotel clientele. Few stops on the U-bahn and you can eat and drink for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great breakfast! I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: onmylist
Reviews.Content: People this was a great vacation. Picked up the Berlin Welcome Card 36E at the airport , validated it on the bus to the Ubahn and at the hotel within 45min. Rooms are updated with a great view of the Gardenmarket square across the street. Checkpoint Charlie , Brandenburg gate, and Museum island all 10 to 15 min walk. Breakfast is a wonderful memory of all types of sausage,breads, jams, and omelets. We ate at a restaurant that dates to 1385AD 1 block away. I loved it. We rented a car from Sixth-a 5 min walk when leaving Berlin. Otherwise Stadmitte Ubahn will take you locally where you need to go. You must take the S Bahn to Pottsdam for the day. Only watch for pick pockets at Checkpoint Charlie.

Reviews.Title: “Location central in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: haymaker58
Reviews.Content: This was an attractive hotel in a very central location. There is a nice pool and jacuzzi and the concierge desk was consistently helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Martusia84
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for a weekend and for sure I will recommend it to everybody!!! Check-in very fast, staff well - organized, they speak very good and fluent English. In bar we drank once, it was good. Hotel is situated perfectly for people, who want to go sightseeing, cause we went everywhere on foot cause it was close. Also we went to discos and unfortunately we discovered last night that in the same street as hotel is a great disco but it was only last night so we've been there once. If I come back to Berlin with no hesitate I will pick that hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: B P
Reviews.Content: Very poor service! THIS IS NOT A FIVE STAR HOTEL. At their best days it might be four stars otherwise I would rate it to be a 3½ star hotel. The internet policy at this hotel sucks. Having booked a suite with access to the "executive" lounge area the homepage stated "free internet access". The "free" access turned out to be three desktops with internet access and these were frequently occupied. There was no free access beyond these three desktops. We then paid the ridiculous amount of 17€ ! for 24 hrs access. However Hilton has no control of the access; the voucher did not work when trying to connect a pc and a smart phone, in this day and age families should be expected to have more than one device and even though we complained twice and got new vouchers it never got to work. The staff was not interested in the problem they were only interested in collecting the money. In a city where just about every coffee shop and even ice-bar has free (really free!!) internet access it is a complete scandal that a so called 5-star hotel charges a ridiculous amount of money for internet access even when booking an "executive" room and furthermore it doesn't work properly like it should. Not knowing the lounge we had booked additional "normal" breakfast. After the first day we discovered that the breakfast in the lounge was enough so I tried (with 24 hrs warning) to cancel the breakfast for the remaining days. I was told that the rate was "breakfast included" so it could not be changed, even though I know I booked it separately. And when we checked out the bill clearly stated room rate and breakfast rate as separate amounts so of course they could have cancelled the breakfast if they wanted to. Furthermore they discussed this at the desk in German talking about us clearly not knowing that I actually do speak German and could understand what they were saying. This is not the way a real classy hotel treat their guests. If we ever get the chance to visit the absolutely beautiful city of Berlin again we will definitely not stay at this hotel. The area (Gendarmenmarkt) is perfect so we will choose another hotel in the area for example the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Maravilloso”
Reviews.Author: CSMEXBOL
Reviews.Content: Excellent attention. Very nice room. Very close to main touristic centers. Just great. I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very central and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: swisspigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton and really liked this hotel. The reception was very friendly, we got a standard room which got all we wanted and needed. The beds were so comfortable that we hardly did not want to go up and out after a nap in the late afternoon... The room is functional and everything worked. We loved the bar in the lobby where we had great Martini's. The only part of the hotel which was not to our liking was the restaurant where we had dinner. The service is ok, but the food was very inconsistent although we ordered the same dish. Having said that, we would certainly come back as the hotel is very well situated and the U-Bahn (metro, subway, tube) station 'Stadtmitte' is as close as the taxi stand. Line No 2 brings you to the in places in Prenzlauer Berg and in Schöneberg. We will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'Home Base'”
Reviews.Author: Kunson
Reviews.Content: If you are either looking for a great view, the ideal starting location for a sightseeing trip, close by (upscale) dining/wining and cultural activities or just a very good hotel with excellent facilities…` Look no further because this hotel will offer it all. It is the ideal hotel for a (one day) trip around the highlights of Berlin as it is conveniently located in the middle of the imaginary circle that will cover all 'must sees' such as Brandenburger Tor, Alexander Platz, Potzdammerplatz, Checkpoint Charlie, museum district, Reichstag, etc, etc. All are within walking distance but renting a bike (at the hotel) or at the (more cheaper) locations in the vicinity of the hotel may be an even better option. If you don’t like either of these options, the entrance to the subway is located in front of the hotel. At the same time the Gendarmenmarkt which is surrounded by many bars, clubs and (upscale) eateries is practically on the doorstep of the hotel. If the weather permits there are multiple drinking/eating option on the square itself and the ‘Konzerthaus ‘ makes that the square remains lively in the evening ours. Around the square you can even dip into the famous Berlin clubbing scene. For the shopaholics, the upscale 'Friedrichstrasse' is around the corner. Although the hotel is huge (almost 600 rooms) the service is not that ‘distant’ as you will experience in many of these large chain hotels. For that matter, this hotel, being not originally build as a Hilton, both on the service level as on the look&feel level really stands out compared to the more traditional Hilton brand hotels. If you like a view, make sure to book a room with view on the Gendarmenmarkt. It will cost you a little more, but the view is worth the extra. For European standards Berlin 5*- hotels (and therefore also this one) are relatively low priced. However, additional charges on Wifi, etc are outrageous (as they always are). Having stayed in many hotels in Berlin before, this will be our new ‘home base’ when we visit this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hilton quality in a huge hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoctorLudwig
Reviews.Content: Although we are in Berlin every 6-8 weeks, we never stayed in the Hilton before. It was never conveniently located for us. This hotel has a prominent location on the Gendarmentmarkt - a prime spot for relatively affluent foreign visitors to the city. The square offers, besides a very imposing view, several upmarket chainhotels (Hilton, Sofitel, Regency etc), an underground mall (Quartier 208), the Galleries Lafayette around the corner on Friedrichstrasse also several luxurious restaurants which are very famous for celebrity sportting (Borchardt, Vau, Guy and some others). Transport is very good (U2 and U6 with direct links to Zoologischer Garten station, Alexanderplatz, Friedrichstrasse and Checkpoint Charlie) but not excellent like some other locations (U2 is usually very crowded with tourists and opposed to the S-Bahn from Zoologischer Gartern eastward relatively slow). If you are a tourist looking for upmarket entertainment and this kind of international surroundings - this is the place for you! As you would expect from Hilton, rooms are well appointed and of a good size. Bathrooms have a tub, no seperate shower - which is a minor setback. We had a marvellous view of the Gendarmenmarkt - well worth. Housekeeping and turn-downservice were impeccable. Check-in went smooth, but being in Germany not all employees were friendly, rather very correct. Staff in the Executive lounge was lovely. Very friendly and helpfull.Refreshments and drinks were good. Refreshingly too was, the visitors of this lounge did not consist of the usual loungeflies but really used pre-dinner drinks and snacks before dinner rather than in stead of. The hotel bar seemed full every night, which gave a positive vibe to the hotel. The lobby was impressively made too. On the downside: this is a huge hotel. This gets clear when you use the breakfast - the breakfast restaurant on the first floor was often overly full, people being seated on the corridors - not very nice I think. Breakfast staff were relatively efficient but some need some training in courtesy. No major complaints though. Food and drink selection in the breakfastrestaurant was good and solid. All in all, we would stay here on leisure in Berlin again. Solid Hilton quality despite the hotels size.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hilton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: janmezzo
Reviews.Content: Not originally a Hilton, this hotel was in what has been East Berlin. It is centrally situated near a U-bahn station and it's a reasonably easy walk to Museum Island and other famous sights. Our room was large with a king-size bed. The bathroom contained a shower only. There wasa large TV which could get a good selection of UK and USA channels. Breakfast was terrific. We did eat in one of the restaurants - one which is next door and has a limited menu of local and seasonal specialities. It wasn't especially cheap but on a par with London prices. There are other restaurants around and you can eat quite economically if you look carefully. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They are all helpful and, even better, cheerful. That includes waiting and housekeeping staff. Of course, everywhere was spotless. We've stayed in several Hiltons and this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great way to end my vacation”
Reviews.Author: jwcardinal11
Reviews.Content: Berlin was the final of three European stops I had during a whirlwind week-long trip, and I was really happy to have chosen to stay at the Hilton Berlin. The room was clean, classy, and had a great view. The hotel staff was more than courteous and always had a smile to accompany.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: southdevon
Reviews.Content: The welcome is unique, by the door man and the reception team. All necessary info given in a quick and friendly manner. The rooms are great, big bed, air con in the room. The bathroom is a bit on the small side but everything that is needed is there and space for my brought items. In the room there is wired and wireless internet access. Also good that an English sockets is near the desk. We had a problem with printing out tickets for a cinema visit. They team of the lounge called the cinema and we could go to the cinema without any worries thank you so much. The ducks in the rooms on the 6th floor are cute. The executive lounge is great. TV channel choice is great although English channels are not always available when the weather is bad but not much time to watch anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: samtravel
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel, well located for metro stations

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: kebo111
Reviews.Content: this Hotel is just suberb and has everything and more the staff are so friendly and treat you with great respect ,it has the lot and more !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hilton - perhaps the best in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Joemalone123
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in a really excellent location. The facilities, restaurant, bar, accommodation were all extremely good. The staff were extremely hospitable - especially Stephan and Christopher in the executive lounge, which undoubtedly was the highest standard Executive Lounge I have ever been in. My room was large, very comfortable, immaculately serviced and was completely noise proofed. I had a wonderful view of Gendarmenmarkt - it was worth it. I highly recommend for a business or leisure stay. Within walking distance of many tourist attractions and the U-Bahn is outside the door for cheap, reliable transport to more distant attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dream_to_Live
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin is primely located in the Gendarmenmarkt. It is truly one of the more beautiful parts of Berlin. The main attractions in Berlin are within an easy walking distance from the hotel. And the hotel conceirge was extremly helpful in providing information on how to get to places of interest. I experienced exceptional service at the hotel from friendly and helpful staff. I experienced slight noise in my room (many people would not even have considered it noise) and when I bought this to the attention of the hotel my room was immediately changed and I was provided with complimentary wine and fruit. The rooms are well sized and the beds are super comfortable. I had many late nights and woke each morning totally refreshed. The spa treatments were also very good with proffessional staff. In room dining was of a good standard and very quick even when ordering at 11:30pm. I found the Hilton Berlin to be exceptional value for money and loved my stay. If I am in Berlin again I will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton. There's not much more to say”
Reviews.Author: Rayfinger
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Berlin. This is a large hotel in the expected Hilton style. On check in, there was a glitch caused by our touring company, with a required second room not booked. This was fixed professionally, with a suite provided at no additional cost. Rooms were clean, well serviced. No great views from either. Internet (typically) expensive, network frequently congested, would have been frustrating if I needed it for business purposes. Location very good. Close to Friedrichstrasse, U Bahn, shopping, museums, etc. Good restaurant choices nearby. Buffet breakfast good, single episode of room service good, did not otherwise eat there. Did not use parking. Unpleasant checkout. Female staff member abrupt and unpleasant. My daughter commented similarly on the same staff member after contact 10 minutes later (quite independently) and she was only returning room key. Staff otherwise positive and helpful. Overall, would probably stay there again if looking for similar accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “The city of Berlin & the Hitlon Hotel = Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Gazoneill
Reviews.Content: I returned home from Berlin a few days ago and i'm missing the place already! I was there with friends for one week and it was without doubt the best holiday I have ever been on (and I have been on a few) Hotel - The Hilton Hotel was superb. I would thurally recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning on visiting Berlin. The staff could not be more helpful. The recpetion staff are friendly and helpful nd I cannot speak highly enough of the consieers who speak good english and help you with any problem you may have (we asked about the u-bhan stations and other things and they were extremely helpful). Even walking around the hotel the staff are always smiling at you and saying hello. The room was very nice, good size and good bathroom. We had complementary shampoo and body wash/lotion replaced daily with fresh towels. Most importantly, the location of the hotel is the best in Berlin. It is situated in a beutiful area with the u-bahn (subway) immediently outside the hotel which can take you to busier areas like Alexenderplatz in around 10 minutes. Across the road from the hotel is a lovely outdoor area to enjoy a few beers in the sun! The only criticism i could apply to the hotel was that when i tried to pay for my drinks order in the lounge I had to wait around 20minutes trying to get the attention of the staff. Eventually I had to go up and pay at the bar. But this is the only thing i could say that was remotely negative and the bar area was busy. The bar staff were extremely pleasant. The hotel is stunning, the staff are amazing and the location is perfect. if you are going to Berlin, go to the hilton. Berlin - Few hints for anyone travelling for the first time; 1. Get the train to Friedrichstr from the airport and then the u-bahn to the hotel (the hotel stop is Stadtmitte). Journey is around 30minutes. 2. When you arrive at the Airport get the Welcome Card - I got a 5 -day pass and it gets you unlimited travel and the discounts on almost EVERY attraction. The discounts are usually at least 25% off. You will save a lot of moey doing this. BUT, MAKE SURE YOUR WELCOME CARD TAKES IN BAND ZONE C (THERE IS ZONE A,B,C) AS THE JOURNEY TO/FROM THE AIRPORT IS IN BAND C AND IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A TICKET YOU WILL BE FINED 40EURO. The welcome card is around 33euro for 5 days. 3.. Remeber to get your welcome card stamped before you use transport for the first time. Look for a red machine at the station!! Don't forget or might get fine! Great city, Checkpoint charlie 5-10minute walk down the road and close to everything. Subway will take you to the Olympic stadium - just use you map for the u-bahn incase you need to change to another carriage. You will have a brilliant holiday if you choose Berlin and the Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore this great city”
Reviews.Author: ANDYKWestYorks
Reviews.Content: Situated in the old section of East Berlin this hotel is perfectly placed to explore the city by foot and has an underground station on its doorstep if you wish to go further afield. The rooms are clean,very comfortable and some have a great view over Mohrenstrasse. You are just 20 minutes from Alexandraplatz and 15 minutes from Museum Island and the Brandenburg Gate. The breakfast is the perfect start to your day and there is comfortable bar in the lobby. There are excellent restautarants and bars on your doorstep and do not miss the excellent chocolate shop on the corner. One thing to miss is the Lowenbrau bar just around the corner from the hotel! We have stayed here twice now and its location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: vinket
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 20th of June to 26th of June 2011. It's an excellent place to stay, provided you book yourself in a room with cathedral view. You then have to pay extra (25%) Otherwise, rooms are good only for sleeping and nothing else. As it happens in all europian hotels, toiletteries are not available and one should never forget to carry it. Since I forgot to carry this time, I faced lot of difficulties. Restaurants are good for food. Location is close to many tourist attractions such as parliament, charlie, river cruise, etc.

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill567
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton last week, it was the second hotel I stayed at in Berlin (first time visitor to Germany). It was easy to find (right by the U Bahn) and really impressive looking. The lady at the front desk told me they redid much of it last year. Im a gold member so they upgraded my room and I had use of the (also newly renovated) executive lounge. My room was great and the lounge is the biggest Hilton exec lounge ive seen. Ive stayed in Hilton often in the U.S. as well as usually staying at least one night when i travel internationally (so ive seen a few) and this was probably my favorite. Gym was good, brunch buffet in lounge was very nice (not sure how it is in the regular restaurant), the lounge also had nice evening snacks and wine and the front desk service was wonderful. Location was great, right by the German and French cathedrals and Freidrichstra§e.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzigirl
Reviews.Content: A lovely room, no view, but beautifully quiet, and the beds were fantasic! A good buffet breakfast as long as you avoid the "eggs" service station. i have never seen anybody take so long to cook eggs to order. Most places these days have two frying pans on the go and can cook fried eggs and omlettes in no time. Not here. The young lady took for ever to produce an omlette, giving rise to long queues at times. I gave up!! I did mention it to the restaurant manager but no improvement made. However, it was a good breakfast and I would certainly stay here again. The hotel is in a great position for sight seeing. Just 10 minutes walk to Checkpoint Charlie, about twenty to the Brandenburg Gate. We experienced wonderful food at local restaurants, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful breakfast but small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: Was there for an international conference held inhouse. The hotel is very big but it is very old and the rooms are very small for a 5-star hotel. The valet service was prompt but very expensive, but there was no adequate alternative for a lazy walker from Asia... Breakfast was the usual great Hilton experience... Was there during a Nato conference so the security was crazy, driving out of the hotel meant difficulty in returing as the hotel was in the security zone (Clinton was in Berlin)... The reception was rather slow and diffident, but otherwise everything including the bellboys were very helpful....'

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: One of the better hotels in Berlin. Was there for a week for business (2nd time at this particular hotel in Berlin). I've stayed at others but this is my first choice for the balance of price/value. It is located in the region formerly known as "East Berlin" for you history buffs. Many sites within walking distance. Checkpoint Charlie and the Wall and so on within 10 minutes or so. Many restaurants and bars in walking distance. So convenient location. Rooms spot on. Decent sized for European hotels, they were in excellent condition. Lobby and related bar are high end in appearance (moderate in price, in line with most major European cities...glass of champagne will set you back about 12 euros...expensive by many standards but in line with a major city. Didn't use the fitness center due to jet lag. Speaking of jet lag, got there around 10 am and they had me checked in within 45 minutes...very accomodating after that flight. Restaurants in the area include a French Bistro, a few great Asian places, a solid Italian and several of the requisite German places. Plenty of shopping, although I would get off the beaten path for that. If you head to Museum Island and poke around a few blocks in either direction you will find much better gifts at much better prices than hitting the spots near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “high and reliable standard”
Reviews.Author: SFH75x
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a great place to stay. It provided all the reliable service and quality you can expect from this brand - without surprises. The room was descend in size, peaceful and freshly decorated. Breakfast buffet was of high standard, again without surprises. Also the meeting rooms fully lived up to the expectations. Overall a great place to stay for business in the heart of Berlin. The only downside was the "non-free" internet. I am always wondering how other hotels manage to provide free internet, but 4 & 5 star hotels often seem not to be able to offer this service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Stoks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel some 10 times over the past 7 years and it has always been excellent. Very friendly and helpful staff (last year my wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary and they did a fantastic job getting champaign and a big bunch of flowers in the room). The recent remodelling is very nice: a true "design" appearance. And the new executive lounge (now on the ground floor) leaves nothing to wish for! Apart from the hotel's restaurant there are abundant places in the vicinity. The hotel itself is very conveniently located, near a subway station and the pretty Gendarmenmarkt. I don't think internet is complimentary, it is for Gold/Diamond members. US visitors be aware: internet prices are very expensive in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: JASTTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in June, our first visit to Berlin. Great location, across the street from Gendarmenmarkt (most beautiful square in Berlin) U-Bahn metro station right in front of the hotel. We were able to walk to all the major sites in East Berlin from hotel. Many restaurants are within walking distance. Would recommend dinner at Augustiner and the wonderful chocolate store Fassbender & Rausch (across from hotel on corner) as well. Room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Spa facilities with separate elevator, pool was fantastic. Breakfast buffet had a large selection of both hot and cold food, lots of fruit and fresh juices as well, great service from staff. Would highly recommend and return!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed and then some”
Reviews.Author: palma05
Reviews.Content: Central location to major attractions and sights; easy access to U-Bahn at corner of the hotel and a quick walk to Unter den Linden for Bus stops. Excellent concierge services, express check-in service with a courtesy call follow-up to our room; Complimentary fruit basket, 350L Sparkling water, and 1/2 bottle of French Red table wine; Room service efficient and high quality. Inside room facing courtyard, quiet, clean and restful. Lovely location across from the Gendermarkt. Mark Branderburg Restaurant, lovely 5 star dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern + allergy friendly rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingPickles
Reviews.Content: When booking at this hotel i decided to opt for the allergy friendly rooms. These have been certified by ECARF. This mean that the rooms are very clean , have wooden floors and enable me to have a good night sleep. The new executive lounge is one of the best Hilton i have been to. The food was yummie.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Nic1405
Reviews.Content: There are a number of words that immediately come to mind when referring to the Hilton Hotel in Berlin, elegant, beautiful and refined. The location is very central, especially for shopping and dining. The rooms are spacious (for Europe) and well appointed however don't get caught out with the minibar. Unless you plan to use it I would advise that you don't open it at all, there are sensors underneath the items and once something has been moved (even if it is put back and not used) it automatically registers on your account and you will be charged ! The breakfast buffet is unbelievable, there is nothing you could want that is not here, and I would definatley recommend dining at the Mark Brandenburg Restaurant if you don't want to venture out for dinner. This is a fantastic hotel, one of the best Hilton's that I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gal4onok
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for people, exploring the city - it is located right in th center - 10 min to Bradenburg Gate, 10 min to Berliner Dom and 5 min to Chekpoint Charlie. Everything is clean. Swimming pool is excellent - great gift for healthy life adherents.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sandra18630
Reviews.Content: Have just spent four days at the Hilton Hotel, Berlin, perfect location, excellent choice of food at breakfast. Had meal in restaurant also very good. All staff friendly. Cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in down town Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Rocks_to_travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Berlin for two nights in June, 2011. The hotel is conveniently located in down town Berlin. It is located about a 5 minute walk from "Checkpoint Charlie" and about a 20 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate. There are two main museums literally across the street in magnificent old churches (my hotel window overlooked these). The room we had was a good size and was well appointed with all amenities. As with all Hilton Hotels (at least that I have stayed in) you had to pay for internet. They offered both by the hour and the 24 hour. Be warned, it is expensive. The breakfast supplied was very good with both hot and cold offerings available and the staff was very nice and polite. As with most Europeans, the staff were multilingual and we had no issue with communication. There is high end shopping within minutes of the hotel (Prada etc) if that is what interests you. In addition, across the street from the hotel is the biggest and most beautiful chocolate store I ever seen. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for service, location and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and breakfast. Renovated room was nice but nothing great.”
Reviews.Author: sportysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the peak of the European summer. Berlin was steaming hot, but our aircon worked great and kept us super cool. The location of this hotel is excellent - we walked to most places including Checkpoint Charlie and the main shopping streets are just 3 mins walk away. The breakfast offered a delicious spread (for a European hotel where sometimes the choice is spartan!). Although we stayed in a renovated room, there was nothing too amazing about it - although I do not know what the older rooms looked like ;-) The room size was the usual for a big city hotel, not large, but comfortable. We didn't use any of the facilities - there is too much to see in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Pickles2011
Reviews.Content: What you would expect from a Hilton. Very large, nice pool and gym run by livingwell. You can pick up good rates but extras are expensive. The hotel is well located, within walking distance to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “My choice for where to stay on our next visit”
Reviews.Author: ltdadd
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 delightful nights in what must be the best location for visiting Berlin. With the Hilton Honors program we were in an executive room with the priviledges for the Executive Club which offered not only a wonderful breakfast, but also snacks on drinks during the rest of the day, just enough to give you a quick pick-me-up and start out again to explore more of the city from this superb location. Our room overlooked the Gendarmen Markt, so we never got a closed in feeling of so many big city hotels where you are surrounded by other large buildings. The only challenge was figuring out how to use the elevator keys. The staff was extremely friendly, multilingual and super helpful. We also ate at the restaurant and found it to have great food in a very relaxing atmosphere which is exactly what we were looking for after a full day as tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and quality”
Reviews.Author: danwtmoon
Reviews.Content: This is a high spec hotel in the centre of Berlin and is relatively low cost to similar hotels in other cities. I can't fault the hotel across the board and genuinely look forward to my stay each time.

Reviews.Title: “A Gendarmenmarkt Treasure, We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: visittheworld16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for four nights on a pleasure trip visiting Berlin for the first time. We had an executive room, so the exclusive lounge came in handy and was spotless with free food and open bar in the evenings. The service is outstanding wherever you are, however if i had any questions i would ask the lounge staff as the concierge was always very busy and less thorough than others. Breakfast was plentiful and the quality was very good - plus we had it free! The spa was excellent and reasonably luxurious. The best thing about the hotel was its location. In my opinion, it was the best as you are close to everything. The Gendarmenmarkt is beautiful and is packed full of al fresco cafes and restaurants. Overall, when i return - i would have to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I love my stay the second time around.”
Reviews.Author: JAndrews10
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a perfect view of the Gendarmenmkt. This made us chose this hotel again. The breakfast buffet offers lots of choices. However, internet connection is availabe for a fee. We were travelling around Eastern Europe, most hotels we stayed in offer it for free. Because of its location, I will certainly stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: ADKtraveller
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of the hotel, it was an easy walk to the Brandenburg Gate (Brandenburger Tor), Checkpoint Charlie it is across the street from the Gendarmenmarkt and a metro station. Access to the city from here is excellent. The room was comfortable, large enough and quite with almost no street noise (3rd floor room). The executive lounge was a real treat - decent food and plenty of beverages with free internet access in the lounge. The hotel staff is attentive and all made attempts to make sure that my time in Berlin was enjoyable - making suggestions on how to get around, restaurant locations etc. All in all an very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent polite staff, wonderful breakfast, not central though..”
Reviews.Author: PaDiWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Our first experience of Berlin, and not our last...although we enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel, in the future we would probably stay a little bit more central, to be nearer more choice of bars and restaurants in the evenings. Saying that, the metro system in Berlin is brilliant, and there is a metro station opposite the hotel ( Stadtmitte ) so it is very easy to get around the city, and to the airport. Rooms are fine, not that big ( we had a standard King ) but not a problem, has a workstation for using laptop if required, but we found the lighting quite dim. The bed was a delight to sleep in, crisp white linen and wonderful quality pillows! Bathroom was quite small and maybe needed updating to a power-shower, but adequate, with plenty of mirrors, bright lighting, hairdryer and toiletries etc. Room seemed to be styled and decorated for the business traveller? Breakfast was really plentiful with an excellent choice to suit every taste, and the staff were brilliant at keeping the very busy breakfast room running efficiently, clearing tables and seating people quickly and cheerfully! We must mention that we found all the staff in the hotel really polite and always greeted us with a smile. This is definately not always the case in all hotels, and the Hilton Berlin is exceptional in their standard of customer service. We ate in the adjoining restaurant ( Mark Brandenburg ) for one evening, which has a relaxed and classy atmosphere, again with attentive professional staff. We didn't find the food exceptional, but it was pleasant enough for us to enjoy a lovely evening, so would recommend it if not wanting to venture out of the hotel for a meal. Nice to wander back into the stylish hotel bar to finish off the evening! All in all, a lovely stay in a quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarb2-2
Reviews.Content: Could not have been more pleased with my 12-day stay at this hotel. It has the best location in Berlin, in my view. It is located on the beautiful Gendarmenmarkt. One can easily walk to many important sights from the hotel and there is also a U-Bahn station in front of the hotel. The hotel has been recently refurbished from top to bottom and the results are outstanding. I stayed in one of the executive rooms located at the front of the hotel overlooking the Gendarmenmarkt. The room was nicely furnished, very comfortable and had a great view. I have just two complaints, The combination shower/tub's surface was extremely slippery. It was quite a challenge to maintain one's footing and to get in or out of the tub. Some sort of non-slip surface would have been greatly appreciated. I also believe the Internet charge of 17 to 22 Euros a day was excessive. I believe such service, like the telephone, should be a standard feature of every hotel room for no extra charge. I found every staff member I met to be friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet available to all guests, which is included in some room rates or otherwise is an extra charge, is expansive and very good. There is even a cook who will prepare eggs or an omelette for you any way you like. Most days I ate breakfast in the executive lounge, where the buffet is less expansive but nonetheless perfectly adequate. There are also computers available to use for free in the executive lounge. The Mark Brandenburg restaurant in the hotel was outstanding. I had many meals there and all were excellent and the prices reasonable. I highly recommend it. The food was also very good in the lobby lounge. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Someishere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the central part of Berlin, easy to reach by the Berlin Metro system. If you like to walk, it's not too far to Brandenburger Tor, Parliament building etc. The room we got (special price for two persons) was a single room, so it was very small but acceptable due to the hotel standard in combination with the price we paid. But the only disadvantage, was the breakfast. It wasn't poor but neither rich, which I had espected from a hotel in this price range. What I don't understand is why this kind of hotels don't offer free Internet (as for example Radisson Blu) but they charge a huge amount for 24 hours connection. Do they think that Internet is for a few people, business men and women who have a fortune and not for "all people" who would like to read the news in the home-town, to check mails or have contact with the family? Today Internet is a part of almost everyones life, also for people who don't have a lot of money at the bank account.

Reviews.Title: “MY HOME FOR 3 WEEKS”
Reviews.Author: Chariotchoogle
Reviews.Content: Was in Berlin on business for three weeks, couldn't ask for a better hotel, rooms are great, the best bed and pillows I have ever had. Location is fantastic right in the centre of everything, the Stadmitte is right outside the hotel so great to just hop on a train and venture parts of the city whether it be sightseeing, eating or going to work. Hotel bar is great albeit pricey, but nice for one or two as a treat. Breakfast is excellent, quality you would expect. Staff are courteous and polite, and because I stayed for so long had regular treats sent up to the room lke wine and fruit. There is a good gym, everything you need and a fantastic swimming pool. TV has lots of channels, and if you are from England you have your BBC and ITV. Great stay, great hotel and great experience ..... thank you

Reviews.Title: “Could not have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: YayShub
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... Modern decor and newly refurbished. The rooms are bit lacking in light though as the walls and curtains are brown.. Very polite and friendly staff. Plentiful breakfast with a wide choice and fantastic view of Gendarmenmarkt from breakfast room. Near most attractions in Berlin... a lot can be walked to. Stadmitte metro line U2 literally outside hotel door but only as long as you take the exit on the U2 platform following the exit for Gendarmenmarkt. Very nice surroundings and felt very safe. The only little hitch we had was that the cleaning lady did not change the bedding during our 4 night stay there - some blood that fell on the sheet when my husband hurt his foot stayed there throughout our stay. We were given 2 hour complimentary late check out which we really appreciated. On the whole wonderful hotel that I would recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a well located Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lollypollyme
Reviews.Content: A very decent Hilton. Well furnished, up date rooms in the same style as most of the better five star Hiltons. Good breakfast with lots of choice including omelette station. Check-in and concierge staff efficient, although a smile wouldn't go astray. Large, welcoming lobby. Very convenient location and close to public transport. Comfortable beds and pillows. Our only complaint was that all of the English language cable channels were showing up as static and were unwatchable - upon calling front desk we were told someone would investigate and call us back, however the follow up call never came. Otherwise this hotel is recommended. Definitely try the currywurst from the Hilton affliated vendor directly outside the hotel. Delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: JASM1NE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 day business trip, great hotel in a superb location, wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: FamilyvaluesLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Berlin for a long weekend city break, and have to say that our expereince wa in whole a positive one. Check in was simple and efficient (would you expect less in Germany). We was given a King size room on the 6th floor, when after some negotiation with the key card and the lift (its not the best system), and getting slightly confused by the directions on the wall we eventually found our room. The room itself was all you would expect from a Hilton, the air con had it so it was a comforatble tempreture, the bathroom was clean and tidy and the bed ok. The only dissapointing thing for me was tha the air con did keep me awake at night, but what with the 15 tog duvet and it being a mini heat wave, it really was needed to be on. That was my only niggle with the room. We opted to stay for bed and breakfast, and have to say we really was really pleased. it was a great sellection buffet style type of thing, with everything from fresh fruit to cereal, to the more gut busting fare you would expect from a German hotel. The city itself is beautiful, be sure to take in all the sights, we were especially impressed with the Olympic Stadium (you can take the Underground from the station just opposite the hotel). also if you are planning to go up the Radio Mast, we would advise you get there early, as the queues are horrendous. All in all a fantastic break, and a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tonyk17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Hilton Berlin. Highly recommended, great location, underground (subway) right outside hotel entrance, just a few minutes walk from some major tourist areas. Nice room, great breakfast, but make sure it's in your package or you'll have to pay €27 each. Only two small problems with the booking; our room wasn't ready when we arrived, should have been available at 14:00, wasn't available till 15:30, and the second bed that we needed wasn't there when we got into our room. Hotel gave us a free drink from the bar while we waited for our room, and put the second bed in the room within minutes of requesting it. Hotel has wifi, but it's very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the heart of a fascinating city!”
Reviews.Author: Afreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton when we travelled to Berlin on a short trip from India. Berlin is an amazing city with some fantastic food, history, culture and people. Our hotel was right in the centre of East Berlin. And with the train station, Stadmitte U-bahn, right outside our hotel entrance, we could be in West Berlin whenever we wanted! Some hugely popular Berlin attractions such as the Check Point Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate were only five minutes away by train. There were a few very good restaurants around the hotel and we even walked into an Indian place one afternoon and sipped some sweet lassi (yogurt-based drink). The rooms were comfortable and spacious, service was prompt and although the bathrooms were small they were very clean. All in all, I would rate this as a truly five-star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right in the heart of Berlin but..............”
Reviews.Author: patbrennan
Reviews.Content: Cost me £598 for 2 of us for 2 nights and had to pay extra for, internet, sauna, and steam room. How penny pinching is that ?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, pricey breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rask46
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend in Berlin with our teenage daughter. We had a package for two with breakfast included, but of course had to pay for extra bed and breakfast for our daughter, wich was quite pricey. Breakfast IS good, but 27 Euro is too expensive. On the other hand, we got a large and comfortable room wich was very quit at night. All in all the typical Hilton style where everything is runninng smoothly, and parking of the car is taken care of, very nice, and we will definetely come back to Hilton Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: letsgofire
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Berlin. The location is very good - convenient for the main sights in East Berlin and also for the subway to other areas. You can walk to almost everything from here. As a Hilton Gold we were given access to the Executive Lounge on the ground floor, which has food and drinks all day. We made big use of this when we wanted a snack. The breakfast is excellent - more or less the basic Hilton breakfast you normally get but perhaps a bit more. The concierge staff could be more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quite pricey and pretty generic, but a very pleasant hotel in an excellent spot and in all a very nice stay and hotel”
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to stay. Slightly odd and confused architecturally and pretty generic, but a fantastic spot with good facilities and very friendly and professional staff. Generally speaking, a very nice hotel. The bar area and reception is very pleasant and smartly designed, if slightly nondescript but the executive lounge is excellent with a very good breakfast and generous nibbles and drink in the evening. The room, on the executive floor, was very private and quiet with a super bed and nice bathroom. The water was lukewarm one of the days of our stay and we had problems with the Internet. The rack price is also quite pricey. But generally a very well run and professional hotel with good staff, good rooms and in a great spot. I would say brilliant for business and well placed for sightseeing but lacking in individuality for the more inquisitive guest.

Reviews.Title: “True 5 star hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: awpal
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay for the Berlin half Marathon at Hilton. Nice room, great breakfast and magnificent spa. Only downside was the loud music from their club (!) saturday night, but I got another room after complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: emmypar
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for the Berlinale Film Festival in February, and I stayed here for 4 nights. I admit that I prefer small boutique hotels to large chain hotels, but the hilton turned out to be a decent pick. The rooms are a good size for european hotel rooms, and the marble baths are ample as well. The location is the best feature of the Hilton, as it is central to all of the main historical sites as well as good shopping. Anywhere else you need to go, you can hop on the S-bahn which is only a block down the street. The hilton has a grand atrium which is beautiful, but in the cold winter months I found it to give the hotel a vacant, chilly feel. I had friends at the Hyatt and the furnishings and ambiance provided a bit more of a cozy feeling, even for a large hotel. Luckily, I foud the service to be very warm and accommodating which made up for the drafty feeling of the hotel. All in all, I had a good experience here. The location was the main selling point, and if you enjoy large chain hotels this is a great pick. Don't forget your scarf!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Gendarmenmarkt square and very close to the tourist shopping center of Berlin. Excellent hotel with superb facilities, incredible staff and amazing mouth watering food. The metro station is located just outside the hotel. After work a leisurely stroll along the streets leads you past the opera house and the brandenburg gate..

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: padsmcginty
Reviews.Content: My partner was staying here while working in berlin so I flew over for a four night stay.Room was very comfortable,the lobby was a pleasant place for a drink,the breakfast offered a great choice and the location on the gendarmarkt is superb.The stadmitte ubahn station is directly outside so you can be in west berlin in no time or alternately go to the sights of east berlin.Most major attractions in the mitte district can easily be reached on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ZT100
Reviews.Content: Hilton Hotels are normally great or bad. This one is the former and easily earns it's 5* rating. The staff are superb, the rooms are great and the location could not be better. I stay in this hotel 50 - 60 nights a year and yet have to have a bad experience. It does the Hilton brand an honour and certainly recommend it to anyone visiting this great city..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, typical Hilton flair”
Reviews.Author: petersouth
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin is a typical 5-star hotel, enjoying a superb location at the Gendarmenmarkt in the heart of the city. The facade of the building is a bit socialist, fitting for it's location in former east Berlin, but the interiors are kept in the standard Hilton class. The reception is spacious and on some nights live piano music is played. POSITIVE ASPECTS The location, with many famous sights (such as Brandenburger Tor, Unter den Linden, Alexanderplatz, Checkpoint Charlie, the egyptian museum and the city's concert hall) within walking distance. For everything else, the metro is at disposal and the nearest station is conveniently located outside the hotel entrance. The guestrooms are furbished in darker colours with a slight business feel, but not lacking any comfort. The breakfast hall offers a fantastic view towards Gendarmenmarkt and as expected, the variety and quality of the food is high. The hotel's wellness area includes an indoor swimming pool, sauna, various massage packages and a fitness room. NEGATIVE ASPECTS The lower room categories are facing the backside gardens, which unfortunately are run down and less pleasant. The price for WiFi in the rooms are beyond their worth. Parking spaces around the hotel seem scarse. PUBLIC TRANSPORT The Berlin metro, or U-Bahn as it is called, is a well connected network that takes you to any location in the city in no time. The nearest station is located right outside the hotel entrance, where the lines U2 and U6 operate. CONCLUSION Wether on business or holiday, this hotel is equipped and ready to serve. Even large tourist groups will have no problem settling in - with a spacious lobby and high amount of rooms in various sizes. The location is a great starting point for city explorers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mpkljp2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights booked through Expedia. The central location of the hotel is excellent only minutes walk from Stadtmitte underground station. We were very happy with our ‘king room’ very comfortable and as expected for a Hilton. We used the swimming pool which although a little cold we had it all to ourselves. Breakfast was excellent with a vast choice of both cooked and continental and champagne if you like! One day we went on a circular walking tour from the hotel to see Checkpoint Charlie, Potsdamer Platz, The Holocaust Memorial, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, and Unter den Linden. All within reasonable walking distance and no public transport required. We also found a good selection of bars and restaurants very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: diddie1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel was GRAND! What a spectacular room and and even better view. We went to Europe for our honeymoon and this was the best hotel that we could stay in throughout the 1 month adventure. They had a pool (but for some reason it wasnt heated - you would expect this in the middle of winter), the rooms were splendid as was the room service. The best meal to have here (or at any hilton) is the Hilton club sandwich...this provides for the best meal along with a large serving of fries - we were thrilled to see the meal arrive on 4 wheels - location was great as it was in the middle of the city....and dont get me started on the breakfast - FIT FOR A KING...they had all kinds of sweets, continental food, asian cusine and so much more...the resto was atleast serving 100 pax or more! we were delighted with this place..this place is costly but defo worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great time in chilly Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: H0mer62
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in a double room with buffet breakfast included. Hotel i believe as been recently refurbished,our room was superb with everything you needed in the room for an enjoyable stay but why do these big hotels persist in ripping people off charging 10 euros per hour for the internet and 5.50 euros a small bottle of Becks which you can buy for 89 cents in local stores. Used the 24hr gym which was well equipped but could get quite busy because it was not very big ,also the indoor pool was very nice but again not very big. Hotel is in a great location right across the road from Stadtmitte U bahn U2 line. Takes less than 1hr from Schonefeld Airport taking the RE7 line from the airport to Alexanderplatz then the U2 line to Stadtmitte. Can be difficult purchasing a ticket at the airport and platform information is very poor. Hotel is convenient to most tourist attractions with Checkpoint Charlie just round the corner and others a short stroll. If you purchase a day ticket for all zones ABC it costs 6.80 euro and you can use all U&S bahn trains,buses and trams,remember to validate your ticket. Word of warning the Reichstag dome as been closed to visitors since November 2010 due to the threat of terror attack but you can enter if you purchase tickets in advance. Sachsenhausen concentration camp is well worth a visit and its free, it takes about 1hr on the S1 line to Oranienburg then about a 20 min walk to the camp,this station is in zone C. Our great trip was slightly spoiled by the pompous miserable staff the Hilton hotel employs at the check in desk. On our last morning we were checking out early before the buffet breakfast restaurant opened so paid the 4.50 euro charge to have it in our room. It turned up late and there was only 1 breakfast and it was to late to get another so we had to rush it down. When we checked out we complained there was only 1 breakfast and the reply was,well you did'nt pay for it,to which i replied,we actually did because it was in the price of the hotel room especially when they charge 26 euros for a American breakfast. I think they should take a leaf out of some of the smaller hotels who treat there guests with respect and not think everybodys got bucket loads of cash to waste. And to add insult to injury she tried short changing me by 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated...still needs a few tweaks”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been obviously recently renovated. The hallways and rooms all have that "new" smell. The rooms are typical of a Hilton. Nothing special. Here are some notes: *Didn't care for the split "European" type beds quilts. You can get cozy with spouse under one blanket. Impossible. *Do not order room service. It's pretty bad. *Bfast downstairs in the Executive Club, however, was very good. *Bar area is quite nice with great entertainment *Hotel conveniently located to subway stops. *Great shopping a block away. *Centrally located. *Wireless access is ridiculous how it's set up. You have to get a login and password FOR EACH DAY from the front desk and one time it took them over one hour for them to get it to me. Frustrating. *Great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standards and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Edward8888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as part of a weekend in Berlin with my partner. The hotel is in a fantastic location, close to History Museum, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc. The breakfast was fantastic, lots of choice including for vegetarians. Swimming pool and spa very nice and clean. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean and service very friendly and efficient. We would definitely return! Only slight downside was the slightly small size and 'busyness' of the room, there was a lot of furniture and differently patterned wallpaper, chairs, curtains etc but this was no real problem to us. We loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wallabyandwhirlwind
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my partner in a Standard Room with breakfast. The rooms were very comfortable with soft beds, big bathrooms and big TVs and breakfast was a delicious buffet. My partner and I had wonderful late night cocktails in the hotel's bar with a live piano and bass band. The hotel opens right onto Stadmitte station and the Gendarmenmarkt and is 10 minutes easy walk to the Brandenburg Gate, Potsdamer Platz, and Museum Island. Mitte is a safe and lively area of Berlin. I asked all sorts of touristy things to the reception and found service to be very kind. All in all a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nordlaw06
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.excellent breakfast buffet,lovely rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Pennystinker1
Reviews.Content: I went with my college age daughter for 5 days of sightseeing and museum hopping. A short walk to the Museum Insel, Berlin Cathedral, Checkpoint Charlie Museum, Jewish museum. The U-bahn station (Stadtmitte) very coveniently located down the street which gives you access to the whole city. The room was quiet, very clean, heated towel rack in the shower, granite floors and vanity, nice decor. The breakfast, which was included with our room was a first rate buffet with eggs, meats, beans, fresh yogurt, cheeses, salmon, fresh breads, coffee, tea, pastries - I could go on and on! The pool was clean, serene and heated (though not that warm) and the gym was clean and had pretty much everything for a complete workout. The only thing that would make this hotel a dream would be free internet.

Reviews.Title: “the best location in berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ebtur
Reviews.Content: the hotel is just across the famous gendarmenmarkt, for me the most beautiful square in berlin. if u go in winter there is just across the street a beautiful xmas market. the hotel is very modern, the rooms are not too big, not too small, the breakfast is very good, the main entrance to the hotel, i.e. the lobby is very big and impressive. right across the street there are a lot of restuarants and bars. Unter den linden and brandenburger gate are a few mins of walk away..highly recommended hotel in berlin

Reviews.Title: “German Efficiency with Convenience”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights here to start off 2011. It was a leisure trip with specific priorities to see the Hitler Memorabilia special exhibition at the National Historic Museum and to visit the Cecilionhof Palace museum and hotel in Potsdam, the site of the 1945 Stalin/Churchill/Truman meeting at the end of the war in Europe. Both of our special objectives were met. We had stayed at this hotel in 2002 and were pleased to see the results of an extensive investment in upgrading the property since then. The hotel is nearly perfectly placed near Checkpoint Charlie, the Unter den Linden, Brandenburg gate, Museum Island, etc. Almost everything of visitor interest is walking distance and what is not is accessible from directly outside the front door of the hotel into the metro system which will take you anywhere in the Berlin region efficiently and inexpensively. The Executive Lounge in this hotel is superior, with friendly and efficient service, an excellent complimentary full breakfast, snacks and tea throughout the day and also complimentary cocktails and hors d'oeuvres in the evening hours. It is a great oasis during breaks in the action during the day. Computers with high speed internet access (and printers) are available in the Exec Lounge at no charge. Get the "Welcome Berlin" card for a reasonable fee and use public transportation and get discounts at most venues in town....it's a great value. The rooms are newly remodeled on the executive floor, very modern, chic and perfectly functional in every respect. Maid service is quick and efficient. An extremely valuable feature of this hotel is the Concierge Desk, which is continuously manned by an extremely knowledgeable and engaging crew of experienced English speaking men (I didn't see a woman there during our stay). They were extremely helpful with shopping, restaurant and other information. If you have noticed the word "efficient" recurring here rather frequently....well there is a good reason for that. Everything about this property works and every request is cheerfully and promptly satisfied. We were able to get all of our shopping and touring objectives met....not to mention some extraordinary Italian cuisine nearby at the Concierge's suggestion.....in total comfort and at a reasonable cost. I would add that being in Berlin mid winter was a treat....we knew it would be cold.....we dressed accordingly, and like the indigenous folks the weather didn't slow us down a bit. In fact a beautiful solitary walk in the snowy woods in Potsdam on a quiet early afternoon just before lunch was a memorable moment in the whole trip. The hotels in Berlin were quiet in this season, which added a relaxed air to the city.....a very nice getaway indeed. We really want to return to Berlin for another (3rd) visit and when we do, we'll choose this Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoziMatt
Reviews.Content: We arrived very, very early (like 06h30) after an uncomfortable overnight train journey. The room was provided to us immediately by a very friendly check in person, which we were very grateful for. The location is very good, near the Gendarmenmarkt and with U-Bahn station right outside. Hilton seem to feel that they have found the magic formula for room design and decor, as our room (which was newly refurbished) was very generic and could have been any Hilton that I have stayed in worldwide.
