I suppose that is good on a certain level as you know what to expect, but there was no local flavour. We'd just come from a very character-full hotel in Amsterdam so perhaps this biased our view, but the "nice" room was just that and we thought it was a bit bland as a result. The room is definitely very comfortable and the bed was perfect. Since we'd had a bad night the previous evening we went to bed straight after breakfast and the construction sounds were very loud, but we can't complain since we ordinarily would have been long gone from the hotel on a usual morning. The staff were great, the concierge was very helpful, and the breakfast plentiful. We didn't fall in love with Berlin like we hoped that we would, but it could have been us more than the city, since we were tired and the weather was extreme. We'd like to return in the summer to check out the things we missed and hopefully get to know the place a bit better. Would I stay at the Hilton again? Probably, since the location was good and the hotel was really very nice, but perhaps I would be tempted to try somewhere with more character.

Reviews.Title: “Service was tops!”
Reviews.Author: cubuff1453
Reviews.Content: We were here for New Years weekend and it was prefect. The Hilton Berlin is located right on the Gendarmmarkt and near everything! Location is ideal for seeing all the sights of this fun city. The Hilton Berlin gets top marks for the service. Everyone we encountered working here was exceptional. The front desk staff from check in and check out were smiling and very helpful and friendly. The concierge was super and all of the housekeeping staff was always smiling and had a greeting everytime we passed. The bed was huge! The room was very clean and nicely appointed. This hotel was first class all the way. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay and New Years weekend one to remember! Already looking to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - could be much better”
Reviews.Author: jj2221
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a relatively good location although i still prefer th west berlin side for convenience. The service was ok, although could be better and the rooms are now in need of refurbishment. The breakfast was excellent but there was no atmoshere in the bar in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DylanV
Reviews.Content: The Hilton has done what it does best, and that is create an amazing hotel. The rooms are very spacious, with great views over courtyards or main attractions, the staff are extremely helpful, and the services added on to each room are well worth the price. The breakfast is a little pricey, but has nearly everything you might want to eat, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service-Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler280
Reviews.Content: For a large hotel group like Hilton the Berlin hotel was better than we expected. First, the staff was very helpful. We arrived Berlin without our luggage and when we advised the staff they were helpful in being alert to our dilemma and watching for bags being delivered from the airport. Additionally, they were very helpful in arranging reservations at difficult to get into restaurants. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is in Statdt Mitte with a UBahn station right outside the front entrance. The hotel is an easy walk to major sites; Unter den Linden Strasse, Brandenburg Tor, Museum Insel, Potsdamer Platz, Alexander Platz and the shopping on Friedrichstrasse. The locale alone is worth the stay. Our room was clean, airy and had plenty of light. We had a deluxe room on 7th floor. Restaurants nearby; Lutter and Wegner (try their sauerbraten) and Augustiner am Gendarmenmarkt and Aigner. All very good. The buffet breakfast was also very good. We will stay at the HIlton again on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, service, facilities & more”
Reviews.Author: MrsOCLondon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - lovely lobby with pianist playing while you relax. Beautiful Christmas trees. Excellent friendly service offered by all staff that we encountered (reception, concierge, health spa, bar) and all could speak good English which was helpful to us as our German is poor. Our room was a typical size but our bed was large and very comfortable. It offered all facilities we needed including tea & coffee making and iron/ironing board, free safe, towelling gowns and slippers etc. My husband was particularly pleased with the wide range of English TV channels. The hotel is in a brilliant location and easy walking distance to key attractions ie Christmas market, Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenberg Gate, even the tourist bus stopped close to the hotel. We had a room only booking and we were disappointed at the cost and choice of the breakfast and therefore we did not take it up. The pool area was lovely but you need to pay more for additional facilities, which is to be expected. We thought the hotel was a great base, was luxurious and we will stay again whenever we return to Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: Ferdinand
Reviews.Content: Very good stay on a hotel we got via the Priceline "bid for your hotel" website so was very please to get a bargain here. Location excellent, ambience really nice. Leisure facility great. A little bit clinical perhaps but thats just large chains perhaps. Stayed once at the Westin Grand nearby that was a bit better, but not much!! I suspect our room at the price we paid was probably the most basic type but the sleep quality and sound proofing was excellent Breakfast is expensive but a little tip is if you go to the cafe near the Stadt Opera they have a v good buffet for about 14 Euro a person

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: solomon5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this Hilton Hotel. It was easy to get to by public transportation and there was so much within easy walking distance. I have to admit that I used points for our one week stay and we did have access to the brand new (2 weeks old) executive lounge on the ground floor. We had breakfast there each day and afternoon sweets and/or evening snacks and libations several times. The lounge was very well run, starting with the email I received asking about my arrival time. I requested 11 am and the room was ready when we arrived at 11. All our questions were answered and the staff was efficient and helpful. The room was nice, newly renovated, and fairly spacious. We had a view over the courtyard and in spite of being near the elevator it was quiet in the room. One late afternoon and a Saturday morning were interrupted by construction noise that sounded as if it were in the room with us. Fortunately, it did not last long. We really liked the little snap out spotlights over the bed so one of us could read while the other slept. The bathroom was adequate and everything worked quite well. The tub has a high side and I was glad there was a grab bar to hang on to. There was plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The best part of the hotel, and it is all good, is the location. It is right across from the Gendarmenmarkt. There were lots of nearby restaurants, 2 great chocolate shops, shopping, the Ubahn just outside the front door, and an incredible Christmas market. We would stay here again even if we had to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elvira P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Berlin very much. Rooms were great. Thanks to this forum we knew of the construction and asked to be placed away from the noise. The staff was very eager to please the customers, great concierge service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small rooms, stiff staff!”
Reviews.Author: theodora_d
Reviews.Content: Great, location walking distance from Brandenburg Gate and the Museum Island. Great restaurants around and great shopping. The room (king size bed) was quite small for Hilton US standards, but comfy and very clean. I didn’t like that the bed had two small comforters instead of a king size one, definitely not convenient for a big guy or for a couple who want to snuggle while on holidays. Our room was quite chilly (colder than the hallway) and they couldn’t do anything about it. Also, the staff seemed to me that they chose not to speak good English when I started complaining about the temperature. The only person who was very nice and helpful with great tips about Berlin and with a generous smile was the evening concierge. Overall great location but the service was thump down and the staff were stiff. But again I paid only $100 a night so I could bear the stiffness and the room temperature, I loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Check on Construction Status”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 nights at the Berlin Hilton, booking through Orbitz and got a great deal (better than on Hilton site). We have been to Berlin before and enjoyed it so much, this vacation we wanted to include Berlin again and stay closer to the museums. The location of this hotel facing the most beautiful sq. in Berlin (Gendermarket) is ideal. Most websites show a ubhan stop nearby but in fact there is one right out the door - making it very convenient. Our room was very nice, a standard room which was comfy but we were concerned with the ongoing construction in the hotel, which as it turns out did not disturb us at all. You need to check though as this is a major reno and from what we could see was creating some great new spaces that looked wonderful. Breakfast buffet was over the top good for us...they had everything you could imagine and all of it top notch. We liked this hotel and will stay again if we can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Construction, construction, construction!”
Reviews.Author: jwl2672
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at a great rate through Priceline. Otherwise, my review would have been much harsher (at the $250 Expedia wanted per night) Perhaps because we paid such a low price, we were given the "privilege" of staying in a brand new updated room. That's code for: you'll be hearing drilling at 9am sharp right next door. The drilling and loud banging woke us up bright and early every day. The updated rooms are very nice. However, our tub was not installed correctly and had a nasty leak which meant that the entire carpet area outside the bathroom was soaked every day we took a shower. We didn't care too much (wore slippers) but told the staff so they can get it fixed before stuff begins to rot. Lobby is very nice also and the concierge is quite helpful and knowledgeable. Internet is priced ridiculously (15 euros per night I think?). Room service was ok, with the positive being that it's 24 hours. The pool is beautiful and we enjoyed it. Location is great. It only cost 23 euros to get from the airport to the hotel. Don't bother trying to take public transportation at this price. It is located right across from the French and German cathedrals. The following has nothing to do with the hotel: Berlin vexes me as a city. It is a city capital yet there is no life in it at all. The square the hotel is in is a major tourist site. Yet there were 2 or 3 tourists milling about, max. Same everywhere else. (Brandenburg gate, Parliament) Granted this is November, but Munich was packed with tourists. Also, Germans seem to be a grim lot with nary a smile except when they're drunk off their b in the brewhouses. I sensed a low level of racism or at least suspicion from many of them as I am asian. Also, no one seems to go out and enjoy nights out. We were there on a Thursday night and there were no parts of the town where it seemed like people gathered to meet up with friends and have dinner or a drink. Very strange indeed. I live in Manhattan, been to Paris, London, Madrid, Barcelona, Munich, Rome etc.etc and never encountered this absence of carousers. Champs d'Elysee is packed with people always. Brandenburg gate was practically empty.

Reviews.Title: “Location !!”
Reviews.Author: antan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a conference in Berlin I stayed again at an old `aquaintant` of mine - the Hilton on Gendarmenmarkt. This place came into age over the yerras and I was keen to see the renovations - an outcome with mixed feelings. The lobby looks more `stylish`, yet cold (not `cool`!). The rooms have been refurbished, but now they have this `look-alike` feekling to it one has seen just tooo many times.... Nothing wrong, in fact all very comfortable, but with (presumably) much money spent, a bit more of `character` could have been the outcome. Also the great and really cozy lounge on the 6th floor has gone (it was the highlight of each stay and worth the extra cost - for the feeling of a `home-away-from-home (always crowded, always filled but with a good `virbration` about it). Not to mention the fantastic view from there over the sqaure. That one gone is a real loss. It has been replaced by what hits the visitor immediately when entering with a feeling `oh no - not another of these Lufthansa lounges, please !!!`. Efficient, business-like, and entirely non-descript. Still, the hotel retains ist greatest location in berlin and its basement pool is a definte plus no doubt. I probabaly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was a very nice hotel with plenty of ammenities. We were only in Berlin for sightseeing, so we did not need to take advantage of the extras this hotel had to offer. This would be a good hotel for business travelers. It is in a good location for travelers that will be using the subway. It is also in walking distance to attractions, such as Check Point Charlie.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY, BUT TYPICAL HILTON ADD-ON CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: In spite of staying in Hiltons as a result of discount booking services, and being a member (reluctantly) of Hilton Honors, I will not recommend this or other Hiltons. The issue I have is that given the prices, the fastest way to get me annoyed as a guest is to charge outrageous prices for things that should be included or available at nominal fees: in particular WiFi and breakfast. If tiny coffee shops can offer free WiFi for the price of a cup of coffee, there is no reason why Hilton should charge over $30 a day for Internet access and $35 for breakfast. As one observer asked: "what could they possibly be offering for $35? Answer: nothing that you can't get for $10 elsewhere. The property is in a good location and there are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area. The U-bahn is in front of the hotel. Front desk service was exellent and no language issues here. Concierge is one of the best I have met. Room cleanliness and comfort were fine. Bottom line: stay there if you must. Its got everything. It's big and safe. But if price is a concern, there are hundreds of hotels in Berlin that offer nearly as much for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location. Newly Renovated”
Reviews.Author: ap200
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable newly renovated rooms. The location is excellent. Very close proximity Unter den Linden and literally across the street from a metro station. Side note: at no point did we hear any of the ongoing construction noise so this was not an issue at all. The staff was very helpful and polite. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for walkers.”
Reviews.Author: 214valentine
Reviews.Content: Location was good for exploring city on foot. Fantastic breakfast buffet. Front rooms face office building, so had to be careful not to be immodest. Ice available from dispenser on the floor. A/C was already turned off by early October and room got stuffy. Winter bedding was on, but winter wasn't here yet. No top sheet available, so it was sleep bare or under too hot covers. Front office staff helpful and courteous. Maids very gracious. Some small restaurants close by for casual meals.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and very central”
Reviews.Author: niki1l
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hiton for 4 nights 18th Sept with my partner. The hotel was being refurbished in areas which didn't cause us any problems or hear any noise and we got they stay at a good price. The staff were very polite and professional. The king bed room was very nice bathroom a bit small. The room was spotless at all times.Towels a bit hard. The breakfast was buffet style and there was a good choice of food. There were lovely big widows int he breakfast room with lovely views. We didn't use the hotel restaurants but they looked nice and were always busy. There is a lovely Thai just round the corner from Hotel called cha cha really fresh food at a reasonable price. There is a Hop on Hop off bus stop just across the road which costs around 20 euros each for a 24 hour ticket. It helps you get your bearings. It is worth getting off at the TV Tower and gitting the lift up as the views are sensational on a clear day. We also enjoyed a boat trip which cost aroun 8 euros each. Most of the sights are in walking distance. Ther are lots of huge department stores near by. There is a tube station right outside the Hotel, but we got a taxi from Schonefeld Airport which is around 10 miles and cost 40 euros on the way there and 30 euros on the way back. Lovely big chocolate shop along the road. Overall a lovely clean city with lots to see.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel - but issues w/ the door keys”
Reviews.Author: Second_City_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel really is a solid 4-star location. The lobby was under renovation at the time I was there but it still looked nice. Also, the rooms themselves are modern and comfortable; everything you would expect in a nice, fairly new Hilton hotel. The location was also terrific...easy walking distance to many places in East Berlin, including Museum Island. The major complaint I had was problems using the electronic keys to gain access to rooms. My key regularly did not work...and the people at the desk were less than helpful when I went down to inquire about it. I was w/ a group of people on a tour - and many people had issues getting into their rooms which unfortunately soured our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Dan1113
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited Berlin for a weekend getaway, and what a fantastic place to get to stay at! Parking easy nearby, and the location was great for walking around! The room was large and comfortable; we slept really well. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4- star hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: NormBC
Reviews.Content: For me this is a "yes, but" hotel for Berlin: yes, but only if you can get a room at an attractive price. The rooms here are clean and functional, but very utilitarian, with a lot of masonite and not a lot of room. Rooms miss typical touches seen in other 4 star Berlin hotels like the much superior Melia Berlin (where I stayed a long time earlier this month): much bigger sleeping areas with nice reading chairs, separate showers in classy well designed large bathrooms, good quality German style mattresses and duvets (the Hilton duvets and pillows are not even down), complementary water (the Hilton wants an astonishing 7 euros for one on offer), artwork, interesting hallways, etc. If you are out and about most of the day and want a clean place to wash and sleep the Hilton Berlin will be just fine. If you want a bit of a retreat from the everyday world, perhaps look elsewhere. I found the Hilton staff helpful and effective, but not more so that elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: profshanku
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Berlin for one night in June, 2010. We arrived in Berlin at noon and our room was not yet ready. However the reception was helpful and stored our luggage while we went sightseeing. The location of the hotel is great. Even though the underground station is very close, we were able to walk to all the sights. Brandenburg Tor was about 15 minutes away and so were the museums at Museum Island. We were given a room on the executive floor and the room was extremely spacious with a sitting area. Since we had a baby with us, we were provided with a crib, linens for the crib, baby towels and even some rubber ducks. Very thoughtful of the hotel. The lounge staff was very friendly - we were scheduled to take a train for the next part of our trip and the lady found out the timings for the train as well as the platform number. We had breakfast at the lounge and also some pre-dinner snacks. The hotel does allow pets, so you might want to keep that in mind if you have allergies. Overall it was a very good stay. I am not sure about the price though since we used our points. But the service was excellent and the staff was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Typical five star Hilton style”
Reviews.Author: JasoninNewtown
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin is everything you'd imagine a Hilton to be anywhere in the world. Nothing offensive, nothing bad. It's a good place to stay if you want no fuss accommodation. With a chep rate, you couldn't beat it I guess. However, West Berlin isn't a very interesting part of Berlin. While entirely pleasant, it's lacking in atmosphere being a very bland somewhat upmarket international shopping area. I'd suggest however staying somewhere in East Berlin as it has a better vibe, especially around the Kaiser-Wilhelm Cathedral area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and decent value”
Reviews.Author: deepakmohan
Reviews.Content: Location was incredible. Staff were very helpful. Rooms were well appointed. Chose overlooking the courtyard as they were newly refurbished. Just outside the tube station and so central that it was very easy to get around. All the sights are just there and so one did not waste too much time travelling and everything was within 10 mins reach - brandenburg gate, cathedral , checkpoint charlie and ALL of it. easy to get to Sachsenhausen from here and Potsdam. Can't get better !! The only issue I had was with the cost of the internet 17 Euros is abit much for 500MB and breakfast was not cheap - but I guess that is the Hilton standard you have to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel - Fine Location - Fine everything”
Reviews.Author: Citylaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this "East Berlin" hotel at the conclusion of our Viking River cruise from Prague. This Hilton located in what was the former East Berlin, is a very good hotel, with a nice location and good service. Since the cost was part of our cruise fare, I have no opinion as to the "value" received. The room overlooked an interior cour. It was quite spacious, with two sma lclothes closets, a full sized dreser and an excellent bath with the tub part of the tub/shower being long and deep enough for me (5'11") to strectch out and enjoy a hot soak. The room would be comfortable enough for a four or five day stay. The location is just off the Freidrichstrasse, which has returned to its pre WWII status as a Fifth Avenue for high end stores. The process had been about half way through on our last visit here in 2005. In fact, much of the mad East Berlin construction frenzy which followed the Wall coming down, has slowed, and the former two cities are truly back to one city. We had enough time for a walking tour guided by a Vikng staff member, to visit Checkpoint Charlie, and see the small stretch of Wall still standing. The morning breakfast buffet was really superior, my wife expecially enjoying the carrot juice made by a waitress in a blender while we watched. I had a small issue at the business center. I was on the net for only slightly over a minute at 0.35€ per minute, but when I checked out they said the charge was more than 7€. I siputed this and after a short conversation with someone, the Desk clerk removed all charges. his Hilton was very much more enjoyable than the Prague Hilton, which is also reviewed on this site. We ate dinnner at the Lowenbrau Resturant around the corner and it was an okay typical German middle of the road restaurant. I thought my jaegerschnitzel was tough, but everyone else in our 8 person party from the cruise liked their food, and the price was quite reasonable; about 25€ for the two of us, including my wife's wine.

Reviews.Title: “centre of berlin”
Reviews.Author: MeandSally
Reviews.Content: the location is the best thing about this hotel, right next to the gendarmenmarkt, infact the hotel overlooks one of the twin cathedrals. they are doing some work in the hotel at the moment so the reception/lobby area wasnt that grand, just a room with chairs tables in etc and we did hear abit of banging in the morning (but after 8am). the room itself was a little on the small side but very nice. staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Berlin - the perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: adymu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hilton Berlin for almost 2 years. It's a really good hotel, and the money you are paying there worth every cent. The food is really good and the personal is really well-trained, polite and kind. The lounge for Status- Clients (Diamonds and some Golds) is not a big one, but it's really nice. The relaxation facilities (like sauna and pool) are fine, maybe the fitness area should be larger. The hotel is located in the center of the city, so it's a really good choice either for business or for travelers. Perhaps a minus point is that it is not too modern, it's quite an old-fashioned hotel (for me it's perfect, but probably it's not so good for somebody who wants something modern).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Conrad would be disappointed; tainted my view of Hilton brand.”
Reviews.Author: NYinTransit
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here and the decent rate I secured, I spent 2 nights at the Hilton Berlin before the business leg of my trip began. What a disappointment this hotel was. First things first, the location is excellent, right outside the Stadmitte UBahn, walkable to most sites as well as Prenzlauer Berg. Beyond that, I have nothing good to say about this hotel. I booked a king-sized room but was given one with what I believe was a full-sized bed at best. As the previous reviewer mentioned, the bed is solid and not comfortable. The room was tiny, with no space to maneuver. In fact, there was not even a full desk in the room. The furnishings were very dated, as were the common spaces. The bathroom was low quality. The towels were frayed and the sheets had a stain on them. The toiletries were very cheap and low quality. The service was apathetic. When I asked the concierge to assist me in determining the train schedules, he acted as though I was asking him to move a mountain. The front desk personnel displayed a similar lack of interest in customer service. The "extras" were very pricey. Internet service in the room cost roughly $30/day and in the business center they charged $0.30 per minute. Hard to believe. This hotel advertises itself as 5 stars. But at best, I'd say it is 3 stars. I've been fortunate to stay in business-class hotels around the world and this ranks as one of the worst. I will not stay in a Hilton again (the quality of Hilton is variable; I've stayed in other Hiltons in the US that were more impressive, but the other one in Europe where I have stayed, in Brussles, is similarly disappionting). The hotel is undergoing renovations but I would not stay there even when they are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Penny-pinching 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: harry12345678
Reviews.Content: This is a real 5-star hotel, but they do economize on their rooms and services. They don't really have twin-beds, just 2 beds separated by a table with ONE reading light. And the beds are relatively hard (so the mattress lasts longer?). Apart from reading light, they also economize in the shower, where the shower-head is the simplest possible (no turbo mode), and one can expect water on the floor after the shower. There is free Internet for guests with laptops, but not for others. When inquiring, one is met by the stupid question of "Would you like to pay for 15 minutes, 30 minutes, or more?", for heaven's sake! No free Internet corner in that enormous lobby of theirs. Apart from this, breakfast is great, service is good, location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: jiffyhelper
Reviews.Content: Like all Hiltons a little bit of the USA, so the service is good and English spoken well and by almost everyone. Clean, comfortable and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the deaf”
Reviews.Author: heskyPrague
Reviews.Content: I don't complain about the price, service or location of this hotel. However be aware: the noise from reconstruction during my stay in early August was apalling. To be fair, the hotel moved our room when the drilling above was intorelable. The noise in our new room was less but extended. They started at 8.00 a.m.despite the fact that we were assured by hotel staff that work would start at 9.00. The Manager of this hotel really nedds to get his/her act together and not rent out noisy rooms at any price

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rate but they tried to extract more from us”
Reviews.Author: Oscar53
Reviews.Content: This hotel disappointed us. We got a great rate through Trip Advisor but on arrival were told, at 4pm, that our room was not ready but that we could have a room with a view for an extra 100 euros. We declined, but suddenly our room was ready. When we opened the door the room was great - and it did have a view of an internal garden which was lovely. Were they seeking an extra 100 euros to make up for our cheap rate? Also, the water was lukewarm so we didn't ever have a decent shower - not what you'd expect of a Hilton. They also charged heaps for internet use, which was advertised at 10 euros per hour but seemed to come out at much more.

Reviews.Title: “Just not what it should be - too dark, small rooms, a pity for the great location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiversity
Reviews.Content: The former communist regime did a lot to turn East Berlin into an example of their success. At least they tried to. Just before the Wall fell (in 1989), they had started to built a new hotel at one of the most prominent spots – right on the South side of Gendarmenmarkt. Hilton bought the almost finished building site and turned into their flagship venue in Berlin. At least the tried to. The raw material they took over from the socialist planners did not allow for a lot of creative realisation. The hotel has two (terrible) back yards around which many (most?) of the rooms are arranged. The ceilings are too low to make you feel comfortable, and the very American style is quite misplaced (but then, did US chains ever care?). Some years ago, I stayed on the exclusive Executive floor, which did not feel special, and last time they booked me into the newly renovated 5th floor, and again, it felt more like a standard, OK kind-of accommodation. The rooms are too small to make any good impression, and the air condition worked poorly (in the newly renovated room!). Breakfast became quite good over the years, with a lot of freshly made dishes and a super view on Gendarmenmarkt. In any case, the location is the biggest plus of Hilton Berlin. And the staff was also a positive surprise as Berlin is not famous for friendliness or customer-focus, and neither are large hotels. Let’s give it another chance in a year or so, when they will have renovated the conference facilities and the lobby, which currently is terrible 1990s staircases and small fountains, brass and brick (sic).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: baringham
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. You are right by the subway and near many restaurants. The only problem we had was checking in. We got there at noon (after flying all night) and there were 4 employees checking people in. We were second in line but it still took 40 minutes till we were able to check in. I don't know why such a simple function is made so difficult. The rooms are nice and the a/c works well (it was 37 C). The hotel is in the former East Berlin but you are in a pretty high end neighborhood. The breakfast buffet is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms. Fab view. Close to perfect!”
Reviews.Author: vashonsialnd
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of choices for hotels in Berlin, and some are classics on the "hot" lists and all that. I went with Hilton because the price was good and the location really outstanding. I'm glad I did. I had an amazingly big, beautiful room that looked straight out on the cathedral. The room was sumptuous, every amenity and spotless. The bathroom was also huge, with a whirlpool soaking tub, separate shower and tons of soaps and lotions. The front desk people could not have been nicer or more helpful--in fact, they seemed better informed and more accommodating than the concierges--one a young woman who kept saying she didn't know anything, she was new, and the other a rather dour older man who was surprisingly brusk and uninformed. He was the only person in this hotel that was less than incredible.The lobby cafe had the best coffee I had in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property with Air Conditioning in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: itsmyturnow
Reviews.Content: very well located (at U2 stop) in east berlin. stayed in renovated section....quiet, clean, and wonderfully airconditioned. great pool and fitness center and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are improvement”
Reviews.Author: LaowaiInChina
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of time. Service and food is good, rooms are clean, but outdated. Stayed in newly renovated room this time. Bit dark in style, but improvement from previous "GDR" look.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel with AC”
Reviews.Author: IBSELLN
Reviews.Content: The AC simply did not work, blew air but it was never cold. Laid in bed unitl wee hours of the morning trying to fall asleep, sweating for the 2 nights I was there. Not a place to stay in the summer Told the front desk, they said that that was as good as it got. Internet was awful, and they charged me for it. I could have gotten faster dial up than the supposedly High Speed they claimed. Consiegre was amazing, guy knows the city. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A good five star”
Reviews.Author: Virginifer
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get the Hilton as a mystery five star. Located near the Concert Hall and within walking distance to the Brandenburg Gate. We were given a newly refurbished room. It was very nice. BBC on cable. Wifi at a fee. We would recommend this hotel for the older set, 45+. We stayed three nights in East Berlin as well and found that there was a lot more going on in East Berlin for young people. That aside, it was a really nice hotel. It is currently being refurbished but there were no noise issues for us.

Reviews.Title: “Check out Hotwire for good deals”
Reviews.Author: larsms
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire and paid just 99 dollars a night, I'd say that's great value. If you see a 5* hotel in Tiergarten on Hotwire, this is were you're probably ending up. I would not have paid the official rate for this hotel on other sites, though. Weird pricing policy! Rooms are as expected, the pool and fitness area are pretty good and the location is not far from Unter den Linden. Internet was not free, but fast. I really appreciated the frontdesk and concierge service. Professional and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Solides 5-Sterne-Hotel in bester Lage”
Reviews.Author: furana
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Singapore via Frankfurt in Berlin with Lufthansa, and as often, our luggage did not make it. We called the Hotel a couple of days in advance to see if we could get an early check-in, but they said it will be decided on the day of our arrival. We came at 10am to the Reception, and they said that we would have the choice between checking in immediately, or to get an upgrade to a higher category room (we have the Hilton GOLD status) but then we would have to wait until 13:00h. We took the "get-the-room-now" option, very quite room, everything we needed was there, also our request for twin beds was fulfilled. We asked if there was a chance for express laundry service, and were told NO PROBLEM! In addition, they gave a breakfast voucher for 2 - because they said that there might some renovation work that might be disturbing. However, we did not hear anything and did not feel disturbed, so it was a nice gift to enjoy the breakfast buffett the next morning. Overall very good service, friendly and efficient. The concierge was a little bit over-efficient and could have been a bit more warm-hearted and less formal. Since this was not our first stay, the Hilton Berlin is really very good, particularly given its location at the Gendarmenmarkt with lots of very good restaurants and bars plus it is very near Friedrichstrasse (good for shopping!) and Unter-den-Linden (good for sightseeing and walking under trees) and the Brandenburg Gate. For those who love running & Jogging: The Tiergarten is about 5-10 minutes away, a lovely green place in the middle of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: ibnova
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sister and my nephew since she had a seminar in this hotel. I got to relax and enjoy Berlin city while she was working (poor her) The hotel was great, the bathroom was big, I had a little room with sofa, and it was filled with amenities, like chocolates, water, and the other usual amenities. I went shopping around, it is centric and walking distance from tourist sites. Its a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel which made our trip to Berlin awesome”
Reviews.Author: LoveMonster
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin around Easter time, and the hotel was beautifully decorated with eggs and pastel ribbons. It had a very relaxing lobby with a water fountain inside. The people we met were very nice and friendly, and in the evening there was a piano player in the lobby and it created a great atmosphere. The hotels location was really good; it had two BIG famous churches across the street and a big square. And when the sun went down the sunlight hit the churches and created a warm yellow glow. The location was quite near to almost everything, for example Check Point Charlie and bits of the Berlin Wall. It was also quite near to the Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden, maybe you had to walk a bit but not much, and along the way you find other great sites and parks, and there was always a tour bus nearby to hop on. There was many good restaurants around the area and also a mini mall, if you felt like shopping. The breakfast at the hotel was a big buffet, with big windows overlooking the churches. I really recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Berlin :D If you want a view of the churches (which is the best) you have to get a room at the front of the hotel. And I forgot to mention the famous old chocolate store down the street; it was the most beautiful chocolate store I've ever been to, with sculptures of famous buildings in Berlin made with chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five star hotel service”
Reviews.Author: cestlaviebaby
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and another couple of friends were in the Hilton Berlin for 3 nights last week...let's start with the good points...Location is amazing, close to many excellent restaurants and shops. Walking distance to some attractions. The breakfast was excellent and the rooms nice and clean. I found it to be a huge problem because this being a 5 star hotel had really poor service, no doorman at all, no bellboy...we had to carry our own luggage, wanted to ask for taxi during the night and there was absolutly NO ONE to help us with that, even in the reception after 10:30pm there was nobody to help us with that. The concierge gave us many disappointing directions, as for example my husband was sick and I wanted to buy him some medicine on saturday around 6pm, the concierge told me would be a pharmacy open, but was too busy with 2 young girls giving them tips on where to "go out" at night, and didnt give me any explanations...I went to the pharmacy (around 4 blocks away...wich is a lot for a 8 months pregnant woman) and when I got there it was closed!!!!! When I came back and told him, only then he told me I should ring the bell (????), but this I could never know, as Im not german...and dont read german!!! Im a Hilton Diamond member and should get room upgrade to the executive floor...and didn't...anyway, their lounge is not a big deal at all, poor breakfast, only 1 computer for ALL lounge guests use...no wireless internet in the lounge... In another words...nice hotel, but really not worthed the price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “close to everthing but away from trafic”
Reviews.Author: drfruenk
Reviews.Content: The Hilton hotel in Berlin is nice, luxurious hotel close to Gendarmenmarkt. This means that it is close to many business offices in the city center, as well as to shopping centers and areas. It's not far from many of the city's highlights: Brandenburg gate, Museumsinsel, cathedral, Alexanderplatz... The hotel is very elegant and noble, from the reception to the rooms. The staff was very attentive. Obviously, the location and the service come in for a price, but if the price is affordable I can just recomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A/C vent noise. I would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Travellingman69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 night as part of a Trafalgar tour so the stay was not by choice and we had a standard room. The hotel is in a good location next to a subway with many restaurants nearby also Many of the tourist attraction like 15 minutes walk to Checkpoint Charlie and its Museum, Brandenburg Gate. The room was average sized looking like it just about needs redecorating but it had a flat screen TV and king bed which was comfortable. The bathroom, which included a bathtub, was also average sized. The main problem with the room was the loud noise coming from the A/C vent also the A/C did not cool so the room on the first night was too warm and we slept badly. On the second night it was too cold and later at night it was too hot again. We asked a couple of other people in our tour if they experienced the same problem and they said yes. A hotel of this class should not rent out a room with a loud vent noise and poor air conditioning even in a standard room. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice and good quality food. Nevertheless, if I had a choice, I wouldn’t stay here again and would look for another hotel in the area. Pictures are attached Happy traveling

Reviews.Title: “Excellent offer”
Reviews.Author: rogerinbcn
Reviews.Content: I wa sbooked at this Hilton through an incredible offer, otherwise it would not have been my choice. The hotel is modern, staff very helpful and it is really centrally located. U-Bahn at the hotel door and a nice walk to Unter den Linden. Breakfast was OK, not the best I ahve sampled at similar quality hotels. Good choice if you find the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: Hilton Berlin is a wonderfully located and elegant property. It is perfectly situated right above a U-Bahn station and within a few minutes walk of tourist attractions such as Checkpoint Charlie. Concierge was always ready to offer advice about places to go and see. The Restaurant Mark Brandenburg has some excellent local specialities to try as well. Overall an ideal property for a pleasant couples citybreak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meercat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton for our anniversary and for a Hilton it does what it says on the tin. The room was lovely but as ever for a Hilton the room temperature was soaring and it appeared the air conditioning only worked during the day and not at night so we had three nights of little sleep. The staff were so lovely and very attentive and nothing was too much trouble which was fab! Breakfast was a dazzling array of food and you really could get anything you wanted from healthy through to gut busting! Location wise it was a perfect base from which to explore the city .

Reviews.Title: “Way Overrated”
Reviews.Author: BornTraveler
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, I reserved the room through Priceline that had it listed as a 5 star hotel. I used Priceline in a number of major cities in Europe on my recent trip, and this was easily the most disappointing hotel. In fact, I had few if any complaints about the other hotels. No way should this hotel should be rated a 5 star and I told Priceline as much. If I had to rate the hotel, 4 stars is the most I would give it. The reception floor was alright but certainly nothing to set it apart from high-end but ordinary hotel. The room that I had for three nights was extremely disappointing. There was absolutely nothing in the room that could be associated with luxury. The room was plain with amenities that I would associate with Motel Six than an elegant hotel. I recently spent a night at Hampton Inn in Buffallo, New York, a couple of months ago, and that room would run circles around the room I had at the Berlin Hilton. I would give the hotel a good service ratinga, however, it was based upon an incident that I blame on the hotel. On the first night,, I was trying to a short nap to shake off the jet lag. As soon as I had fallen asleep, at about 7:30 p.m., I could hear drilling and banging coming from somewhere in the hotel. I called reception, and when I reported the noise, I was told that two floors below, they were remodeling the floor but that the work was to have stopped at 6:00 p.m. everyday. When noise continued, I called reception and requested that someone come up to my room. Within 5 minutes, someone was at my room, and when she heard the noise, she immediately went down to the area of the noise and within minutes, the annoying sounds ceased. The other thing that I liked was the location of the hotel and the fact that the metro stop is virtually in front of the hotel. In sum, I would not recommend this hotel to others unless they could get the room at a price lower that the amount that is now being asked for the hotel and is not looking for an elegant and luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Disneybears
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, we didn’t select the Hilton Hotel Berlin for any reason other than the fact that we were bidding on a five-star hotel in East Berlin on Priceline and our offer was accepted at the Hilton. That being said, we could not have been happier with the hotel – it met all of our expectations of a five-star hotel and was in a perfect location for tourists. Although you can take public transit from the main airport to the hotel, if you are traveling with luggage, you might want to consider spending the 20 Euros for the short cab ride and save yourself some of the hassle of navigating stairs and turnstiles with bags in tow. The lobby of the hotel was quite striking – I was especially impressed by the water feature which ran by the lobby lounge where they were serving tea. Check-in was effortless and we were assigned to a very large and well appointed room with doors that worked like a French Balcony. We were especially impressed with the bathroom. Aside from the usual luxury amenities (fluffy towels, high-end toiletries), our room was equipped with a heated mirror. It was so nice to be able to step out of a steamy shower and actually be able to use the mirror. We did not avail ourselves of any of the restaurants in the hotel as there were so many other choices in the area – and the prices were somewhat extreme. (Sorry, I refuse to pay upwards of 20 Euros for breakfast.) We did, however, avail ourselves of the swimming pool which was fabulous. We both found ourselves wishing for more time to just relax and hang out at the pool. All of the staff we interacted with was very friendly and exceptionally helpful. We were especially impressed with the concierge staff. Not only did they provide us with great recommendations regarding things to see and places to eat, they were quite helpful in getting us driving directions to the airport and in figuring out the GPS in our rental car. Like my fellow travelers, we found the prices for the internet, mini bar and laundry to be exorbitant, however that seems to be endemic with all luxury hotels not just Hilton so we can’t slight them on that. (Though perhaps Hilton could be the first buck the trend and provide free internet and self-service laundry facilities…) We certainly wouldn’t be disappointed if we got the Hilton the next time we Priceline a hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: connor200
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Berlin in February 2010 for two nights with a friend. Taxied to the hotel from Tegel Airport which was pretty quick and around 20 euros. The hotel is close to Stadmitte U-Bahn so you could catch trains if didn’t want to taxi. The hotel lobby is fairly grand and at first glance quite impressive. Check in was easy being a Silver HHonors member and my room was changed no probs from a king to twin. I had pre-booked online with an advance purchase rate so I was pleased that changing to room didn’t cost me anything extra. After checking in and heading to the room it was clear that the hotel really does need renovation. It’s very 70/80’s and has the feeling of being formally 5 star. The room wasn’t too bad, quite big by Europe standards. Bathroom was average size and like the room, needed renovation. In room Internet was expensive – around 20 euros a day. Spent most of our time in Berlin out of the hotel exploring so it really didn’t matter too much what the hotel looked like. Good location being close to train stations and only minutes to other historic attractions like Checkpoint Charlie. Overall, was a good stay but I’d probably chose to stay somewhere else next time I’m in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndn1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the heart of Berlin being a few streets away from Checkpoint Charlie and in the middle of a lively area with music, museums, bars and cafés. I couldn't imagine a better location for a hotel in Berlin. The hotel itself is stunning. Very classy even for a Hilton hotel. A spacious reception area with an open bar, live piano music at night and a sense of luxury. The rooms are very good and the Hilton breakfast is as a Hilton breakfast always is - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCanucks_9
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend break with the family in a Deluxe Room booked on the January sale rate and was extremely impressed by this hotel. It is centrally located downtown a few feet from a U-bahn station and Friedrichstrasse (shopping). It's also an easy walk to many of the historical sights (Check Point Charlie is 5 min walk). Street constuction nearby added a couple of minutes to our drive but did not cause any noise issues during our stay. So back to the hotel. This Hilton is very new so is modern and well appointed. The deluxe room we booked was 600+ Sq feet configured in an "L" formation so it was easy to accommodate our two small kids. The service from the hotel staff was what really made this hotel stand out. They really beant over backwards to accommodate our needs (our kids are 3 and 1, so we seem to have LOTS of needs these days). Breakfast is excellent even by HIlton standards (kudos to the service staff in the main restaurant), and the pool/fitness area is top notch. Great executive lounge as well. This Hilton gets a big "Thunbs-up" from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: gone_tripping
Reviews.Content: Must commend the hotel. The rooms were great. I say rooms because although we got a nice room with a courtyard view, we had to move . The bathtub pipe seemed to have burst and we had a flood. We received instead a deluxe room with a view to the cathedral, but unfortunately, as every hour of our short break counted, we missed out on one museum visit because of the mess. Tthe hotel staff were wonderful when my wallet was stolen, helping me call to cancel credit cards and get in touch with my husband. While we were there the hotel was full due to a convention (Jehovah's Witnesses) and breakfast was packed and the lobby was always swarming. I would have preferred it quieter and more relaxed, but the staff were coping so we couldn't complain. Altogether a great hotel considering the good deal we get (easyclicktravel).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quick to train station, subway at the front door, good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nyc2cal
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific Hilton - very fine service, truly comfortable rooms - the location is terrific. Walkable to Brandenberg, Checkpoint Charlie, to the museums...the subway is directly at the front door. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: RedCzarina
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely, the location was great, the service was first class. I had such a nice stay at this hotel. The staff are truly amazing. And great pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1202
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel where you can't beat the location. You can walk to all the sites from this hotel. Great shopping and ample selections of restaurants are everywhere. Public transportation is across the street. We had a car and finding the hotel was easy. Berlin is an easy city in which to drive. Our room was large and the service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but more like a 3.5-4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right across from the Gendarmenmarkt and right across the street from the Stadmitte subway station. The hotel is nice but I do feel it is a bit over rated as a 5 star hotel. The rooms are clean but they are a bit old and tired looking for a hotel billing itself as a 5 star hotel. Luckily, I got a great rate for the hotel but the regular rate for the hotel is a bit high for what you are getting. The location is great as you can walk to most major sites in Berlin fairly easily. Checkpoint Charlie is about a 10 minute walk away and Brandenburg gate about a 15 minute walk away as well. The area of the hotel had lots of high end shops but was a bit more limited in terms of restaurants. The ride from the airport was fairly quick and about 23 Euros. You can also take the public bus that drops you off a few blocks away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas stay!”
Reviews.Author: Andykn3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton from Boxing Day for 3 days. First time visit to Berlin. Booked the hotel through Cresta Holidays and got a combined flight/hotel package. Hotel is in a great central location with a U-Bahn stop right outside the hotel. As expected with a 5* hotel everything was of a high standard. The staff were very friendly and the choice of food for breakfast was excellent. Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - But way over priced internet charges”
Reviews.Author: DublinRobert
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, Clean, Good staff, I would say 4 star. But 24 euros for internet or 10 euros an hour is way too expensive. Apart from that the hotel is well located, But I would not recommend you work from Hotel as it will cost you.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: AdamEngland
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Berlin, we could not have picked a better hotel, located on a quieter square with metro station access outside the door. Right next door is the most amazing chocolate shop that sells every conceivable type of chocolcate know to man and the cafe has about 20 different types of hot cholcoate, if we had stayed any longer we not have made it out alive. The Hotel, was classy and understated, Rooms were clean and spacious with a good slection of cable TV channels (not that we watched any), The bathroom was modern and large. This Hotel was once the haunt of senior GDR firgues back in the days before the wall came down. The square opposite is delightful and there are some excellent restuarants within 1 minutes walk. It is about 8 mins walk to checkpoint charlie, and with the metro everywhere is easily accesible. If you are going to Berlin for the first time as we did, you really couldn't get much better location wise to take in all the city has to offer. Whilst being tucked away just enough for a little inner city peace. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “very well located, rather limited services and a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: Usual standard for that kind of hotel, the room was comfortable and nice although a bit a small (a single armchair). Internet connexion was prohibitive and the "business center" was a joke (2 computers behind a rack of glasses... but still at 5 euros for 15 minutes!). Rip off on that side. The sauna is not free either, which is highly unusual in Germany. In summary a good hotel, perfectly located but just choose it if you've got an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a few rough edges”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPoland
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located and generally runs well - as any Hilton should - but there were too many rough edges for a top quality experience. Phone in room 6093 took two days to get repaired during this time only out going calls could be made, the room could not receive calls. Number of people on duty at the operator was too few. When calling in to hotel one listens to a very long message and then I waited for 3 minutes one time for my call to be answered by the operator on duty (at 1800). Only 3 of the 4 main elevators worked so one often had to wait for a second or third elevator to arrive to go down to breakfast. When moving between rooms the extra bed was forgotten to be moved. So as you can see nothing absolutely crucial is wrong just lots of small things that should not happen did happen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steph181
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel , excellent location, very clean rooms , excellent staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location & stay”
Reviews.Author: SkyE5
Reviews.Content: As previously mentioned, Hilton's location is a real advantage for both turists and business travellers. Check-in was quick and efficient - new guests were offered a dvd issued on the 20th anniversary of the Berlin Wall removal and covering different moments throughout the history of the Wall. Rooms are clean, spacious and easily meet one's expectation - minor negative point was the water spot on the floor of the bathroom each time one took a shower. Dinner at hotel's restaurant is expensive but yet tasty, service okay even though there is place for better. Lounge bar was nice but beware of the prices your're charged for, you may ask for something and be billed the highest price of the product. Availability of international newspapers could be much appreciated by business travellers. Breakfast buffet was generous, service okay and clean area. Averall score is very positive and would recommend this hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Berlin is first class”
Reviews.Author: helovesher
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Berlin was great. I was there for 3 nights and from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out the staff was very professional and helpful. The room was bigger than I thought it would be based on the reviews I read on this site. The cleaning staff did a wonderful job in cleaning the room. The breakfast buffet was included in my room-rate and it was first class from the service to the offerings. The scones were delicious. The hotel is perfectly located as it is across from the Gendarmenmarkt where the Christmas Market was taking place (great Christmas Market). The U-Bahn line 2 is in front of the hotel and two blocks away is the U-Bahn line 6. I was able to get off of the U-6 and walk to the hotel in less than 5 mins with luggage. There are also several restaurants nearby as well as a nice bar/lounge. Next time I'm in Berlin I will be staying at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard Usual Hilton, but that's Good, Right?”
Reviews.Author: scruffty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in November for business. The hotel was not cheap to book so I'd advise you get the earliest rate. We checked in late on Sunday after getting a 32 Euro Taxi from Schoenfield. Luckily the Hiltons own restaurant was open until 12 a.m. so we grabbed a quick, and expensive, bite to eat. The check-in was unusually slow but alright. The concierge again was slow and not that helpful unfortuantly. The room is a stanfard Hilton affair, box room, comortable bed, noisy fan heating etc. The only thing that really annoyed me was the shower over-spilled every day on to the floor due to a design flaw in the bath. Oh well! Breakfast again was a typical Hilton, very well stocked but on two occasions the hot buffet was cold. Check out was slow but fine. The local area was OK. The station is right out side so very convienent. There are a number of good bars are restaraunts in the area, and also a nice Christmas Market across the square if you happen to go that time of year. Check Point Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate are in reach by foot. Although the area of the hotel is quite sleepy, it only takes about 5 mins to start walking into the action, which was good for me. All in all, expect the expected. Just make sure you are patient and everything will be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Central and solid”
Reviews.Author: fkaway
Reviews.Content: This business hotel is easy accessible with public transportation as there’s the metro station „Stadtmitte“ literally outside the building. And with a comfortable walk you’ll get to Checkpoint Charlie as well as to the boulevard “Unter den Linden”/Brandenburger Tor. My twin bed room on the 5th floor was spacious, unfortunately the equipment was outdated but you'll find everything as in-room safe or flat screen TV plus a modern bathroom. A downside was the TV as it couldn’t be turned towards the beds without using your craftman’s skills. Service was good, breakfast was Hilton-standard and therefore hearty and with a nice view. I liked the fact that my superior room was facing the inner court therefore a quiet good night sleep was granted. There’s a halt for the sightseeing bus in front of the hotel. I'd choose this hotel again due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “1 star less than advertised”
Reviews.Author: zimbo22
Reviews.Content: A great location, and a nice hotel, but don't get excited about the star rating. If you looked at the pictures and said to yourself, "That room looks kinda small, and not very luxurious, but maybe my room will be nicer..." you are correct, and no your room will not be nicer. When was the last time you stayed at a luxury hotel that considered two twin mattresses pushed together a king size bed? And in honor of the fall of the Berlin wall, they have kept the same carpet and wallpaper from 1989, so you get a very authentic experience. Clean and well maintained, but dated. Other reviewers raved about the friendly service, and I would classify it as merely adequate. I called the front desk to ask for a late check out (check out was 1100). I was greated with, "Well, that depends on how late you want to check out." (read in a sarcastic German accent). The hotel was clean, great location as mentioned above, and the lobby was classy. For the discount price I paid, I was happy with the room and the experience, and I would stay there again, but I've stayed at much nicer hotels with lower star ratings.

Reviews.Title: “30th anniversary of the collapse of the wall”
Reviews.Author: awsculli
Reviews.Content: We attended a seminar at the Hilton, and arrangements were very good. The hotel is large and accommodating, with a multitude of different conference halls and rooms. Service is very good at all levels, from the reception desk (less than 1 minute wait at check in and check out), to the concierge (extremely helpful), to the restaurant facilities (better than normal Hilton quality). Located close to many sights it is convenient for tourists and business people alike. We coincided our visit with the 30th anniversary of the wall coming down, so Berlin was alive that weekend. A momentous weekend with a reputed 3 million visitors to the city. All hotels were full, but this did not detract from the service we received. There is a good business centre, but you had to pay for the internet, which in today's day and age is not what you expect. About 40 minutes from the airport, less out of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon61
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in April, 2009. The hotel is beautifully situated right on Gendarmenmarkt, a large beautiful square with two churches and a concert hall. I had a large room that faced the square. Couldn't have been better. Great location for walking around the city or using the subway. Walking distance to Potsdamer Platz to the southwest, really close to Unter den Linden to the north and then straight east to Alexanderplatz, with a number of interesting sights on the way. All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trinijap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Berlin for the first time and this hotel was located near most of the cultural and historical sites. We were upgraded to the Executive floor and had use of the Executive Lounge which was great. The staff at the hotel was super! i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but get an executive room”
Reviews.Author: MarkGD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit out of the central tourist area, closer to checkpoint charlie. We booked an executive room and thus had club access which made a big difference with free food and drinks just about any time and Internet as well. The room was nicely decorated but a bit smaller than expected for a Hilton. Service was very good and club lounge staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Esperanto-uk
Reviews.Content: With an underground station right outside the hotel, this is an ideal location for sightseeing. Walking to other sights, such as Unter den Linden is easy. Make sure you come out of the correct underground entrance. There are several. Why don't hotel websites give you such useful information. It is Stadtmitte station, follow exit for Gendarmenmarkt. Room was well equiped & clean. Nice swimming pool but it is a shame that you have to pay for the sauna. The main restaurant is pleasant & the food ok, if a little pricey. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hilton in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: JAJORI
Reviews.Content: I am almost a frequent visitor at Hilton Berlin. The staff is very friendly from the reception to the executive lounge. This time the concierge used a lot of time to help me with my bike rental and some addresses I had to visit during my stay in Berlin. The rooms are spacious, but a bit oldish. The design is a mixture on Tuscony from the 80's. A strange cigarett smell disturbed every morning in the bathroom. The public spaces are also dated. Ok, but no luxury either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: BingHill
Reviews.Content: As first-time visitors to Berlin we played safe by choosing a "known" hotel in a convenient location. Our choice for our break, 19 - 23 October, did not let us down. The city itself is a marvelous place to visit, with many sights to see, lots of superb shops to visit and an abundance of history to learn. The hotel is within walking distance of some of the principal tourist spots: Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag. Also, just a couple of yards from the hotel entrance is an U-bahn station which brings the rest of Berlin to within a few minutes travel. The hotel is a Hilton, which means that you will find the same facilities, decoration and quality you will find in Hilton's elsewhere. The Berlin Hilton did not let us down - but, we did not spend very much time at the hotel. We could not fault the breakfasts - plenty of everything was available: hot food, cold meats, fruits, breads, etc ....The staff were polite and helpful (although we did have a small problem one evening waiting over 30 minutes to be served in the bar). There is a restaurant at the Hotel, but we did not dine at it and cannot comment on the quality of food. However, the restaurant never appeared particularly busy in the evenings which was surprising as some of the other restaurants which we dined at (all were within a few minutes walk away) were extremely busy? Overall we enjoyed our stay in Berlin, a great short break city, that was made all the more pleasant by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable 7 Days”
Reviews.Author: Tonken
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Berlin for 7 days in July 2009. This is a nice hotel and very typical of other Hilton hotels. What I liked best is the location. It is literally walking distance to most of Berlin's attractions. Everything else is very accessible by the train station right outside the front door. I did not take advantage of the pool, spa or fitness room, but did use the business center on a couple of occasions. Room service and the hotel restaurant were just ok. I would recommend this hotel especially for the location. Great shopping, museums and restaurants are all close by. BTW, Berlin is a fantastic city and I would encourage everyone to visit this city so rich in culture and history.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed - service and location”
Reviews.Author: mlscott
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Berlin. It was a convenient location. Rooms were nice and clean- and even had a tub to soak in. We had an executive stay and the lounge area was amazing - as well as the service there...they greated you warmly and helped with plans to see the city. A good feeling inside the hotel. Would recommend it and would stay there again! Next time though, i would just walk to close by sights and wouldn't take the hop on and off bus. Used free wireless across street at a cafe...very expensive inside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “smallest room for an exorbitant price”
Reviews.Author: premitotic
Reviews.Content: for 300 euro a night, this is the smallest room i have ever stayed. smaller than a one-bedroom youth hostel. wow - i stayed on the 8th floor with no exposure to sunlight all day long. and the docration was mediocre at best. overall one of the most constrained experience i have had.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: joannb
Reviews.Content: From the check in at the front desk to the check out, our stay of three nights was excellent. Our rooms were clean, service was wonderful, buffet breakfast was more than adequate, they even gave us wine, cake and fruit to celebrate a birthday! The public transportation is right in front of the hotel and there are many great restaurants within walking distance. All in all, a fabulous trip!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel In Center Of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DieterK3
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel on Gendarmenplatz in the center of Berlin. The main boulevard Unter Den Linden, the Berlin cathedral and various museums, along with many restaurants are in walking distance. The hotel is well appointed, all rooms have private bathrooms, HDTV TV sets and there is a nice indoor pool and gym. The lobby lacks personality, however the hotel makes up for that with location and very good service. I did not eat in the various hotel restaurants, so I am unable to rate them.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Berlin hummmm”
Reviews.Author: porusky
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend a weekend with my partner in Hilton Berlin. Having seen a video on YouTube.com of a Asian gentleman taking a walk around his room, which looked like was located on a 3rd floor looking into the courtyard i thought to myself - oh well, you have a Gold Status u will get a nice upgrade. We arrived Friday - check in was quick and pleasant - we got to the room dropped our things and went out till 3am. Only next morning i realized that the room was a smoking room - reservation was specifically saying NON SMOKING (was it so hard to follow)?. Reception apologized next day and offered to move as they had plenty of non smoking rooms available (again was it so hard to pay attention to the reservation (requirement) - given the fact that probably the last smoking guest stayed in the room in 20th century, the room did not smell that is why it was not so obvious from the start that it was a smoking room. Rooms bathroom needs major re-do (6013). Room itself is just NICE. However i was not sure what was the fuss at the checkin in that i'm being upgraded to the executive level and a superior room cause it looked identical to what i saw in the yotube.com video on the 3rd floor. Access to the lounge was a huge benefit throughout the entire stay and the fact that we were offered to keep the room till 5pm without extra charges was a plus. The gym area was nice but i did not appreciate the rather rude manner of the gym attendant that told me to keep it down when i was trying to adjust the equipment to my height and it kept on sticking and making noise - id be nice if she would help and not just poke her head out of the massage room. Over all its a good hotel, but especially if you are a Gold/Diamond members do not expect much (friend of mine is Diamond and her experience was seamingly disappointing as mine).

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: taterrx
Reviews.Content: Sitting adjacent to the quaint Deutscher Dom (Square), this fine hotel was wonderfully located. A terrific chocolate shop on the corner (Fassbender & Rausch) and reasonable walking distance to the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, and Unter den Linden. Very nice accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: nate1879
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin as part of our family vacation to Germany last Oktoberfest. The Hilton was our Berlin hotel choice. This is likely the nicest Hilton I have ever visited, and by far the best staff! Kudos to Christoph in the lounge, he was fantastic with recommendations, directions, and all questions! The junior suite was a corner room overlooking a square outside. We found the location wonderful for all of our walking excursions, and convenient to the subway. We had dinner and cocktails one evening in the hotel, which was a very pleasant experience. Likes: Huge bathroom, nice room, great staff, superior location Dislikes: noise from the street in the morning Overall: If you are going to Berlin, and the Hilton is within your budget. Splurge for a nicer room, and you'll not regret it. Just ask for a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “excellent go at christmas”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireDeb
Reviews.Content: Room: we had 2 twin rooms on the executive floor they were large and clean. Beds were comfortable and we had excellent view. We had a little Christmas chocolate left on the bed every night. Executive lounge: this was one of the best lounges I have enjoyed at a Hilton, the free bar was excellent with a varied choice, and the choice for breakfast was very varied and was refill quickly. In the afternoon was a choice of cakes and when they were replenished they were not the same, and in the evening they offered hot snacks, which changed every night. Staff: we never had a problem with the staff they were very friendly and would do anything for you. We were Hilton diamond members, don’t know if that had ay thing to do with it. location: we stayed in December last year for Christmas markets, this was a great location as there was one straight outside the front door, you did have to pay one euro to get in however there was entertainment on every night (Berlin tenors were great.) next door to the hotel is a chocolate shop, well worth a visit. The sub is a very short walk away so getting round was easy. There is a shopping centre near by if you go to the bottom floor there is a great café, food was cheap but of a good quality. Recommendation: go to check point Charlie museum really interesting. There are so many xmas market in Berlin, have a good look for them and they are free entry. I am very picky about hotels and expect high quality and good service and this hotel for fills both. We are booking again to go this year, so think that says everything; if you have never visited Berlin before (I have 4 times) I would recommend Christmas the Christmas market really put you in the Christmas spirit. BEWARE though it is very cold there so wrap up warm, we had snow which was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional In Every Way A Perfect Week In Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ricsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from September 8 to the 15th. Everything we perfect. We were able to check in early. The staff was great. The service was great. The location was great. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. This was our first trip to Germany and this hotel made a great impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend The Berlin Hilton Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumjulie
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our qccomendations at The Berlin Hotel. It was in a very good location to walk to all the interesting sites. Being an American hotel, it provided nice towels and washcloths, which some hotels don't furnish. We ate breakfast there every day, and it was good. The concierge was very helpful in recommending tours and arranged a private driver to take us anywhere we wanted to go. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The gift shop was nice, too. Julie Troha

Reviews.Title: “As so many other reviewers: Excellent hotel on excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: BA-traveler
Reviews.Content: After arrival at the train station we took a taxi to the hotel, although there are also good public transport possibilities. Taxis from and to the Central station will cost app. 8-10 euros. After arriving, a bellboy immediately opened the door of the taxi and we were offered assistance with our luggage, always a sign of good service! The lobby is huge and nice; at the front desk were many employees, so we could check-in right away. Because of my Diamond HHonors status we were given an upgrade to an executive room at the 6th and upper floor. The room was of a proper size with good quality furniture in light colors, a nice bed, an easy chair with side table and a working desk with chair. There was a minibar and coffee/tea facilities. Our room was on the site of the Gendarmen Markt and the view was fantastic! The bathroom was sufficient and clean. The lounge is on the same floor and has also a nice view. They have excellent coffee from a good coffee machine, a wide variety in select tea bags and all kinds of soft drinks all day. In the afternoon they serve tarts and cookies, in the evening many hot and cold items, all very tasty and a different selection the two evenings we were here, together with an assortment of drinks. There is a computer available for free Internet. We had a rate including breakfast; we used this in the buffet restaurant.
