They have an amazingly wide variety in items and a cook to make eggs in a station as part of the buffet. It was superb in every way. What we saw of the breakfast in the lounge was also very good. We had dinner once in the Mark Brandenburg restaurant and it was delicious and reasonable prized, the latter is very special for a restaurant in a hotel. Service was somewhat less, however. The location couldn’t be better; we could easily walk to many highlights of the city. There is a metro entrance just in front and we took the metro several times. We had Opera tickets and it was very comfortable to use this line to go to the Deutsche Oper at the other end of the city. Within 20 minutes we were from the exit at the hotel at the entrance of the Opera House, using just one metro line. Being at the Gendarmen Markt and so close to the Concert Hall gave us another advantage. We wanted to attend a concert, but that was sold out on the website of the Concert Hall. On the day of the performance I went to the ticket box at opening time and could buy two tickets! Berlin is a wonderful city and we enjoyed our stay in this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, especially the location...”
Reviews.Author: tolayawearyhead
Reviews.Content: During August I stayed first at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie for 7 nights, and then moved to the Berlin Hilton for the last 3 nights. So a comparison may be in order. They are seven minutes walk away from each other - Checkpoint Charlie to the Gendarmenmarkt. Both are excellent central places to stay with convenient U2 and U6 S-Bahn at hand. Halfway between the hotels lies a good and well-stocked supermarket (Kaisers at north side Friedrichstrasse 60). The Mercure was a very welcoming hotel (and my warmest thanks to Liese and her colleagues for making it so). I had an internal room onto the treed rectangular courtyard; very quiet, with a pleasant balcony. The move to employ an Italian architect of note to design this hotel has certainly paid off: this was one of the most memorable hotel rooms I have ever stayed in, so beautifully thought out, spacious, relaxing, and just totally right in every respect. And unlike the usual cramped shower, the wet room was all a shower space should be. But the Mercure chain does need to think hard about not providing what is now taken for granted: bath-towels (necessary after an evening shower), toiletries (of which no shampoo, nothing), and bottles of mineral water. And the old TVs, which need upgrading, detract from the overall experience. I cannot comment on the food as I did not pay for breakfast, and cannot say that I found anywhere handy for it. As already mentioned in these Trip Reports, the computer at the ready in the foyer in a dedicated area was great to use and invaluable. To summarise: a great hotel in which to feel at home. The Berlin Hilton was similarly welcoming, and my warm thanks to Marieka and Rebecca for making my arrival and departure so pleasant. This hotel has a great setting onto the square, the perfect place to sit in the evening. I had breakfast in the hotel: attractive room (one area looks through onto the Square) with attentive and pleasant service; the food offered a wide, if not inspired, choice and made a satisfactory start to the day. Rooms can often mean a quite long walk. Compact and well-designed, I again had a quiet room looking onto a central courtyard with vegetable beds and glasshouses growing food for the hotel. Good modern bathroom with a proper bath, well equipped with toiletries and bathrobes. But not a room to linger in and read like the Mercure. The lack of a computer for general use has already been mentioned by others: this is a serious omission for travellers today (we don't all have laptops with us!). To sum up: better location than the Mercure but with a less enjoyable room. To eat: I ate several times at each of the following: Lungomare trattoria bar (Spaghetti puttanesca - excellent); Malatesta caffe ristorante (Pappadelle al funghi - excellent); Maothai aka Sisaket thai restaurant Mauerstrasse 76 (good lunch offers, overpriced in the evenings and empty). The two Italian are between the Mercure and the Hilton and reasonably priced. Guidebooks: if you take no other get Berlin (Everyman MapGuides) from Amazon. Brilliant! Pergamon: arrive by 9.30am unless you want to join a long queue (no pressure at the other galleries)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good service”
Reviews.Author: amidtun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Booked through Priceline and got a very good price. Asked for a non smoking room, and got a room that had been used as a smoking room earlier. We asked for a new room and got this at once. A man came and carried our luggage. We hada rate without breakfast, and breakfast was priced at 25€! We therefor ate breakdfast at the nearby restaurant Lowenbrau! A very good choice for 10€. Hotel is in walking distance from major attractions and U-bahn across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel. The best service, best staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela60
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed in the Hilton, Berlin and it didn't disappoint. It is in a great location for exploring. The concert house is right across the road, with restaurants and cafe's surrounding it. Within walking distance of all the major attractions ( the Brandenberg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc). The Underground station (stadtmitte), is just outside the hotel. You couldn't ask for more really, with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Nittie
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hilton Berlin for a five-night stay and it was a wonderful choice. Hilton provides a great class of service and consistency that was welcome at the end of a 16-day trip. We arrived by train and took a cab there only to find a subway stop in front of the hotel! It's an underground stop and so it does not destrop the ambience of the Gendarmenmarkt (plaza in front of the hotel). Two sets of elevators manage the movement of guests and it never seemed crowded to us. There is a huge breakfast dining area as well, so there was never a wait for our buffet breakfast. We'd pre-paid the room and included breakfast for a very good, low rate. The room was large for European standards, comfy mattress (twin beds here, but there are other options), two fluffy pillows, great AC, lots of hot water and pressure. We asked for a quite room, away from the elevators and were accommodated. We slept peacefully and it was quiet! The staff went out of their way to personalize the hotel with friendliness. Rooms were cleaned efficiently and new towels were hung. The sheets were changed each day. The breakfast was hot and cold, with many choices. One could order eggs made to order at a station, and the line moved quickly. The hotel was within easy walking distance of all the major sites. Checkpoint Charlie was about 4 blocks, German History Museum 5 blocks, Potsdamer Platz perhaps 8 blocks. It never took us longer than 20 minutes to reach any of these sites. We took the subway once or twice, but Berlin is a great walking city. There were many people here on business, so the business center was often busy. Even had we found space there, the internet charges are pricey. We bought an hour of internet time for 2 euros at Dunkin Donuts. This access code gives you the freedom to use the internet at any Dunkin Donuts in the city and there were several. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IrishWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hilton for 2 nights. As many travelers have stated, you can not beat this hotel for its location. You are within walking distance of all the sights and you have a U-Bahn stop right outside the door. Its costs EUR2.80 for the train (S-Bahn -S9 and change for U-Bahn) from Schoenfeld airport. The standard rooms are small(ish) and are comfortable for 2 people. However, if your traveling with a children you may have to upgrade to a larger room type as with the addition of a fold out bed, there would be very little space in the room. All in all a nice hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and excellent all round experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: I booked the Berlin Hilton through Expedia as a hotel and flight package. It was great value but I went for an Executive room which gave access to the Executive Lounge - strongly recommended. From Tegel airport to the hotel by taxi was 20 euros and took about 30 minutes. The location of the hotel is superb, right on Gendenmarkt with its lovely buildings and plenty of places to sit down in the evening for a drink and a meal. It is very easy to walk to most places from the hotel but we took out a Zone A and B pass most days which gave us unlimited transport (trains/buses/trams) as far as Wanasee which was 30 minutes away. Tickets can be bought from the machines at the station outside the hotel and there is an English translation if you press the button with the flags on. To go to Potsdam you will also need Zone C included but unlimited travel for one day for zones ABC was only 6 euros 50 which is good value and very convenient if you are tired and just want to get on a bus or tram for a ride outside the city.. The entrance to the hotel is grand and a pianist entertained at night. The bar looked rather unatmospheric so we decided to sit at the cafes in the square for a late evening drink as it was so warm. We were disappointed with the room as it seemed rather small but after moving some furniture around it seemed bigger and was OK. The air conditioning was efficient but I would have preferred a window that opened wider rather than the Health and Safety limiter which meant it only opened 6 inches. We faced the inner courtyard so there was no view but it was very quiet at night which was an advantage. Decor was fine, the bathroom was modern and the whole room was spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable and there were adequate provisions such as shower gel. There was a complimentary bottle of water each day and all in all it served the purpose. The Executive Lounge is worth every penny so I would certainly recommend paying the little extra for that facility. Breakfast could be taken in the Lounge or in the restaurant on the first floor whch we did every day. Breakfast was first class with everything you could want from yoghurts and various fruits to cold meats and cheeses, delicious breads, cakes which seemed popular but not for us at breakfast time, a selection of smoked fish and tomatoes, cucumber, olives etc, a hot selection of sausages, tomatoes, hash browns, baked beans, scrambled egg etc. There was also an omelette station or fried eggs. We requested poached eggs from the waiter on several occasions and they were freshly cooked. On Saturday and Sunday there is the inclusion of sparkling wine which was very popular with many guests, us included. Breakfast is served until 10.30am and 11am at week-ends. The Executive Lounge breakfast was far more modest but you could avoid the crowds there is you prefer. I liked the fact that I could go for a coffee at 7am when it opened and read the papers or go on the internet that was provided free in the Lounge, great for printing off boarding passes etc. Soft drinks, fruit and crisps etc are available all day as was bottled beer (Becks and Stella). In the afternoon cakes appeared and from 6pm until 8.30pm there were unlimited canapes of varying but good quality. Alcohol such as wine, sparkling wine, spirits etc were available in the Exec Lounge from 6pm until 11pm - a great facility. The staff of the hotel were in the main charming and attentive and overall went out of their way to ensure a pleasant stay. If we returned to Berlin I would go for the Hilton in preference to other hotels but if you can, as I have said previously, go for the Executive package. A few other bits and pieces of things we would recommend in Berlin. Make Fat Tire Bike Tours one of your first excursions. We did the Berlin City Tour the day after we arrived and for 20 euros it was great value. Even for a 60 year old, biking around Berlin and seeing all the sites was an easy experience. We also went to the Reichstag at 8pm in the evening. The queues were still there but shorter than in the day and it is free to go to the top and see the views. It is an easy walk to Checkpoint Charlie from the hotel. The Sony Centre at Potsdamer Plaz (two U metro stops from the hotel) is buzzy at night and worth experiencing to see how Berlin has rebuilt itself. All in all, we had a great trip to Berlin, enhanced by the facilities at the Hilton and I would have no hesitation in recommending it as a classy but not over the top hotel at a good price and with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “I wonder why Hilton Berlin still has 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: kobri
Reviews.Content: Let me say, usually I stay in Concorde hotel Berlin, which is a new 5 star moddle in Charlottenburg. This time we have stayed in Hilton because we were invited to the party which was quite around the corner, and we could spend our Hilton points on it. Well Hilton is a pretty old hotel (build 1992) and you can see it , and smell it immediately. The rooms were very clean, and everything was on the right place, but dull and worn out. There was a very specific smell in the room, and absolutely disgusting smell in the bathroom. Something like smell of old toilet and water pipes. You could see that the bathroom doors were in a poor condition because of humidity. The noise isolation was also not good enough, you could hear the traffic noise outside, and more irritating, every noise from the corridor. The staff seemed to be also worn out, since we haven't seen a lot of smile. We didn't have breakfast, since it was pretty overpriced, and you can get plenty of cheap and good breakfast just one step outside the hotel. My conclusion, the only one good thing about this hotel is location. It could be a good deal if you have some points to spend, because the regular Hilton rate is pretty expensive. You have plenty new and cheap 5-star hotels in Berlin. So Hilton would probably be always the last choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl64
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Hilton was a terrific hotel close to all the sights those visiting Berlin want to see. The lobby area is very large and nicely decorated. The room was a good size and had good amenities, including great bath products. The hotel breakfast, if not included in the room rate, is much too expensive at 25 euros per adult and half that price for children. Instead we walked down the street to a bakery and had terrific pastries and coffee for about 10 euros for all four of us. (The Einstein Coffee place across the street from the hotel is more expensive, so make sure you go out the front of the hotel and head to your right until the street ends, which is where the bakery is located.) One thing I would definitely recommend to those visiting Berlin is to take the walking tour. The two best companies are Original Berlin Walks and Inside Tours. The other "free" tours do not have dedicated guides, and the walking tour we took with Original Berlin Walks cost us 12 euros per adult and our kids were free. My husband and I both said it was the best 24 euros we spent. The tours usually run around 3-1/2 hours in length and give so much information that you would not otherwise get. In fact, this was my second visit to Berlin and I learned more on that tour than I did the entire previous visit. In summary, the Berlin Hilton will give visitors a great location where everything is within walking distance, and there are many wonderful restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - but beware Sunday morning church bells”
Reviews.Author: hidden_tiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during the weekend of Christopher Street Parade (Gay Pride). Had a good deal with 3 for 2 nights offer so the rates are quite good. We chose it because it is right in the centre of the City, literately next to Stadtmit metro station. So it was very easy to get around. We took the taxi from the airport & only took 15 minutes from door to door (no traffic jam) & cost just 17 Euro. The staff in the hotel is curtious but quite formal. I guess it is really a business hotel & tend to cater for older clientels. However they are very helpful & also very secure. You must have a room key to operate the lift so we generally feel very safe. The hotel over see the two grand churches & also the famous square infront of the National Theatre. So in the evening its quite well lite & very romantic walking along the deserted square. However, a word of warning, the church bells start rining on Sunday from 8am onward, and goes on & on (at least for half hour!) So if you were (like us) out late on Saturday night, you're get a shock early on Sunday morning for the 'wake-up' call. But that's the only time we noticed the bells, best not stay here over Saturday night if you want a lay-in. They are have a good size swimming pool & small gym. Both are very clean & modern. The pool particular are always busy, but I went only in afternoon period, may be its quieter in morning / off peak time. The gym is open 24 hours, but you have to pay for the sauna & steam room. The sauna also allow mixed nudist use, so we didn't try it out. Overall this is a good choise if you want a base to explore the city centre. From the hotel you can walk almost everywhere easily. And if you want to venture further out, the metro station outside is a bonus. Would come again in future, but will definately not stay over Saturday night to avoid the over zelous bell ringers.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jammer54
Reviews.Content: Did I say great location? The hotel is situated within walking distance of many major sites and also has a U-bahn station right in front of the hotel. The Berlin Hilton is a very nice city hotel. Breakfast is good with alot of variety (although I've been to 5 star hotels with better breakfasts). My only real complaint is that the air conditioning in the room was more like ventilation. It moved the air around but didn't really cool the room. Kudos to Wolgang the concierge who really will help with any question and give good recommendations. I should also add that I got a great deal and was at the hotel for 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “worth the priceline price, not the rack rate”
Reviews.Author: cjohann
Reviews.Content: Got a room in the Hilton Berlin for €75.00 including tax from Priceline - at that rate, great value. Otherwise, a rather standard experience with carpets in need of a change and a smaller than average room. Would not recommend at the $200+ rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSaenz
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Eastern side of the wall. Within walking distance of Check Point Charlies. Metro entrance directly in front of the hotel. Staff was very accomodating and helpful. Valet parking for an extra fee. Fabulous breakfast that came with our room. They did have high speed internet, but you paid extra for it and it was pricey in my opinion. We asked for a roll-away in one of our rooms for our third son (had to get two rooms) and staff gladly complied. The bed fit fine.

Reviews.Title: “Less than impressive”
Reviews.Author: dcribb
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the Hilton is never going to be a dive or really bad. I stay at the chain's hotel regularly. The Berlin Hilton has a top location but the inside disappoints. Lobby, restaurant, room all smacked of early nineties design and certain budgetary constraints. Breakfast was included in my room rate, but I would have been very sour had they made me pay EUR 25 for what was on offer. Nothing more than standard. Not one bit. WiFi in room EUR 22 per day, come on guys, get real. All in all, there are better deals in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: missussmithy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a mini-break to the city, thanks to a bargain airline and an even better 'top secret' deal on the hotel. The Berlin Hilton is in a perfect location for Checkpoint Charlie and all the sights, and has the Stadtmitte metro station right outside. The two cathedrals outside in the square are beautiful, and I'm sure the place comes alive with music and beer in the summer (we stayed at the beginning of March so slightly chilly for as fresco dining!). As you'd expect from a hilton, it was spotless and with all the nice little extras which come as standard. With a room only deal, we chose not to pay for breakfast which was around 20 euros, but there are plenty of places to eat nearby - including the cheesily named Snackpoint Charlie. The pool and spa is also gorgeous, and the perfect way to unwind after pounding the streets sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Best City Break with lots to do and see”
Reviews.Author: Lola006
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4 day stay at the Hilton in Berlin with good bedroom - clean and large room, twin beds, perfect floor and quiet Pool - perfect temperature and size Staff - attentive Location to city centre - perfect Trasport - perfect with an underground just outside the hotel Food - not so good - we got a bad deal for the £50 meal we had in the Hotel Restaurant, mine was the vegeterian option, so tiny, that it could have passed for a snack! Train to Airport no problem. Lots of good museums and shops nearby

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location for The Berlin Hilton”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: We are staying at Hilton Luxembourg (another story) and planned a 3-day visit to Berlin while in the area, only checking-out this morning! We were lucky enough to choose the weekend commemorating the 60th anniversary of the Federation of the Republic of Germany (23/24 May) and enjoyed the festive atmosphere. We were upgraded through HHonors to a corner junior suiite - 4096 - which offered close-up views of the beautiful French and German cathedrals in Gendarmenmarkt. The suite was approx. 8m x 7m and comprised an entrance hall, a lovely sitting room with three floor-to-ceiling windows, a sofa and 2 armchairs, a huge LCD tv and a business desk etc. An opulent double-handbasin, black granite with white tiled bathroom provided all the amenities and a nicely-proportioned bedroom with another LCD tv with lots of wardrobe space and drawers. The executive lounge was on the 6th floor and was very pleasant with some comfortable sofas and plenty of small tables and chairs set in groups of 2 or 3.There is a help-yourself system to the drinks, which was very generous and the food was plentiful and varied. The only downside was a very young child whose parents were determined to enjoy their drinks even though their son was running around screaming, quite obviously very tired and needing to sleep, so they half-heartedly took him out into the hallway but brought him back moments later. This detracted from the pleasant surroundings until they eventually gave up! Breakfast in this lounge was also more than adequate with choices to suit everyone, hot and cold, healthy and slightly less healthy! Staff were all very helpful and seemed to know the answer to any question! We did two of the Berlin Walks and would highly recommend them, "Discover Berlin" and "Potsdam". The hotel is within a short walk of Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate etc. and Unter den Linden is a beautiful area to walk around only minutes away. Buy a Berlin Welcome Card at the airport as it covers all transport systems and savings on many attraction charges. Incidentally, the train, subway and bus systems are to die for! I am sure they are the envy of most big cities, very efficient and frequent. This city has not given itself over to the car, thank goodness. Can't wait for another chance to visit Berlin and to stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to get on the concierge level”
Reviews.Author: Crazy Mimi
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and his wife and I just had a wonderful stay at the Berlin Hilton over the Easter Weekend. Our rooms were adjoining and even though our personal view wasn't great, the view from the executive lounge was truly fantastic. We met several nice people in the lounge, where we enjoyed delicious appetizers, drinks, etc. It was very busy and the staff was great. I've never seen such an assortment in any American hotel concierge lounge. I would highly recommend the hotel for location. The concierge made restaurant suggestions, but we checked them out and made our own way to several great restaurants and a good nightclub. We were right by the most beautiful square in Berlin and within walking distance of most tourist attractions, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, museums, bus tour, Jewish museum etc. All in all, a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alsace
Reviews.Content: We had a nice trip to Berlin this week and stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights. The room rate was 145€ /night which is very good for a centrally located hotel in a European capital (have a look at the prices in Paris!). You have the subway and cabs right at your doorstep and a 10-20 minutes walk to Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Kanzleramt, Unter den Linden, Humboldt University, Alexanderplatz, Potsdamer Platz, Tiergarten, Checkpoint Charly ...You are on historic 'Gendarmenmarkt', a beautifully restored place with a choice of restaurants and cafes. Don't miss the 'Ampelmann' store- the little person on the pedestrian traffic lights of the former German Democratic Republic. The Hilton is very clean and quiet with friendly staff, nice pool area, a good restaurant (Mark Brandenburg) and an excellent but expensive breakfast (25€/person). Our rooms were good sized (don't expect the US size, though) with all the amenities you want. You'll be right in the heart of Berlin feeling that unique mix of history and modern present, western and eastern Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location & Good Service”
Reviews.Author: JHBingham
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is very well located, with a subway line right in front of the hotel. The rooms there are very standard Hilton rooms, but are comfortable nonetheless. There are many restaurants within the hotel, but by far the best would be the excellent breakfast buffet. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hotelgmSolvang
Reviews.Content: in prior trips always stayed closer to the airport, this time I selected the Hilton downtown and was very impressed. the hotel was outstanding. there was a small problem finding my reservation at check in, but the front desk had me sit and relax while it was sorted out. in a few minutes all was set and I checked into a great room. there was a young bellman ( wish i had gotten his name) who was outstanding. very helpful and friendly. the breakfast was way to expensive, but that is typical of Berlin in general.

Reviews.Title: “Improved a lot ... Service at the Executive Launch did great Job#”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel many times, but this is my first review because we were pleased by the Service and the people. There are more fany Hotels in Berlin, but the location here is great. I booked two rooms using Hilton Points and I received an upgrade. The lady in the Executive Launch did everything to satisfy us (3 adults one teenager and a 16 months old baby. Food in the Executive launch for Dinner has room for improvement.... thats it...

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: saltspringislander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton across from the Gendarmenmarkt for 2 nights. The location was perfect. Good sights within walking distance, subway across the street, and a very well informed concierge staff to send us in the right directions. Les Galleries Lafayette a Berlin with its epicurean level,. Shopping Passages and Fassbinder and Rausch (for the chocaholic) all within steps Room surpassed the Hilton standards that we were expecting. Beatiful bathroom with a soaker tub. The high room rate charge was to be expected for world capital accommodation... but the add-ons were a little over the top. Parking exceeded 20E per day, Internet access was 22E per 24 hr period, Breakfast not included but available at 30 E per person. That is almost $150 nightly extra for "services".. Would we go back? In all likelyhood. It somehow had a good mix of services. Berlin has that vibe.... And did we mention location???

Reviews.Title: “good location but lacking in atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: vincon
Reviews.Content: Have recently stayed in this hotel. The room was fine though not particularly spacious. Nice bathroom though. The staff were efficient rather than friendly and the foyer/bar area was pretty devoid of any character. I certainly wouldn't pop in for a drink if I wasn't staying there though they do make a fine vodka martini! The breakfast was excellent.The spa looks lovely but the water was cold. Not very attractive in a jacuzzi. It is in a good location and within walking distance of several sights most notably the stunning Holocaust Memorial.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's 4.5 bubbles!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin definitely deserves it's 4.5 TA rating. I've stayed in a few Hiltons throughout the world and this was one of the best. Fantastically situated for a Xmas/New Year break. Directly opposite the Gendarmentmrkt for the Christmas Market and New Year fireworks/festivities (in which we partook!). Very family orientated rather than the party area down at the Brandenberg Gate. U-bahn directly outside the hotel on lines U2 and U6 which were direct to Alexanderplatz/TV Tower, Potsdamer Platz and Checkpoint Charlie with just a short 10 min or so walk from Potsdamer Platz northwards taking in the Holocaust Memorial to the Reichstag Building. All in all, brilliant for a short two day trip (which is what we did!). Service and rooms were great. Towels, slippers, easy to use room safe and very courteous room service. We even had a lovely view overlooking the Gendarmenmarkt. Taxis sit right outside the hotel (even at 6am) for your airport transfers if you wish. We didn't eat in the hotel as I had heard previously that it was a bit of a rip off but there are so many places in this area of Berlin, it really isn't an issue. It wasn't cheap but then it's a capital city and the exchange rate £/Euro is simply shocking at the mo so you get what you pay for. Highly recommended for family - we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillis_d_sa
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here over Christmas. The hotel was in an excellent location, super close to the U Bahn and 2 Christmas markets and lots of attractions in walking distance. We spent Christmas eve in the Trader Vics bar where we had a great time. The service was excellent and the cocktails were interesting! We had Christmas dinner in the Mark Brandenburg Restaurant, the food was good, however the service was a bit offhand at times, super at others. The we had a room on the 3rd floor and our friends were on the 5th floor. Both our rooms were a good hike from the lifts, while there seemed plenty of vacant rooms closer to the lifts. The rooms were clean and well presented. I think the décor was a little dowdy and not very modern. However this is just my personal taste. We asked to be in a non smoking room, however the halls in our floor had a very distinctive smell of smoke, which wasn’t very pleasant in the morning for us non smokers! My only major issue I had with hotel was an issue with our towels. We had hung up our towels to re- use in the evening (as suggested by the hotel if we wanted to reuse our towels). However we found that they had been relocated when they had made up the room and my sister and I had no idea who’s towel was who’s. The next day, because of this mix up we placed our towels in the bath (as directed by the hotel if we required new towels), when we came back to our room, the same towels were hung up again, complete with make up marks! I know it’s a slight detail, however its these small details that make a average hotel a great hotel. Overall not a bad hotel, the concierge and check in staff were lovely and they did grant us a late check out at no extra cost. I would stay at the hotel again, however its more of a hotel for people 40+ and families rather than 25-30’s.

Reviews.Title: “good luxus hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olli85
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good. It is directly at the "Gendarmenmarkt" and not far away from the street "Unter den Linden" and the "Brandenburger Tor". The underground station is only 50 meters away. The lobby is very beautiful an the staff at the reception is very friendly and helpful. The corridors and the rooms are not very luxurious. The bathroom and the flatscreen tv are the most modern things. The bed is very comfortable. I woud only recommend an executive room at the 6th floor. There you have the possibility to visit the executive lounge. There you get your breakfast in the morning, coffee the whole day and fingerfood in the evening. Until 11 p.m. you get different sorts of wine, beer an other driks for example Glenfiddich Whisky. And all those things are included if you book an executive room. The other advantage of this lounge is, that you dont have to eat your breakfast with for about 100 other guests because this lounge is only for the guests of the 6th floor. With the bar "Trader Vic's" you have a good opinion to go out in the evening directly in the hotel. There is also a business center and a pool. The roomservice is very good and the prices are high, but fair for such an hotel. All in all a hotel with very good service with old looking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location !”
Reviews.Author: mklovesny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over Christmas. Check in was smooth and friendly. The room was really big. We had reserved a deluxe room plus which basically is a junior suite. The room had one king bed and a small living room with sofa and chair and writing desk. It had a big flatscreen tv. The bathroom was the best part: it was really big! almost as much as the living room! it had 2 sinks and separate tub and shower. All the usual great toiletries were there as well as bathrobe and slippers. The room also had a small dressing area with lots of space for luggage and clothes and a safe. All in all the hotel was really pleasant. Did not have any problem during the stay and personnel was really nice. Dined at Mark Brandenburg Restaurant and loved it. Both the food and the decor! Did not have the buffet breakfast since we do not usually eat a lot at breafast and it costed 23 euros. For 12 euros you can have a small continental breakfast in the Wintergarten which we found more than enough. Anyway there are plenty of bars near the hotel as well as a Starbucks a 5 mins walk away. What we enjoyed most was the location, right on Gendarmenmarkt in the centre of Berlin. I would definitely choose this hotel again for my next Berlin visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kkeating
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a six-day stay in Berlin, Germany, over Christmas. We chose to stay at the Hilton, since we were able to cash in some of his award points for two free nights, making it a great deal for us. The Hilton is located in Mitte (the center of Berlin) and was within walking distance of most of the sights we wanted to visit (i.e. the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Fernsehturm or TV Tower and the Pergamon Museum). The hotel is rather conveniently located right next to the U-bahn stop Stadtmitte, so getting to other areas of the city was very easy. We were also pleased to find that the hotel was adjacent to the Gendarmenmarkt and not far from the Opernpalais and Alexanderplatz, since all three locations hosted lovely Christmas markets. Our room in the Hilton was on the fifth floor, facing the interior courtyard. This didn't provide us with a great view, but it was very quiet. The room was not very big by American standards but it was large by European standards. It was nicely furnished, though it didn't really seem up to a five-star rating. The room had a king size bed with two twin-size comforters (typical for Germany), a desk and desk chair, an armchair, a nightstand, a dresser, a large flat screen tv, a small minibar and a small closet. The bathroom was very nice (it may have been recently remodeled, as it seemed nicer than the rest of the room), with a shower/tub, a toilet, a sink with lots of counter space to put your toiletries and heated mirrors that didn't fog up during showers. One of my only complaints about the room was the lack of a thermostat. There was a dial on the wall that you could use to turn the heat up and a fan on, but we could never get the room to be much cooler without opening the windows. Even with the dial set to its lowest setting and the fan off, my travel clock said the room was still 74 degrees. The hotel is large, with a beautiful and spacious lobby area and several restaurants and bars. We ate at the Mark Brandenburg Restaurant on Christmas Eve, and the food was excellent. It was a fixed 4-course menu, but we enjoyed every course. The restaurant was large, but it had a nice elegant but cozy atmosphere. The breakfast buffet was very expensive (24 Euros per person), but it was quite hearty with lots of options. We ate a big breakfast there every day, and it kept us full through dinner-time. The staff at the hotel were all very helpful and courteous. Every single person we spoke with (from reception to housekeeping) was incredibly nice and happy to help us with anything we needed. I'm not sure that the hotel merits its five-star rating, but I would recommend it to a friend and/or stay there again if I could find a good deal. The great location and excellent staff made our stay there very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “ok but some problems”
Reviews.Author: coniston
Reviews.Content: stayed for weekend, good points are location and excellent staff. the breakfast was also wonderful. down side. the bed was awful, far too soft and gave no support. it actually made trying to get to sleep difficult. also our room 8004 stunk of smoke. we should have complained but by the time we had arrived were too tired. i left the window open most of the time to try and get rid of the smokey smell.also there was very high step in and out of the shower which some people might find difficult.. for a luxury hotel i felt a bit let down

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Top Secret Hotel Hstorical Gendarmenmarket”
Reviews.Author: C0rnish_Maid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the "5 Star" Hilton Berlin for two nights to experience the Christmas Markets and celebrate my friends birthday. We we allocated room 5088 which looked over an internal courtyard so very quiet but no view. Most importantly the room appeared clean and well maintained. The size of the room was adequate but the luxurious touches I would have expected from a hotel of this standard were in my opinion poor. There were robes (not very large, soft or fluffy) and slippers, small, thin towels (in fact my friends had to share a towel). King size bed (plus added squeaky springs) with two single duvets. Minimal tea & coffee (one cup per day) and mini bar. The room also had ironing facilites. There was a pool and spa but I don't have experience them. With last minute it was room only so no idea what the breakfast was like. The redeeming point was the hotel's location which was superb. If you can get a room at a good price I would stay here but if paying rack rate there are other hotels with far superior facilities available in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Central location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Chewster
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Berlin Hilton for its cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff, and for its' central location to most of the historical sites. While we were there the annual Marathon run was on and the transportation above ground was virtually shut down for the afternoon so we took a hop-on-hop-off bus tour in the morning, took a boat cruise in the afternoon, and walked for the balance of our time . The only negatives that I have are with all of the Hilton Hotels - exorbitant internet rates and breakfast buffets. Unless you take the buffet there is no other breakfast option and coffee and an egg with toast is not worth 22-25 Euros. Obviously it is not enough to keep us away, we just find alternatives outside the hotel. One we enjoyed was the Lowenbrau restaurant around the corner from the Hilton complete traditional German foods and with a full band on Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in good central location”
Reviews.Author: Mia K
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to a lot of the main sites in Berlin- 15-20 mins to the Brandenberg Gate. Across the street is the amazing "Fassbender & Rausch" chocolate shop. A couple of blocks walk to some beautiful shops. Plenty of places to eat nearby. The rooms were lovely & had tea/coffee making facilities but no iron/ironing board. Staff we friendly & efficient. The minibar was somewhat unusual in that as soon as an item was picked up/moved you were charged if you didn't put it back within 30secs!. As mentioned before internet connection was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the best of berlin”
Reviews.Author: yvrldn
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights over Easter and was very impressed as I don't normally stay with the bigger chain hotels. got a deal with expedia so it was great value for such a lovely place and ideal location. We walked all over this area and enjoyed the luxurious accommodation and friendly service. Didn't eat here though as there are so many great places nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at too many nicer hotels. Nor would I generally spend over 300 Euros for a hotel (thankfully my Mom was paying for this stay). At the risk of sounding like a line from "Cabaret," everything about this hotel is beautiful. The lobby is beautiful. The restaurants are beautiful. The rooms are beautiful. The pool and gym are are really beautiful. Even the breakfast is a feast for the eyes (as well as the stomach). We ate at both restaurants. The Trader Vic's puts our Trader Vic's here in Emeryville to shame, both with respect to decor and food quality. The German restaurant, Mark Brandenburg, simply had the best German food I've ever had (and I've been to Germany about 8-9 times). One needs to swipe ones room cards in order to access the floor rooms. The pool/gym area is open 24 hours/day. As a Gold HHonors member, we received an upgraded room, which was very quiet, comfortable, and large, but had no view (windows open to an inner courtyard). My complaints about the hotel: (1) Charging 22 Euros/day for lousy (off/on) internet service is a bit outrageous given the very high room charges, (2) Temperature difficult to adjust in the room (no thermostat), and we couldn't get it quite cool enough for comfort, (3) Rather thin towels for a luxury hotel, (4) Needless step to the beds; great for tripping on (especially for an older person such as my mother) So a very nice hotel, albeit not a great value. I would go here if money were of no object (and not otherwise).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good”
Reviews.Author: Boysaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a junior suite which was great with a gorgeous bathroom, but breakfast was not included and the room cost 414 Euros per night which is far more that any other hotel I've ever stayed in. However the views from the room of the cathedral and the Gendarmenmarkt were fantastic! U-Bahn right outside the door and the tour bus stops very nearby. Try the sweet hot chocolate in the cafe above the chocolate shop next door, it is to die for! Had dinner in the Mark Brandenberg restaurant which was excellent, also in Lutter and Wegner across the road, similarly good with an amazing choice of wines. Last night ate in Diverso, an Italian along the road, which was good. Loved Berlin, all the history and the atmosphere were just what I imagined.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: stefliri
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at the Hilton Berlin for our honeymoon. This is really a great hotel, excellent staff, nice room and the bed was so comfortable! In the room there was plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. In terms of location, it was ideal. A great hotel that we will definitely consider visiting when we go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Liberton
Reviews.Content: Spent four excellent nights. Because hotels were busy spent a bit more to get an Executive room and it was well worth the additional cost. Staff on the Exceutive floor could not be faulted and every aspect of the hotel exceeded our expectations. Perhaps the best hotel stay we have ever had. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “great location, incredible views”
Reviews.Author: hhl
Reviews.Content: Hilton – stay on executive floor (great lounge) get a room overlooking the Gendarmenmarkt (beautiful day and night). They also have a nice pool and spa but the children at all hours in the pool will drive you to the nudist spa area, which is pretty nice and child free. There are several good restaurants near by. We loved the eastern sector location with it's delightful walking areas and proximity to museum island and gorgeous neo-classical architecture. The Potsdammer Platz is very times square with it's glass and steel highrises and heavy traffic. The rooms are very comfortable - typical Hilton decor - nice sheets and good showers. The concierge was very helpful with local restaurants. The lounge had a great breakfast and offered drinks through the day including wine, etc. at evenings with appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SpicySugar
Reviews.Content: Room was not luxurious but the whole package worth more than the price! Standard Hilton service was already very pleasant and professional. - Fantastic location: right in front of one of the most famous tourist attractions and next to an Underground station. - Complimentoray Evian water - Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries Always love Hilton when travelling

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton is a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: CAbonbon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a superb location - right near several museums, Checkpoint Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate. Wonderful shopping was right around the corner and well within an easy walk. Also many great restaurants are only a very short walk away. The Hotel was clean, courteous and typical for a large chain hotel. Internet use was a bit of a hassle since you have to use their business center and they charge you first but if you are not over your useage amount you get your deposit back. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and had many, many selections with attentive staff. I would stay here again when visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Berlin”
Reviews.Author: simonsfar
Reviews.Content: Superb, staff very helpful. Lovely Fitness and Pool area. My Son a I loved every minute here in the Pool Area. The Rooms are very nice, Breakfast superb, and we could go on and on and on. TRY IT..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: becannon
Reviews.Content: We (4 adults, 2 rooms) stayed at the Hilton Berlin for 3 nights in July 2008. We had an absolutely wonderful experience, I would highly recommend the hotel. We arrived at the Hilton around 9 am and were able to check in but not able to access our rooms yet. The front desk staff was quite apologetic even though we knew this would be the case. We were upgraded from a basic room to a room that faced the Gendarmenmarkt and had wonderful large windows that opened so we were able to hear the outdoors concerts going on there. We each had a double room that consisted of a medium sized bathroom that was very clean and well maintained. There were two large closets on of which had shelves and a safe, the other had room for hanging clothes. There were slippers and robes available although the robes had definitely seen better days. There was a queen size bed with soft bedding and pillows. The room also had an arm chair and a desk. The room had a mini-bar which I did not like because it was one that charged you whenever an item was moved. The room and the whole hotel were very cleaned and well maintained (much different from many of the other Hiltons I have stayed in). The staff at the front desk was very polite and helpful. The concierge desk was the biggest downfall in service as there never seemed to be anyone there to help you. One time we waited about 15 minutes for help there one day and no concierge actually showed up to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Berlin Hilton, and it has to be one of the best Hiltons I have stayed in for a long time. I attended a conference at the hotel and found the hotel excellent in every way. The room was in one corner on floor 4 and was larger than most, with a double aspect. Room was very clean and well appointed. Food in the restaurant and during the conference was also excellent. Location: Easy walk to Checkpoint Charlie and Brandenburg Gate easy.....and I see from other reports it you walk many other places. Taxi to/from Tegel airport is about 25 mins and cost less than 20 Euros. Got access to the Exec Lounge on floor 6, as he was on that floor. This was also very well appointed with free bar and food.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: KYBALION
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel generally, and only one Hilton in Berlin. Located in a very good area and near to must see places. Very nice staff, especially check-in/check-out was very good at the reception. A bit old but clean, nice rooms. I have Honors Gold VIP card, but not upgraded or not offered anything else. I'd recommend to stay at this hotel if you compare price/qulaity with other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: anigbr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor but it was quite dissappointing. I was traveling by myself and I was given a two single bed room, I asked if they could change it for a one bed room and they told me that they couldn't change the category of the room, I replied that it wasn't a change of the category but a change of beds and they told me that they would try but it would be difficult; of course I didn't have my room changed. There were broken things in the bathroom too like a hanger. On the other side, cleanliness is not good either. I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in a row and they didn't change sheets during my whole stay (inacceptable for a hotel that claims to be 5 stars). Breakfast is good and plenty of choice but the service once again left a lot to be desired; the rest of the people were escorted to the tables and served coffee and freshly squezzed orange juice, I had to order it several times. All in all I would give this hotel 3 star; the only good thing about it is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, great 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemmybear83
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff very friendly and hepful. Don't miss the chocolate shop next door! U Bahn station and paving outside the front of the hotel is currently going through some renovations, but don't put you off a great hotel to stay at Berlin

Reviews.Title: “luxury in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: scamp190
Reviews.Content: one word, WOW!! to anyone, i recomend this hotel. right on the gerandmarkt, 1 minute from the U-bahn and so central. 5 minutes on foot to checkpoint charlie, 10 minutes on foot to the brandenburg gate and the reichstag. spent four nights there from 26th March. a perfect location and quiet and discrete. room on 2nd floor was soo quiet. staff so efficent. we booked via expedia and got this hotel cheaper than many 3 star 1970's tower block hotels in the "old west". the east is definately the best part of the city. i have never walked so far and done so many sites on my visit. one of the best cities in the world. the food in Berlin is soo cheap, I definitely recommend Lemke by Haskerhof station. didn't have the hotel breakfast but went to cafe Einstein next door and Kamp cafe round the corner. please go to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: orangeIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hilton Berlin for three nights. from 03/04/08. Arrived at SXF airport late at night so got a taxi to Hotel. Cost 32.00 Euro Nice driver Good price. The Hotel I found to be Very Good. Spacious and Luxurious Lobby. The room was a bit on the small side,but not too small and was well appointed.This Hotel is within walking distance of most of the Historical sites in East Berlin, ( Brandenberg Gate etc., ) If you like a bit of old world charm, and modern Hotel, then you will like this Hotel ( I loved it ) The only reason I did not give it Excellent ,,was the every early check out ,, 11.00

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixPooh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two nights in the Berlin Hilton and could not offer more praise for both hotel and staff. Everything was just as you would expect from a major first class hotel, efficient but friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the swimming pool was excellent. This hotel is very well placed for sightseeing and don't forget to visit the fantastic chocolate "cafe" next door.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: oneval
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Berlin & spent 3 excellent nights in the Hilton. Our room was large, comfortable & very clean. The hotel was very quiet, no late night noise.The staff were tremendously helpful, couldnt do enough for you. Above all else the location is excellent. there was a stike on that affected the buses & the underground, not a problem when staying in the Hilton as all the major sites are within walking distance. Also very handy for great resturants. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_Mallon
Reviews.Content: Visited with two fiends in February. The hotel is well located and the staff very friendly. There are some very nice restaurants near-by. The city bus tour stops across the square and is worth a trip on. Inside the hotel the decor is fine and there is attentive service from waiters. The rooms were clean and had a good view. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: R0se50
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Hilton . The breakfast was second to nothing we had ever seen before,glass of fresh juice handed to us on our arrival and then shown to our table with great views as well. The rooms were clean and very spacious couldnt fault room service. Having an underground station 20 yards from the front door was also a bonus overall we would always stay at the Hilton on our future visits to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased with this”
Reviews.Author: Commodore
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here on a city break, my first in Berlin. I really landed on my feet with this one. The public rooms are lovely, the staff friendly and helpful, and the rooms comfortable. The location is good too, very central to downtown Berlin and with convenient access to public transport. A couple of restaurants provide good eating choice and if they don't cut it for you, there are plenty of bars and coffee shops nearby. Only one minus springs to mind: the breakfast, though good, is rather pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Flaesb
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel located in what was East Berlin exceeded my expectations in every respect. The lobby is large and luxurious, the staff was helpful and respectful beyond compare. My room was a corner suite on the executive floor, with a large living area which included a desk, sofa, two chairs, coffee table and large flat screen TV. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and marble. The bedroom had a large very comfortable king sized bed and another television. Breakfast was included (fortunately, since it is 23 Euros if not included...ouch!) and consisted of a large array of food from which to choose. The location of the hotel is ideal, with an underground stop directly across the street. The views of the plaza across from the hotel are spectacular. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Berlin - Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Striker69
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in the Berlin Hilton over the New Year's holiday with my girlfriend. The hotel is well placed in the city, a few blocks from the Brandenberg gate and the Reichstag. If you like high end shopping you'll love staying here. The rooms were comfortable. We were staying on points and were entitled to a room upgrade and free breakfast. There was no upgraded room when we arrived on New Year's Eve as the place was full, so we were placed in a regular room. The room was normal by European standards (small to an American) but the bed was comfortable and the design of the room was excellent. We were very comfortable. We were able to upgrade our second night in to a suite on the Executive level. The room was very large and comfortable, although the bed was less comfortable than in the previous room. THe Executive lounge was much better than most of the lounges I have experienced in the United States, but the breakfast spread was not nearly as elaborate as the hotel breakfast buffet, which was outstanding, The breakfast buffet was pricey (US$30!!! each), but was as good as or better than your average Champagne Sunday brunch in the States, which is similarly priced. There are more reasonably priced restaurants very close to the hotel. In fact, there is a department store food court less than a block away. The staff and service was outstanding. I speak German, but most of the staff spoke outstanding English, which was great for my girlfriend. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Repetaed visits”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: In 2007 I stayed three times here with a total of 22 nights. I find this hotel a reliable value and would join the other reviewers about this place. I especially found house keeping helpful, polite and being very motivated. The turn down service (on request) was less reliable, though some of the staff did a very good job (otherwise turn down did not include emptying paper waste baskets or cleaning glasses, but just and only opening the bed and closing the curtains). What I found a bit annoying was not being welcomed as a regular guest, returning for several years. Maybe this is due to my lost gold status in 2007 (which I gladly regained by now). Instead I was told (for the second time) that their computer system has changed. It will recognise me as a frequent guest at my fourth stay in that hotel. In my mind previous data should be retained and not simply deleted when it comes to customer relations. We have been to the restaurant Mark Brandenburg twice, good service and quality, though not outstanding. And we have been to Trader Vic's on Christmas Eve. It started with a waitress that did not listen to our ordering. It continued with only one starter (we shared) instead of two. We ordered white wine by the glass and had to insist on two other staff to have it (while the hot starter was waiting at our table). One of the main dishes was not cooked to order. The table was not set correctly (which should be in such a place) and the red wine was out of sight, as well. We did complain and after that the restaurant manager got involved and ameliorated the situation. But the restaurant experience was already spoiled. Though having been a frequent guest and satisfied so far, I personally would look for an alternative among the abundance of good hotels in Berlin due to my somewhat frustrations after all (Swissotel, Palace and Intercontinental are outstanding hotels, but there are many more alternatives). But if you should prefer a Hilton for other reasons, this will be a reliably choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: TwoHavlesofCoconuts
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Berlin is a great choice for either business or pleasure. It is a solid 4 star by American standards (which are higher than European standards). I stay there on business. The staff is very professional and efficient. The rooms are very clean. Service is excellent. The breakfast buffet is a bounty of tasty choices. The surrounding area is made up of high end shops. Mass transit just outside bldg. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights for a conference taking place in the hotel. The conference was really well organised by the hotel, the staff very friendly and the buffets always replenished. Check-in/Check-out was utmost efficient. Both took only 1 minute. The room was of good size, with all the necessary amenities, bathrobes and slippers, wifi connection, wake-up clock, etc. The bathroom was rather small in size with only a small shower, not a bathtub. I think it's because we were on the 8th floor, under the roof, because there seem to be rooms with a large bathroom with bathtub. Breakfast buffet was excellent, with à la minute cooking for eggs. Apparantly you could order also pancakes and waffles, but I must have missed that. Lunch in the restaurant was of good quality and service was great. Apart from the conference facilities I didn't use much of the other facilities apart from the lobby bar, which is rather impressive, although perhaps lacking in atmosphere. The hotel is conveniently located in the City Centre, called Mitte, near the best shoppingstreet in Berlin! Recommendable for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was just fine”
Reviews.Author: P_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We, a Scottish couple, decided to visit Berlin for four days and after reading positive reviews regarding the location of the Hilton, we decided to opt for that. On our arrival, we discovered that the hotel had overbooked and that there was to be no room there for our first night. We were a bit annoyed because the location of the hotel had been our primary reason for booking. We were asked to have one night in the Intercontinental and come back to the Hilton for the remainder of our stay. The Intercontinental was fine and on our return to the Hilton I have to say that the staff could not do enough for us. We had a room upgrade and a variety of gifts, free dinner, etc, to apologise for our inconvenience. The staff and in particular, Doreen the acting front desk manager were all superb and truly went out of their way to make our stay more special. Breakfast choice was great, only slight criticism was the room where you have breakfast, sort of reminded me of a works canteen but that aside, choices were good and plenty of food available. Overall, you could do a lot worse than to go to the Berlin Hilton as the location is absolutely spot on for the underground, shopping and sightseeing and of course at this time of year there are a few Christmas markets within walking distance. All in all, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: drb671
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews prior to arriving at the hotel to help manage expectations. Overall, this hotel has some of the friendliest staff of any hotel I have ever stayed. The hotel entrance and main lobby are very nice and grand. I was greeted a friendly desk person who advised I am in the Exec Floor. She promptly handed me a key to access the elevators and I checked in on that floor. I had read and it is true the hotel hallways, which are endless, are drab (green carpet and gray stained panels). My room had a nice bathroom and it was spacious. I had heard the rooms were small, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had friends staying at the Radisson, although their hotel was much newer and modern, the room was significantly smaller than mine. I had nightly turndown service as well. On one note, the hotel housekeeping staff are aggressive. They would be waiting for me to depart in the mornings around 8:00 am or so and get started cleaning. If you stay be sure to use your privacy door tag. The one bad experience I had was at Trader Vic's. The only thing I can contribute it to is just poor management. There were 3 people working this huge restaurant besides the 2 bartenders. The bartenders sat their half the time while the rest of the staff sat people, checked coats and served food. Cocktails and appetizers took an exceptionally long time. Again our server was very friendly, but just overwhelmed. I would highly recommend staying, although the rack rate seemed steep. I stayed on points, so the value was nice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reliable service”
Reviews.Author: Victoria S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a city break trip. Took me ages to decide which hotel to stay in while in Berlin, but eventually plumped for this one as got a great rate through Expedia, and I figured I wouldn't go far wrong with a Hilton. I was right. Location was superb - literally right next to Stadtmitte U-Bahn - and on the side of a beautiful square (we paid a bit extra for a view and it was worth it). No issues with noise being on the street side of the hotel. Room impressively large and very clean. Bathroom very modern although our shower seemed to do something odd after about 5 minutes of being in it, i.e. the water pressure would drop to the point where there was no way I was going to get the shampoo out of my hair! We didn't have breakfast included and didn't visit the buffet (have to admit I flinched at the 23 Euros price tag). There are loads of cafes nearby where you can get something yummy. We did eat at the Mark Brandenburg restaurant at the hotel though and that was very good. All in all, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Living up to Hilton expectations”
Reviews.Author: apspartan
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hilton Berlin in June. The hotel has a great location just above a U/S bahn stop. The hotel provided the same Hilton reliability that I expect. The room was very nice with a small balcony over looking the Gendarmenmarkt. We were given breakfast coupons for each morning which really helped out since the dollar is so weak versus the euro. The selection and quality of food was also very good. I would absolutely recommend the hotel for the location and its quality. Note: If you are taking the S/U Bahn to this hotel get off at Stadtmitte. The station can be a bit confusing, but one of the several entrances/exits comes up directly in front of the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nothing special about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tortoise_n_Hare
Reviews.Content: Stay - 4 nights / 4 days. Location – Located just off the Gendarmenarkt (square that has the concert hall, and the German and French Cathedrals). Easy walk to the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag and Check point “Charlie”. Room – Room was OK, we had a corner suite so we had plenty of room, and bathroom was typical smallish hotel fare. Food – Breakfast – Only had breakfast on the last day – good spread, fresh and presented well. Dinner at Trader Vics – Again OK, it was nothing to write home about. We had much better meals at the surrounding cafes/restaurants. Staff – Reception desk staff were fine, the concierge that we went to see about finding a laundry mat was a bit of pain in the rear, he sent us to the right suburb but the wrong street, it was around the corner and across the road. Overall – This is a typical businessman’s / conference hotel. Anyone looking for something a little bit special should look elsewhere, its location was it’s main attraction to us.

Reviews.Title: “bizpro”
Reviews.Author: bizpro
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyable. As Senior Hilton VIP we were upgraded to one junior suite and one normal Quen room on the excutive floor. The staff everywhere was very helpfull and polite. The rooms were spotless; the bathrooms were small but efficient use of space allowed to have a nice soaker tub. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the lounge treats were generous, including free liquor. Due to extensive construction work in Berlin it was a bit challening to find the hotel. (Herz at Tegel did not provide clear instruction) The location is great. There is only one suggestion: provide onions and capers for the smoked salmon =). If booked early, rates can be as low as 50% off and in general Gold & Diamond members will be upgraded so I would gamble on a room rate without breakfast. Compared to other hotels the rates are normal for the location but services exceed the standard of other hotels in the same category.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Nick_From_Manchester
Reviews.Content: It’s a typical Hilton, ideally located within walking distance of the main sights with Checkpoint Charlie just 3 minutes walk away and the underground station (Stadtmitte) directly outside the door. I recommend you buy an underground pass from the airport on arrival, to cover the days of your stay. Breakfast was fantastic, a generous choice for all palates, so take the breakfast option when you book. There are also many good quality restaurants close to the hotel. The pool is a nice bonus, remembering that this is a city centre hotel, not a leisure spa. Rooms are as you would expect from a Hilton: TV, expensive mini-bar, safe, room service, bath robes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “We're going back it was that good”
Reviews.Author: Aramanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton for 4 nights just before Easter and very impressed. Arrived on overnight train from Paris and called in at 8.30am to drop off bags but were taken straight to our room by seriously friendly staff and were unpacked and on the streets by 9am. The hotel is an old Four Seasons and a cut above your normal Hilton. We travel a lot - business and pleasure, everything from basic bed and breakfasts to five star hotels - and the bedroom ticked all the boxes as did the public areas - don't really understand some of the more lukewarm comments about this place! Breakfast is a more than generous buffet spread and sets you up for the rest of the day - well worth trying to book the pay in advance bed and breakfast package. Pool more than adequate - remember it's not a leisure centre it's a hotel. View over Gendarmarkt while you're eating breakfast is fantastic - very difficult to beat this breakfast room location. Just around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie and the old East Berlin has got to be the best part of Berlin to stay in. And an underground right outside the hotel front door - well one of them - just be careful to go up the right steps - there's loads of exits from one underground and you can end up several minutes walk away from the hotel if you choose the wrong one! We're going back in October with our 14 year old daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - surprisingly accommodating to families.”
Reviews.Author: masewell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Berlin Hilton over a long weekend in August. Location was prime as it is within walking distance of the main sights (Brandenburg Gate/Checkpoint charlie/Berlin Wall/Pergamon/Altesmuseum) and there is a U-bahn train station (Stadtmitte) directly across the street from the hotel. (We took this to the zoo). Breakfast was traditional Hilton fare. There are many nearby quality restaurants as well. Room was quiet. The pool and workout room were adequate and always available. Had one meal at the Trader Vic's in the hotel which was nice and they brought out special drinks (sans alcohol) for the kids . This was a little pricey - you can find better elsewhere but the little ones were pooped after all the walking. The rooms were clean/spacious and they provided us interconnecting rooms with a baby cot for our youngest. (we got the second room @ 1/2 price from the Hilton family deal.). Would stay here again if I go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great City & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Si-Em
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions now, Berlin being a favourite and convenient holiday destination of ours, especially around Christmas time when the seasonal markets, one of which is conveniently located across the road from the hotel, add an extra bit of cultural flavour to an already wonderful city. The hotel is also right next to a u-bahn (subway) station. We have always found the Hilton Berlin to be an exceptional hotel, on our first visit we were given a room with a beautiful view of Gendarmenmarkt, they remembered this and we were given the same room on our second visit. The staff are always helpful and friendly. The rooms clean and spacious with a feeling of luxury about them. The spa is wonderful. The location is perfect, and you get a rubber duck. Would we return to this hotel? Yes, and we have done on many occasions, we can't imagine staying anywhere else in Berlin, a truly top-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bickley
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I have stayed at this hotel and I am pleased to report that my satisfaction remains just as high as on the first visit. The hotel gives a luxury experience at a reasonable price. The staff were very welcoming and efficient. and our room was immaculately clean and comfortable. The hotel is located in a smart square within easy walking distance of Unter Den Linden, the Reichstag, the Brandenberg Gate and many of the other tourist attractions. The breakfast is the usual good Hilton buffet, and there are several restaurants in the hotel: this time we used the (German cooking) Mark Brandenberg and the (Italian) Fellini. Both were satisfactory and reasonable value for money. (In my book, Germany is not a great country for gourmet cuisine). I will certainly go back to the Hilton when I next visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hotel's Charges”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveler48
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well-situated near main attractions, restaurants and shopping. Room was clean, well furnished and serviced promptly. The room air conditioning had a hard time keeping up with the warm temperatures in Berlin. The restaurant (Mark Brandenburg) was over-priced and had marginal food. The hotel was overrun with meetings and groups. There was an unexplained, additional Hotel charge of 8 Euros that appeared on my credit card statement. I challenged the charge in an e-mail to the hotel, and followed up with e-mails to the Hotel (twice), HiltonHonors and Hilton corporate. None of these Hilton entities have had the courtesy of even responding (no less reversing this charge) in over a week.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ricbre_98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Hotel - Berlin for 3 nights during the last week in May. This hotel is a great place to stay! The room was extremely neat , clean, and nicely decorated. It had TV and a nice king bed. The bathroom had a shower in the tub. No complaints about the room. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. Other reviews allude to not-so-good experiences with the concierge, but to us he was extremely helpful. Everyone spoke execellent English and no-one seemed to mind my less-than-perfect German. As one reviewer stated, the lobby bar/lounge is a good place to sit, relax, and have a bite to eat or a glass of beer. The Mark Brandenburger Restaurant was excellent. There is a Trader Vic's Restaurant in the building, too, that was really good. In both these restaurants the staff were terrific. I didn't see a cafeteria in the lobby area that one reviewer described. Most of Berlin's sights are within walking distance from this hotel, so my car wasn't needed during our stay. My wife and I made use of the U-bahn to visit the Berlin Zoo, an entrance to the U-bahn almost directly outside the front door of the hotel. My wife and I will definitely stay at the Hilton Hotel - Berlin again if we ever come back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “I gotta get back there!”
Reviews.Author: BavarianChicagoUSA
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Hilton in April 2002 and chose it for its' proximity to the Deutsches Opera, a ten minute walk away across the beautiful square. We weren't expecting to spend much time in the hotel but we did want to have a view of the Dom from our bedroom and wanted to be high off the street to minimise traffic noise. A room on the Executive floor offered this. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and its' staff and so... Four years later we were lured back to Berlin by the opera and there was real no decision making involved in choosing a hotel.The famous Adlon is historic and was considered for a moment but the location is too busy with sightseers. We had no dislikes regarding the Hilton and were in fact looking forward to staying there again. We arrived at 6pm after a spirited drive from Frankfurt. A valet parked the car-there is a fee for parking in the attached garage which I think was 17E a day, while we went straight to the 6th floor check-in. This takes place in the cosy Club room where breakfast, afternoon and evening snacks are served. Drinks-spirits, wines, beer and sodas are complimentary and after a 350 mile drive I needed one (or two).The young women who staff the Club are real ambassadors for the hotel-friendly efficent and super-industrious. The hotel room is not huge but we don't have parties or practice our golf swings in them. They are tastefully decorated with lots of wooden furniture and comfy beds with duvets. Extra pillows were ordered as were extra hangers and they appeared within minutes as did our luggage. The windows are ingenious and open in two different planes so one can lean out and get some fresh air or puff on a cigarette. Outside the window was Berlin! It had hardly seemed to matter on our first visit as we were there for the opera and the city was almost immaterial but having seen it once and warmed to it, massive construction notwithstanding, we were excited to see more of it and revisit places that had been so pleasurable before (Spreewald and Sans Souci come to mind) I had kept the rental car for day trips outside the city as the countryside around Berlin is peaceful and easy on the eye. You can rent a car from Sixt in the hotel. I use Hertz booked in the USA. For exploring the city though it makes little sense to drive and have the hassle of finding parking. The U Bahn at Stadtmitte station in front of the hotel is the way to go-it's fast and cheap and easy to find your way around. Trains are safe and clean. Like every hotel I stay in there are parts of it I don't get time to visit and parts of it I might camp out in. Spa? What spa? However the bar area in the lobby is a great place to people-watch while having a cold beer or a tasty snack. Service is attentive and the quality of the food is exceptional for a bar area although the menu is short. The spaghetti a la carbonara had me licking the plate but I don't think anyone noticed.
