At night this bar has a small jazz combo with vocalist but the volume level doesn't impede conversation unless you ask for a table next to the drummer. It is not a hang out for people under 40. If you are from the USA don't expect to be tipping like you do back home. This ain't New York. I have seen criticism of the concierge in these reviews but I have no cause to compalin as they were always helpful and efficient. If someone gives you good or bad service it is good to identify them to management so their behaviour can be rewarded or corrected. They arranged a great city tour for us and helped us with directions and reccommendations. They are kept constantly busy. There is a handy little gift shop in one corner of the lobby where one can buy snacks and drinks for the room if you are mini-bar shy like me. I haul my beers and wine from a supermarket a block away. Next to that shop in the corner of the lobby is a cafeteria where you can load up a tray full of hot German food for way less than 10E including beer and dessert. Great value if you are pressed for time and just need to refuel for more sightseeing. As mentioned in many reviews the Gendarmenmarkt area is well served by good restaurants- Aigner, Lutter and Wegner etc but the food and service in the Mark Brandenburger just off the Hilton lobby is hard to beat. Both Aigner and Lutter waitstaff show visible disappointment when you don't order a bottle of wine and both are tight rooms where the noise level registers DIN on the scale. Brandenburger is a civilised Oasis in comparison and the view of the German Dom at night reminds you that you are in that very special city called Berlin. In summary-the Hilton is a large, busy city hotel. I consider it very well run from my two visits there. The rooms may not be spectacular or huge but they are tastefully appointed and everything performs its' function. Huge bathrooms can be found in Las Vegas. A few words spoken in German will get you even friendlier service. No one on staff was ever less than helpful despite their workload. Room service was prompt and tasty but there are many dining options just outside your door and in clement weather (Easter onwards) many restaurants around the square set up tables in the plaza. Much of your sightseeing can be done on foot from the Hilton. If you like museums or tour boat rides there is hardly any city better equipped to indulge you than Berlin. There are airplane rides in vintage aircraft and seaplane tours if you want to see Berlin's vast sprawl from the air. I can't wait to go back as there is so much to still to be scratched off my list! Bavarian ChicagoUSA

Reviews.Title: “Quality in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Steve-G23
Reviews.Content: A high quality hotel with a good standard of accommodation and facilities, and in an excellent position for walking to most of the main sights of the city. The rooms are only medium sized but recently refurbished, well equipped and very comfortable. Any item taken out of the mini-bar is automatically charged to your account via electronic detectors - even if you put it back; but the reception staff are very understanding if you make this mistake. In fact the staff were always very courteous and helpful. My only gripe is that breakfast, at 23 Euros, was pricey - excellent quality and loads of it, but if you only want or can only manage a small breakfast then it is not good value, and we found really good breakfasts with personal service at local cafes (notably Mohring and Dressler).

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Langvale
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location in East Berlin near all the major sites. We didn't eat in the Hotel as there are some great restaurants close by ( including a great place to have breafast at a fraction of the price charged in the hotel called Mohring).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: I&P-7
Reviews.Content: There is little to add to the other reviews, except to confirm the GREAT location of this Hilton Hotel. All the museum are within short walking distance, public transportation in front of the hotel (also the busstop for the direct bus to airport Tegel is nearby), nice shops around the corner and good restaurants nearby. The only time I used the public transportation, was to go to West Berlin (Kudamm). But I prefer East Berlin and the Hilton is perfectly situated. I would definately return here! Look around for a good price. I paid only EUR 100 per room per night, including breakfast! I booked this through an travel agent. I also approached the Hilton directly, but they couldn't offer my this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: halopes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at his Hotel for a week during February. The year before I had stayed at the Marriott – which I consider the best hotel ever - so, first thing I needed while checking in at the Hilton was to acknowledge I could be disappointed because I wouldn’t be stayed at the Marriott. Nevertheless, the Hilton revealed itself as a great experience and a great hotel. I stayed at the business floor. The rooms are big, clean and beautiful. Bathroom was extremely clean and functional, although not very big. Breakfast was amazing. Staff was helpful and always had a smile. Lobby is huge and there was live music at the bar. Berlin is an amazing city and I would return to this Hotel without blinking my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myself-7
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day visit to Berlin. I was accompanying my husband on a business trip and had 2 mornings enjoying the city. We lodged at the Hilton. This hotel is in a very central position just a few steps away from a leading shopping street and also opposite the magnificent Gendarmenmarkt. The service was excellent. Hotel boasts of 4 restaurants varying from the typical german cusine to the polynesian, complementing these is the Fellini restaurant which is an Italian restaurant. Room was of a decent size and included all amenities, including a coffee maker, bathroom was well equipped and maintained. We had an early morning check-out and we did appreciate a little buffet breakfast at the lobby specially prepared by the hotel staff for those who leave before 6.00 (normal breakfast time). All in all I think that this hotel has hilton quality complemented by german standards. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: FirstClassTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked a duplex suite oon 6th floor for 5 nights. The room was rather tired and the furniture was stained. Staff in the Executive Lounge were very good but for the price paid (EUR355 per night), should have stayed at the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Exceptional Staff, Best Location”
Reviews.Author: JF_Cork
Reviews.Content: What can I add to what has already been said ? Well the hotel is very good maybe in need of a smarten up and rooms even on executive floor are on the small side but of a high standard. However that's a small price to pay for the perfect location and exceptional service and staff, especially on the executive floor. The pool and sauna area (extra charge) were superior. Would defintely recommend it and will stay there when back in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a New Year trip.”
Reviews.Author: ladyinspain
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Dec 29th and although given a smallish room facing the inner courtyard - it was a comfortable and well appointed room. I booked directly with Hilton on the internet and got a good advance rate. This hotel has the best possible location for the Christmas Gendarmenmarkt, Friedrichstrasse shopping and not that far from the party at the Brandenburg Gate on New Year's Eve. My mind still divides Berlin into East and West and I found this MITTE part of the former East has turned into the most interesting and lively part of town now. We ate once in the hotel restaurant - very good - but then avoided the expensive breakfast and New Year parties and went across the street to Mohrings for almost all other meals. Don't miss the chocolate store on the corner and music concerts in the Hall in front of the hotel. The subway stop StadtMitte is in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “happy at the hilton”
Reviews.Author: airtool
Reviews.Content: lucky to miss the fog and delayed flights by a few days so arrived at tagel airport 27 dec 2006 ok ,wife and i prefer to use public transport if possible so purchased tickets at kiosk at airport exit and caught bus 128 to kurt schumacher platz metro stop,using same ticket caught u6 metro to stadmitte(all for under 5 euro for 2 people).at stadmitte use walkway and head towards u2 line,only then at this point go up the steps and your infront of hotel. yes it is cumbersome to lug bags up steps,i personally think it should be a european law that all members of parliment utilise public transport, then and only then, will they place a metro/rail stop at every airport. we felt that stadmitte was a clean and prosperous area of berlin,the bars and restaurants were smart and spotlessly clean (has in most places we went). found berlin on occasion to be a trifle high on some prices, over 5 euro for a coffee,4.5 euro for half a beer,but the quality was allways there in the service etc which was nice. went on the city tour which was good, 20 euro's which enabled you to get your bearings,did see better buses and various prices ,our bus i think had allready served one life in london?. would suggest to join onto a city guide,ours was very lively and informative,took us to brandenburg gate,luftwaffe office,checkpoint charlie,and hitlers bunker i you wish, go by metro to } friedrichstr /oranienburgerstr. a little dated tram area. younger element bars and restaurants potsdamer platz. ultra modern restaurant/shopping area kurfursten damm/wittenbergplatz very busy area,markets,shops and so much more, plus the large shopping mall, kadewe very impressive !! don't miss on your doorstep, lafayette at franzosische str q 250/7 very impressive shopping mall. also across from the hotel, the gendarmenmarket. very pretty enclosed area. has for the hotel well pleased,other than the automated charge if you moved an item in the fridge ? i had allready paid for the hotel so will not be so forthcoming with a card number when asked for one on arrival next time.still waiting on return to see if they have charged us ,for moving a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but not the usual Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: London69
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin to celebrate a friend's birthday and to visit the Christmas Markets. In terms of Berlin and the proximity to all the great sites/areas - this hotel is in a very good position. Berlin is one of my favourite cities - and you cannot go wrong in this location. The breakfast was also ok; lobby bar is fair; but the Trader Vics bar lounge is awful, kitsch and tacky. The reception is vast and anonymous. Check in efficient but inflexible re: early arrivals. We had to walk around town and come back after 4pm. Not great when you want to have a quick shower and freshen up. The rooms are very basic. Very few have a decent view i.e. over the beautiful square to the front. Our first two rooms were so small and so musty, we complained. We got upgraded, but to our horror, the bathroom in the suite had not been cleaned satisfactorily. In fact, it was pretty dirty. So - great location, basic rooms. Not the usual Hilton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Berlin !”
Reviews.Author: chiliyo
Reviews.Content: I was here for the World Cup 2006 and this is one great place to stay in Berlin. The front desk was very receptive considering that SAS had lost my credit card while testing the self-checkin kiosks at CPH airport so I showed up at the front desk of the Hilton w/out a credit card. I hope this is the last time this happens to me. The breakfast buffet is wonderful and it was included in my rate. The subway station is just steps from the main entrance of the hotel. I will stay at the Hilton Berlin anytime.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel....Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: hedgehog
Reviews.Content: We are making a regular thing of going to Germany to visit the Christmas Markets. Last year, Cologne, this year Berlin. We love the whole gluhwein, street entertainment, Christmassy ideas, so duly booked we arrived in Berlin on 24/11/06. Yes, we got it wrong!! The markets in Berlin did not officially start until 27/11/06 so we were a bit bothered that Berlin would have little to offer us for the 3 day duration. How wrong we were. Berlin is fantastic, so too is the Hilton Berlin hotel. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left we all agree that we felt very welcome and that nothing was too much trouble. We were very happy with our rooms overlooking the Gendarmenmarkt - indeed we could see the Christmas market being set up- we thought the bathrooms were spot on and although the rooms themselves could do with a tiny bit of a makeover they were very comfortable and spotless. Breakfast was too die for. We sat for 2 hours enjoying the food and the company. On the Sunday we were treated to speciality coffees by a management trainee who seemed very eager to please us (Or everyone) The situation of the hotel is perfect. We walked everywhere but appreciated that if we need to go further afield the u-bahn station was right outside the door. Berlin is brill! Loads to see. The Reichstag building is stunning (and free). History surrounds you and you cannot help but become immersed in it - that surprised me, I learnt more in one weekend than any number of history lessons at school. To go back after a long day of sight seeing, good eating and drinking to the Hilton Berlin was the icing on the cake... Great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1704
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights from Saturday 12 to Tuesday 15 August 2006 in a double room. We arrived at the hotel very late at night after an evening flight and found the hotel easy to get to by public transport from the airport by train into the city centre and then a ten minute walk. The staff at receiption allocated our room quickly. Our room was spacious, well equipped with all the usual hotel furnishings with ensuit bathroom. The room was very comfortable, clean and tidy. A lovely touch was the chocolates (more like mini cakes) and the bottled water in our room on arrival. Our room overlooked an internal courtyard. We booked the hotel on a room only basis and prefering to spend our time outside sightseeing are unable to comment on the wide range of facilities available at this large hotel. The location is wonderful. It is next two an underground station with two train lines and the main attractions of the city are a comfortable 15 - 20 minutes walk. We would be very happy to return here or to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant berlin”
Reviews.Author: DM66
Reviews.Content: we recently took a city break in Berlin with a couple of friends and stayed at the Hilton. What a great choice it turned out to be. We booked executive rooms which were excellent. Tanya at check in couldn't have been more helpful.The lounge itself was the perfect spot for some r and r after a long day siteseeing. It looks out over the pictureque Gendarmenmarkt with its beautiful cathedrals. Breakfast in the lounge is continental style however the buffet style breakfast in the main dining area was fantastic. We also had dinner in the Brandenberg restaurant attached the hotel which was superb. The waiting staff were attentive and the food was delightful. Full marks for service. The hotel is in our opinion ideally located for exploring the city and the Stadmitte U Bahn station is literally at the front door. We would highly recommend this hotel. We would also recommend the Berlin walking tour which commences from Starbucks beside the Brandenberg Gate at 1.15pm each afternoon and the Refugium restaurant beside the french Cathedral on Gendarmenmarkt. Superb food and excellent service. Try hiring a bike for the day and tour the sites, Tiergarten is a must. The concierge arranged them for us and in a matter of minutes they were at the front door and only 15 euro for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: platinum1
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed 3 nights at the Berlin Hilton. Since we are Hilton Diamond members we were upgraded to the Executive level which gave us free internet access, breakfast, drinks and snacks. We were given a choice between breakfast in the concierge room or at the buffet in the restaurant. We tried both while we were there and both were great. However, the buffet in the restaurant had more selections. The hotel is clean and in a good location. It is in walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie and other sites. The staff at the Hilton that I encountered were all very nice. We took the Fat Tire Bike tour one day and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lasttri4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night break at the Hilton Berlin. Rooms clean, comfortable and good size. All facilities even bathrobe and slippers. Very friendly conceirge and staff. The hotel is in a very central position - PERFECT- for a stay in Berlin. Highly recommended. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A city hotel to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Kilkerran
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 5 days here and felt it was everything one could have expected. The reception staff were first rate and made you feel really welcome.We had a lovely room overlooking the Gendarmenmarkt. As for the staff on the Executive floor nothing was too much trouble,they were friendly, helpful and at breakfast one morning I commented that the hot choices did not have bacon that day, the hostess immediately said she would order some and it came within minutes. The hotels location is great with a Underground station right outside the hotel, and within walking distance of a number of places to visit. Our only regret was that we did not stay long enough, as there is so much to see and do that 5 days was not enough. Well done Hilton Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kam1974
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, perfectly placed to see all the sights of Berlin only a short walk away from Unter den Linden, Brandenburg gate etc. Nice quiet part of the city too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: BirdieS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for a long weekend break. We chose it because of the Hilton brand and also the central location of the hotel. The hotel itself is nice and modern. It has all the facilities you would expect from a large hotel chain like the Hilton. Rooms are of a good size and bathrooms are well-equipped (Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries). Our room had a view of the Gendarmenmarkt. It is located in a somewhat quiet part of town and apart from Checkpoint Charlie, you have to take a U-Bahn or bus to get anywhere (unless you're a keen walker). The U-Bahn station is right outside the hotel though, so not a problem. Service however was poor. We arrived at 12pm and were told that our Executive Room wouldn't be ready till 1. That was fine, as their earliest stated check-in time is 2, so we were invited to chill in the Executive Lounge and they offered to look after our luggage until then. Trouble was, the room wasn't ready at 1, or at 2. The staff at the Executive Lounge (when the desk was manned - rare) were unfriendly and a bit difficult. OK, we had to wait. But they cleared away the snacks in the Executive Lounge at 12 and didn't bring out any fresh ones. Then at 2.30 the room was ready, but the luggage got lost in their system and we had to wait another 2 hours for that. So we lost an afternoon of sight-seeing which was a shame. We were supposed to get free water every day and a free newspaper; that never happened. When we complained on check-out, the receptionist unhelpfully said "well what do you want me to do about it?" Not the sort of service you'd expect from the Hilton. We complained to the manager, who offered to take a miserly 10 euros off the total bill - they needn't have bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Crinkly
Reviews.Content: Hilton Berlin - Mohrenstrasse - great location, friendly staff, check in a bit of a shambles , arrived early and had to wait a while - not a big deal , nice bar - have a drink and chill while you are waiting!. Did not find the grumpy concierge mentioned in another review ! staff are all very nice and helpful. rooms have aircon - badly needed this week ! Berlin was hot. Room very clean - not a huge size but good by European standards. great buffet breakfast included. U Bahn ( underground trains )directly outside hotel Recommend this hotel , if you want a bit of comfort - this is the one for you ! Michael Dublin

Reviews.Title: “below average Hilton”
Reviews.Author: summermom8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Berlin in early June, 2006. We are Diamond HHonor memebers, so were upgraded to executive room on the executive floor. The room is average looking, with motel style bedspread and decrative pillows. underneath the bedspread, there are 2 twin comforters, which is wierd for a queen room. Bathroom is average looking too, with mold smell. concierge not helpful and very unfriendly. executive floor representitives are cold too. we stayed at many hiltons worldwide, we feel this is a below average hilton, especially for it's service. we defintely will try other hotels when we return to berlin next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Penny.M
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break to Berlin, staying at the Hilton Hotel. We could not have chosen a better hotel for our trip. We had standard rooms, that were very nice. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. The best thing about the beds is the immaculate white bedding including the duvet cover, therefore no reused bedspreads which I really dislike in hotels. The bathroom was sparklingly clean and had everything you could need. The complimentary slippers, robe and rubber duck were a nice touch. We found the staff at reception very pleasant and helpful although the concierge was a bit grumpy. The location is fabulous for sightseeing, you step out of the hotel to face the Deustcher Dom, the square has lovely cafes and restaurants, the U-Bahn is right nearby and the open top bus tour stops a few feet away. We had booked on line through the Hilton Website and had opted for room only, on arrival we were told about the 22 euro breakfast but opted to walk to a lovely nearby cafe and sat outside to enjoy an excellent breakfast for 7 euros. On Sunday we returned for the brunch buffet which I believe is a tradition with Berliners and cost 9 Euros plus drinks- excellent and an experience in itself. If you are on a big stag or hen type do then this is not the hotel for you, it is not rowdy and there is no wild nightlife nearby, but for small groups, families and couples it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: YiannisP
Reviews.Content: The hilon in berlin is one of the best hotels I have visited. The Location is very nice since you can visit all the sites by using the metro or just walk your way around. In a few words --very good and value for your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: josie33
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard room - clean,quiet and very comfortable.Hotel amenities were excellent.Staff very friendly.Restaurants - food great and a nice selection.It is in a very good location - tube stop right outside or walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie.A great choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Liora
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. We upgraded to a room with a view of the Gendarmenmarkt for 20 euros a night. The room is avarage in size. Double bed quite narrow and not as comfortable as expected . Bathroom nice but on the small size. Breakfast was included in our deal, yet each morning they asked for our signature as on their records it appeard as if our breakfast was exclusive. I would have assumed that after their first mistake they'll sort their records but it never happened. Unfortunately i fell ill on our last day there. I sent my husband to get me an Aspirin until we buy one at a pharmacy. They couldn't spare us one and said they didn't have any. Is this the Hilton? There is no turndown service as well. Apart from all the above the location is great, central and quite. Breakfast is delicious and plentiful. I believe the hotel is best for business clientle.

Reviews.Title: “The Executive Floor is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: traveller1959
Reviews.Content: Although the building is not a masterpiece of architecture the Hilton is an excellent choice, especially if you book one of the Executive rooms. Certainly, the Hilton has the best location in town; and from the Executive floor you also have the view of Gendarmenmarkt with the two Cathedrals. The Executive rooms are very large. But the best is the clubroom. There are comfortable seats and sofas in a nice quiet atmosphere. High-quality breakfast is served (included in room rate) as well as cakes, pastries, sandwiches and all kinds of drinks (soft drinks, sparkling wine, white and red wine, liqueurs, spirits) at no extra costs. You may save a whole meal this way or get appetizers. After all, paying for the Executive floor may be an economical decision. I also highly recommend the restaurant "Mark Brandenburg": It serves refined regional cuisine made of local products like Havel perch or Brandenburg pork. The Hilton has a typical hotel bar; however I always choose to walk 100 yards to Lutter & Wegner for a late-night drink.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in March. All amenities associated with a good business hotel at an above average level. Excellent fitness room, though I did not use the spa/pool. Great location, a short walk to shopping & many popular points of interest (e.g. Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, museums, checkpoint charlie). U-bahn station directly in front of hotel for easy transport to attractions farther west. Note breakfast and 24-hours of Internet use were an extra 22 euro each.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Satisfied1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights at this hotel and could not fault it. We had an executive room which gave us access to the executive lounge where there were complimentary drinks, cakes during the afternoon and a buffet in the evening. There was also a continental breakfast although we chose to eat in the main restaurant. The breakfast was superb lots of choice and we ate one night in the Fellini Italian restaurant where the food was excellant and good value. The staff were very friendly and not OTT as is often the case in hotels of this rating. Our room was nicely furnished very bright and overlooked the square. I had e-mailed ahead to request this always advisable with any hotel and it has not failed me yet. They also gave my wife a birthday cake and card for her birthday whilst we were there which was a lovely touch. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of checkpoint charlie, the Rechsteig etc and there is a metro station opposite. I would definately recommend this hotel and will certainly return if I ever visted Berlin again. I think the people who made the previous negative comments must have been staying in a different hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SueGrogan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Year. The location of the hotel is excellent. The rooms are fine but nothing spectacular. The staff were friendly and helpful. If you can get a good room rate I would recommend this hotel, especially due to its great location. Berlin is an excellent city, well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Berlin - It's fine...”
Reviews.Author: JMD1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for two nights at the beginning of December. The hotel is well place in the city, with a U-Bahn station right outside the door; this makes everywhere very easily accessible. We were also right next to one of the Christmas markets, which was handy. The hotel itself is fine; it is a fairly typical four star hotel, without any features to really set it apart from the rest. The lobby is grand in it's size, and is quite impressive. We were given a smoking room, and the staff were happy to move us to a less smelly non-smoking room when we asked. Throughout the stay the hotel staff were all very helpful and polite, and of course all spoke excellent English - as usual compounding my misery at being uni-lingual! Our room was clean and of a good size and the bathroom was very nice. The minibar was well stocked and priced at the usual OTT rate! The swimming pool and gym were both excellent, although I still cannot quite believe they charge 11 Euros for a Sauna... Breakfast was excellent, with a very good selection of food and very good service. The hotel restaurants looked nice, but we did not try them. Probably my main criticism with the hotel is it's size - the hotel is very big and somewhat impersonal. Checking out at 10.55 on Sunday was not a good plan, as all six queues for reception were enormous - this could of course have been avoided by getting up earlier or doing express check out. The last time we stayed in Berlin (June), we stayed at the Ritz Carlton & paid a similar price to the Hilton; on our next visit we will certainly go back to the Ritz Carlton, as it is that bit more special.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and in my experience at least as good as the standard of any other Hilton I stayed in. Location is central and very quiet considering where it is. All the facilities are exceelent. Breakfast and other quality of food were very good. I would happily stay here again next time I am in Berlin. The low ratings by some reviewers, I feel reflect personal specific problems they encountered rather that a poor quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look past the lobby and it's worn & tired”
Reviews.Author: DogInTow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton 22-23 Aug and was disappointed. It looks quite grand from the outside and the lobby "sparkles" however once you enter the hallways to the rooms it is decorated with gray paneling that you would find in a "rustic" hotel in the po-dunk USA. The carpets are worn as well in the hallways and chances are slim you'll have a view of anything except neighboring buildings. The paneling carries through to the rooms...although they are nicer than the hallways. One plus was that I was able to check in around 1200 w/no issues. Location is ok, but not great. I e-mailed the hotel before I left to find out what public transport goes to the hotel from the train station and they sent me the directions straight off the internet (driving directions and directions from the airport). Stadmitte metro stop is literally right in front of the hotel. If I go back to Berlin I won't stay at the Hilton. Must put a plug in for Fat Tire Bike Tours though...wonderful way to spend the afternoon/evening.
